or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) being in command at any post or on the march and receiving a complaint that any one under his command has beaten or otherwise maltreated or oppressed any person, or has committed any riot or trespass, fails, on proof of the truth of the complaint, to have due reparation made as far as possible to the injured person and to report the case to the proper authority; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) designedly, or through neglect, injures or loses or fraudulently or without due authority disposes of his arms, clothes, tools, equipment, ammunition, accoutrements, any means of transport or other necessaries or any such articles entrusted to him or belonging to any other person; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) malingers, feigns or produces disease or infirmity in himself, or intentionally delays his cure or aggravates his disease or infirmity; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) with intent to render himself or any other person unfit for service, voluntarily causes hurt to himself or any other person; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) commits extortion, or without proper authority extracts from any person carriage, porterage or provisions; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) designedly, or through neglect, kills, injures, makes away with or ill-treats or loses his horse or any animal used in the public service; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) disobeys the lawful command of his officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q) plunders, destroys or damages any property of any kind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r) being a sentry, sleeps at his post or quits it without being regularly relieved or without leave; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(s) designedly or through neglect fails to apprehend an offender; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(t) designedly or through neglect fails to perform his duties; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(u) neglects to obey Battalion orders or company orders or any other orders or rules made under this Ordinance or commits any act or omission prejudicial to good order and discipline;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by a Summary   Court, be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Summary Court may take cognizance of an offence punishable under this section either of its own motion or on complaint by any person and shall follow such procedure as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any person aggrieved by a judgment of a Summary   Court may prefer an appeal,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in the case of a superior officer, to the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman, to the Inspector General of Police.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Departmental proceedings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) Subject to such rules as the Government may make under this Ordinance, in the case of superior officers, the Government and in the case of subordinate officers and Armed Policeman, the Inspector General of Police or any other officer authorised by him in this behalf, may, at any time, award any one or more of the following punishments to any officer or any Armed Policeman whom he finds to be guilty of disobedience, neglect of duty or remissness in the discharge of any duty, or of rendering himself unfit to discharge his duty or of other misconduct as an officer, or an Armed Policeman, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) dismissal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) removal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) compulsory retirement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) reduction in rank or grade;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) stoppage of promotion;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) forfeiture of seniority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) forfeiture of pay and allowance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) forfeiture of increment in pay;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) fine of any amount not exceeding one month's pay;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) severe reprimand;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) reprimand;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) extra guard, picquets, patrol or fatigue duties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) confinement to lines for a term not exceeding one month with or without drill, extra guard, fatigue or other duties:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the punishments mentioned in clauses (l) and (m) shall not apply to officers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An officer or an Armed Policeman against whom action under sub-section (1) is required to be taken or against whom any inquiry is to be made may be placed under suspension-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in the case of a superior officer, by the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman, by the Inspector General of Police.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), an officer or an Armed Policeman against whom action under that sub-section is required to be taken shall have the right to conduct his own defence or to have assistance of any superior or subordinate officer of his battalion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any officer or any Armed Policeman aggrieved by any action under sub-section (1), may prefer an appeal within thirty days of the passing of the order or the action taken,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in the case of a superior officer, to the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman, to the Inspector General of Police.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Imprisonment of persons convicted and dismissed</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Any officer or Armed Policeman sentenced under this Ordinance to imprisonment for a period not exceeding three months shall, when he is also dismissed from the Force, be imprisoned in the nearest or such other jail as the Government may, by general or special order, direct, but when he is not also dismissed from the Force, he may, if the convicting Court so directs, be confined in the quarter-guard or such other place as such Court may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Inspector General of Police may delegate, by order in writing, to such extent and in respect of such subordinate officer or such Armed Policeman as he may think fit, the powers conferred on him by any provision of this Ordinance, except sub-sections (4) and (5) of section 8 and sub-section (3) of section 9, to any superior officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall be against any member of the Force for anything which is done or intended to be done in good faith under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) organisation, classification and distribution of the Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) appointment, control, supervision, condition of service, transfer, suspension, removal, dismissal and punishment of the members of the Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) grant of leave, absentee or acting allowance to the members of the Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) places at which the members of the Force shall reside and the duties to be performed by them;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) description of arms, ammunitions and accoutrements to be furnished to the members of the Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) rations and supplies and other necessaries to be provided to the members of the Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) accommodation and messing facilities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) drill, musketry and signalling;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) preparation and maintenance of accounts and the manner in which such accounts shall be audited;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) general administration of the Force and security measures; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) generally for the efficient conduct of the Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Inspector General of Police, may, from time to time, make such regulations and orders not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for matters relating to collection and communication of intelligence by the members of the Force, prevention of abuse or neglect of duty and for such other matters which he may consider necessary for rendering the Force efficient in the discharge of its duties but are not required to be provided for by rules.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “and commencement” were omitted by section 2 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The dash, brackets and figure “-(1)” were omitted by section 2 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (aa) was inserted by section 3 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (dd) was inserted by section 3 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Clause (hh) was inserted by section 3 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Sub-sections (3), (4), (5) and (6) were added by section 4 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Clause (aa) was inserted by section 5 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Clause (bb) was inserted by section 5 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Sections 6A, 6B, 6C and 6D were inserted by section 6 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
527	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ASIAN REINSURANCE CORPORATION ORDINANCE, 1978 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ASIAN REINSURANCE CORPORATION ORDINANCE, 1978 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXVII OF 1978).[17th July, 1978]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the implementation of the Agreement establishing the Asian Reinsurance Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS the People’s Republic of Bangladesh is a signatory to the Agreement establishing the Asian Reinsurance Corporation and it is expedient to provide for the implementation of that Agreement and for carrying out the obligations of the Republic as a member of that Corporation and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Asian Reinsurance Corporation Ordinance, 1978.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context ,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Agreement” means the Agreement establishing the Asian Reinsurance Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Corporation” means the Asian Reinsurance Corporation established by the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Financial Provisions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Subscription of the shares of the capital stock of the Corporation shall be arranged by the Government pursuant to provisions of Article III of the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Sadharan Bima Corporation participates in the purchase of the Capital stock by an arrangement made under Article III of the Agreement, it shall be paid its proportionate share of any sums received from the Corporation which are related to subscriptions made towards capital stock.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Certain provisions of the Agreement to have force of law</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law, the provisions of the Agreement set out in the Schedule shall have the force of law in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to take steps to discharge obligations and liabilities under the Agreement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Government may take all such steps and make all such arrangements as may be considered necessary to enable it to discharge its financial obligations and other liabilities under the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source  : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
528	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXII OF 1976).[4th August, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of an Agricultural Research Institute for carrying out research for improved agriculture through scientific management of land and water, evolution of improved varieties of various agricultural products and development of pest management practices of such products and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “assets” include all rights, powers, authorities and privileges, all property, movable and immovable, including cash balances, bank deposits, reserve fund, investments and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property and all books of accounts, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        “Board” means the Board of 1[ Management] of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (iv) “Council” means ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ??????????? ?? ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ???);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv a) “Director-General” means the Director-General of the Institute;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        “Fund” means the Fund of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi)       “Institute” means the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vii) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and incorporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall establish an Institute to be called the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute for carrying out the purpose of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of properties, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Institute shall be located at Joydevpur in the district of 3[ Gazipur].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute may establish offices at such other places as the Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Subject to the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction, administration and supervision of the affairs of the Institute shall vest in a Board of 4[ Management] which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things that may be exercised or done by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Certain directions etc of Council to be given effect to</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ 6. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, the Institute, or any of its functionaries shall, in relation to the affairs of the Institute, ensure that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any direction issued by the Council under or in pursuance of the provisions of section 8 or 14 of ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ???) is complied with;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any recommendation made or advice given by the said Council under or in pursuance of the said provisions is given effect to:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where, in the opinion of the Institute, it is not possible to give effect to such recommendation or advice or any part thereof,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the Institute shall, within seven days communicate its opinion with reasons therefor to the Council; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the Council may, after consideration of such opinion, modify or revoke its earlier recommendation or advice, or may issue fresh recommendation or advice on the same subject:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the recommendation or advice so modified or issued afresh, as the case may be, shall be deemed to be a direction under clause (a) and shall be complied with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6A. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Director-General, who shall also be the Chairman, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) two eminent scientists, one in any social science and the other in the field pertaining to the speciality of the Institute, from outside the Institute, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) a representative of the Council, to be nominated by it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) a representative of the Department of Agricultural Extension, not below the rank of Director, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the Directors of the Institute, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) two senior scientists of the Institute, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) two representatives, one from among the farmers and the other from among the Non-Government Organisations (NGO's) performing functions similar to those of the Institute, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) two representatives, one from the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture and the other from the Finance Division of the Ministry dealing with finance, not below the rank of Deputy Secretary, to be nominated by the respective Ministry or Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-in-charge of Administration of the Institute shall act as the Secretary of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Tenure of membership, resignation etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6B. (1) The members specified in clause (h) of section 6A (1) shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of their nomination:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such members may resign their membership in writing addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall cease to be a member, if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        dies; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) being a member specified in clause (h) of section 6A (1)-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         resigns his membership under the proviso to sub-section (1) of this section ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        his tenure expires under sub-section (1) of this section ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       remains absent, without permission of the Chairman, from three consecutive meetings of the Board; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is an undischarged insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) has been, on conviction for a criminal offence involving moral turpitude, sentenced to imprisonment for a term of not less than three months or to a fine not less than five thousand taka and unless a period of two years has elapsed since his release or realisation of the fine, as the case may be, a person so sentenced shall not be eligible to be a member.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The functions of the Institute shall be to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        approve the course of study in broad outlines;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        undertake research to ensure a stable and productive agriculture through scientific management of land and water, evolution of new varieties of various agricultural products and development of appropriate technology and pest management methods;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) provide the farmers with the information necessary for carrying out their farming business efficiently;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) set up research centres, sub-stations, project areas and farms in different regions of the country for carrying out research on various problems of agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) carry out demonstration tests or trial-runs of new varieties of crops and their management practices;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) publish annual reports, agricultural manuals, monograms, bulletins and other literatures relating to crop research and the activities of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) train research and extension officers in the improved technology of crop production;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) provide post-graduate research facilities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) organise seminars, symposiam and workshop on selected problems which may afford specialists from different research Institutes and stations opportunity to exchange ideas and be acquainted with the recent advancements in agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) perform such other functions as may be necessary for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be convened by the Secretary of the Board, in consultation with the Chairman, at least once in every quarter of a year but may also be convened as frequently as may be necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) At least fourteen days' notice shall be given for convening a meeting of the Board and such notice shall specify the date on which, and the time and place at which, the meeting shall be held, but emergency meetings may be convened on twenty-four hours' notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman, and in his absence, 6[ a member elected for the purpose by the members present], shall preside over the meetings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Three members shall constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All matters at a meeting shall be decided by the votes of the majority of the members present and voting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) At a meeting of the Board each member shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman 7[ or the member presiding over the meeting] shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Director-General</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ 9. (1) There shall be a Director-General of the Institute who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-General shall be a whole time officer and the chief executive of the Institute.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and functions of the 9[ Director-General]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The 10[ Director-General] shall exercise and perform such powers and functions as may be determined by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, the 11[ Director-General] shall, in particular, have power to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        prepare annual budget for the approval of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        arrange for audit of the accounts of the Institute by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) acquire, subject to the budget provisions of the Institute, by purchase or otherwise, properties, movable and immovable, for the maintenance of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) construct or alter any building for, or of, the Institute; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) open, with the approval of the Board, a deposit account with any bank and operate the same as per decisions of the Board from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to borrow, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Institute may, for carrying out its functions under this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        borrow, with the approval by the Government, such money from such source and to such extent as it may consider necessary ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) ask for, and receive grants-in-aid from the Government and, with the approval of the Government, any other agencies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Board shall, by such date before the commencement of every financial year as the Government may direct, submit, in such manner and form as may be prescribed, to the Government, for making necessary provision in its budget, a statement of the estimated receipts and expenditure pertaining to the discharge of its functions under this Ordinance in respect of that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Institute shall have its own Fund which shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) grants made by local authorities; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) grants and aid received from aid giving agencies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Board may, from time to time, appoint such committees as may be necessary to discharge such functions as may be assigned to them by the Board or to assist the 13[ Director-General] in the performance of his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Each such committee shall be headed by a Chairman and shall comprise such other members as the Board may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other members of a committee shall hold office for such period as the Board may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of Advisers, Directors, officers etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ 14A. For the efficient performance of the functions of the Institute-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Government may appoint such number of Directors and on such terms and conditions as it may determine from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Board may appoint such advisers, officers and other employees and on such terms and conditions as it determine from time to time.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public servant, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The 15[ Director-General, Advisers, Directors and other officers and employees] of the Institute shall, while acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any provision of this Ordinance or rules and regulations made thereunder, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall not be deemed to be a “shop” or “commercial establishment” or “industry” for the purpose of the Shops and Establishments Act, 1965 (E.P. Act VII of 1965), the Factories Act, 1965 (E.P. Act IV of 1965), or the Industrial Relations Ordinance, 1969 (XXIII of 1969).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Merger of research components of the Directorate of Agricultural (Research and Education) into the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or in any other instrument, on the establishment of the Institute under section 3 of this Ordinance-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all assets of the research divisions, experimental stations and sub-stations and research projects institutes of the Directorate of Agriculture (Research and Education), hereinafter referred to as the research components of the said Directorate, shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts, liabilities and obligations of the research components of the said Directorate subsisting immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, be the debts, liabilities and obligations of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the services of such officers, advisors, consultants and other staff and employees of the research components of the said Directorate as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct, be placed at the disposal of the Institute and such officers, advisors, consultants and other staff and employees shall, unless otherwise directed by the Government, hold office on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Institute may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “Management” was substituted for the word “Governors” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clauses (iv) and (iv a) were substituted for clause (iv) by section 2 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word “Gazipur” was substituted for the word “Dacca” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “Management” was substituted for the word “Governors” by section 4 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Section 6, 6A and 6B were substituted for section 6 by section 5 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words “a member elected for the purpose by the members present ” were substituted for the words “the Vice-Chairman” by section 6 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The words “or the member presiding over the meeting” were inserted by section 6 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Section 9 was substituted by section 7 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The word “Management” was substituted for the word “Governors” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Director” by section 8 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Director” by section 8 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align:
