officers and employees” were substituted for the words and commas “Director, Officers, Advisers and other staff and employees” by section 11 of the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. XIV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
529	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH BIMAN CORPORATION ORDINANCE 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH BIMAN CORPORATION ORDINANCE 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XIX OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[9th June, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Biman Corporation.WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Corporation for the purpose of ensuring proper operation and development of air transport services and for matters connected therewith; NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Biman Corporation Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Board of Directors of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Corporation” means the Bangladesh Biman Corporation established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Director” means a Director of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Managing Director” means the Managing Director of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Corporation</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Ordinance, there shall be established a Corporation to be called the Bangladesh Biman Corporation for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Head office, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The head office of the Corporation shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation may establish offices at such other places, in Bangladesh and abroad, as the Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Authorised Capital</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5.  (1) The authorised share capital of the Corporation shall be two hundred crore Taka divided into two crore shares of one hundred Taka each:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may increase the authorised share capital of the Corporation from time to time and shall divide the increased share capital into required number of shares of one hundred Taka each.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The paid-up share capital of the Corporation shall, in the first instance, be five crore Taka, and may, with the approval of the Government, be increased from time to time, of which not less than fifty-one per cent shares shall be subscribed for by the Government and the remaining shares shall be subscribed, in such manner, at such time and to such extent as the Government may determine, either by the Government or by the public.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the Corporation may, for carrying out all or any of its functions, raise loans or obtain grants in such manner and from such sources including banks, local or foreign, as may be approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The shares of the Corporation shall be listed on the Stock Exchange in Bangladesh prior to the issue of any shares for public subscription.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Shares to be approved securities</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The shares of the Corporation shall be deemed to be included among the securities enumerated in section 20 of the Trusts Act 1882 (II of 1882), and to be approved securities and approved investments for the purposes of the Insurance Act 1938 (IV of 1938).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Corporation</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) It shall be the function of the Corporation to provide and develop safe, efficient, adequate, economical and properly coordinated air transport services, internal as well as international, and the Corporation shall so exercise its powers as to secure that the air transport services are developed to the greatest possible advantage in the interest of the country.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, the Corporation shall, in particular, have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to acquire, charter, hold or dispose of aircraft;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to operate any air transport service or any flight by aircraft for a commercial or other purpose, and to carry out all forms of aerial work;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to repair, overhaul, construct, recondition or assemble aircraft and other vehicles;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to assemble, manufacture, recondition, overhaul or repair machines, parts, accessories and instruments pertaining to aircraft and other vehicles;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to establish, institute or make other arrangement for the instruction and training of persons engaged or likely to be engaged in any activity connected with or ancillary to air transport service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to acquire, hold or dispose of any property, whether movable or immovable;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to acquire, own, run, manage or participate in the running or management of any other business or commercial undertaking with the approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to do all other things connected with or ancillary to any of the matters referred to in sub-clauses (a) to (f);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to perform such other function as may be assigned to it by the Government by notification in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Management</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Subject to rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction and superintendence of the affairs and business of the Corporation shall vest in a Board of Directors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board, in discharging its functions, shall act on commercial considerations having due regard to public interest generally and be guided by such general or special instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board of Directors</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Board of Directors shall consist of a Chairman, a Managing Director and not less than six and not more than ten other Directors, to be appointed by the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that when there are shareholders other than the Government, such shareholders shall elect, in such manner as may be prescribed, from amongst themselves-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) one Director, when the number of shares subscribed for by them exceeds twenty per cent, but does not exceed thirty-four per cent of the total shares;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) two Directors, when the number of shares subscribed for by them exceeds thirty-four per cent of the total shares.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman, the Managing Director and the other appointed Directors shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An elected Director shall hold office for a term of two years and shall continue in office thereafter until his successor is elected, and shall be eligible for re-election.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A casual vacancy in the office of an elected Director shall be filled by election and the person elected to fill such vacancy shall hold office for the unexpired period of the term of his predecessor:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that it shall not be necessary to fill a casual vacancy in the office of an elected Director for a period of less than three months.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Managing Director</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Managing Director shall be a whole time officer and the chief executive of the Corporation and shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be assigned to him by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Disqualifications of Directors</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No person shall be or shall continue to be a Director who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) is or at any time has been adjudicated insolvent;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) is found to be a lunatic or of unsound mind;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) or at any time has been convicted of an offence which, in the opinion of the Government, is an offence involving moral turpitude;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is a minor; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence granted by the Chairman or, in the case of the Chairman, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed by regulations:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman when he so thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than three Directors including the Chairman shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of the Board each Director shall have one vote, and in the event of an equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If, for any reason, the Chairman is unable to preside over a meeting, it shall be presided over by a Director nominated by the Chairman for the purpose, and in default of such nomination, by such Director as the Directors present may choose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of committees, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Board may appoint such committee or committees as it thinks fit to assist it in the efficient discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Corporation may appoint such officers, consultants, advisers, auditors and employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman or by such Director or officer of the Corporation as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Investment in securities</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Corporation may invest its funds in such shares and securities, or may make such other investments, as may be authorised by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowing powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Corporation may, with the prior approval of the Government or in accordance with the terms of any general authority given to it by the Government,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) borrow money in Bangladesh or foreign currency for all or any of the purposes of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"> (aa) secure the payment of any sum borrowed under clause (a) by hypothecation or mortgage of any aircraft owned by the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) raise capital by the issue of bonds, debentures and debenture-stock.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may guarantee, in such manner and on such conditions as it thinks fit, the redemption or repayment of, and the payment of interest on, any bonds, debentures or debenture-stock issued by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Budget</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Corporation shall, at least three months before the expiry of a financial year, submit to the Government for approval a statement, to be called the Annual Budget Statement; in the prescribed form for the next financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Accounts and audit</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Corporation shall maintain proper accounts and shall prepare annual statement of accounts, including the profit and loss account and balance sheet, in accordance with the accounting principles and established practices and such general directions as may be issued, and in such form as may be prescribed, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Corporation shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance sheet of the Corporation and shall examine it together with the accounts and vouchers relating thereto, and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Corporation, and shall, at all reasonable times, have access to the books of accounts and other documents of the Corporation, and may in relation to such accounts examine any Director or officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditors shall report to the Government on the accounts examined by them and on every statement of account, profit and loss account and balance sheet and in their report they shall state-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) whether or not they have obtained all the information and explanations called for by them;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) whether or not, in their opinion, the books of accounts have been kept and the annual statement of account, profit and loss account and balance sheet are drawn up in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made, and the directions issued, thereunder;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) whether or not such statement of account, profit and loss account and balance sheet exhibit a true and fair view of the Corporation's affair; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) whether or not there is any scope for effecting economy in any matter or for increasing the income of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may, at any time, issue directions to the auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Corporation for the protection of the interest of its shareholders and creditors or upon the sufficiency of the information and other means placed at the disposal of the auditors in auditing the accounts of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) If the Corporation has sponsored any company under section 24 the statement of accounts, profit and loss accounts, balance sheet and auditor's report of such company shall be appended to the balance sheet of the Corporation together with a statement showing the manner in which the profits and losses of the company have been dealt with in the accounts of the Corporation and the provision made for the losses of the company, if any, in the accounts of the company and also of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Reports, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Corporation shall furnish to the Government such returns, reports and statements as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation shall, within six months after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of accounts audited by the auditors under section 19 and a report of the Board thereon together with an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year showing specifically the amount, if any, recommended to be paid as dividend and the amount provided for the reserve funds.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The copies of the audited accounts and annual report received by the Government under sub-section (2) shall be published in the official Gazette and shall be laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Programme of operation, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. The Corporation shall, at such time before the beginning of every financial year as the Government may direct, submit to the Government for approval-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) its programme of operation and development of air transport services and other activities during that year;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the financial estimates for the implementation of such programme; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) its proposal for investment of capital and increase in the strength of its staff during that year and the financial estimates in respect thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Annual general meeting</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) The annual general meeting of the shareholders shall be held at the head office of the Corporation within nine months from the date on which the annual accounts of the Corporation are closed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any other general meeting of the shareholders may be convened by the Board at any time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The shareholders present at the annual general meeting shall be entitled to discuss and adopt or make recommendations to the Board with regard to the annual accounts, the annual report of the Board on the working of the Corporation and the auditors' report on the annual balance sheet and accounts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Reserve fund</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) Out of its profits, the Corporation shall establish a general reserve fund and create from time to time such other special reserve as the Board may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) After making provisions for interest, taxes, bad and doubtful debts, depreciation of assets, maintenance of reserves and any other matter determined by the Board, the Corporation may declare a dividend out of the profits accruing in a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Formation of new companies</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) The Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government, sponsor limited companies for carrying out any of the purposes of this Ordinance, hold shares in such companies and regulate the manner in which the shares thereof may be subscribed by the public.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government, and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine, disinvest any share held by it in any company sponsored by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity of Directors</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) The Chairman, Managing Director and other Directors shall be indemnified by the Corporation against all losses and expenses incurred by them in the discharge of their duties except such as are caused by their own wilful act or default.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Director shall not be personally responsible for the acts of any other Director or of any officer or employee of the Corporation for any loss or expense resulting to the Corporation by reason of the insufficiency or deficiency in value of or title to any property or security acquired or taken on behalf of the Corporation, or by the wrongful act of any person under a liability to the Corporation, or by anything done by him in good faith in execution of the duties of his office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Protection of action taken in good faith</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Government or the Chairman, the Managing Director or any other Director or any officer, adviser, consultant or employee of the Corporation for anything which in good faith is done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Public servants</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. The Chairman, the Managing Director and other Directors, officers, advisers or employees of the Corporation shall, while acting or purporting to act in pursuance of the provisions of this Ordinance, or the rules or regulations made thereunder, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Winding up of the Corporation</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. No provision of law relating to the winding up of companies or corporations shall apply to the Corporation and the Corporation shall not be wound up save by an order of the Government and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Conversion of the corporation into a public limited company</p><p style="text-align: justify;"> 28A.(1) Notwithstanding anything contained to the contrary in this Ordinance, Government may, in public interest, convert the Corporation into a public limited company under the Company Act No. 1994 (Act. XVIII of 1994) ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)].</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by agreement, transfer the entire undertaking of the Corporation to the Company referred to in sub-section (1), on such terms and conditions as may be specified in the agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) As soon as the Corporation has been converted into a public limited company and undertaking of the Corporation has been transferred to the Company, the Government shall notify the fact in the official Gazette and shall, by the same notification, declare that the corporation has been dissolved.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Explanation</strong>:- The word "undertaking of the Corporation'' includes its employees, business, projects, schemes, assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, its properties, movable and immovable, reserve funds, investments, deposits, borrowings, liabilities and obligations of whatever nature.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer of the undertaking of the Corporation under sub-section (2) or the dissolution thereof under sub-section (3), make, by a notification published in the official Gazette, such order as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) The Board may, with the previous sanction of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. (1) The Bangladesh Biman Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 126 of 1972), hereinafter referred to as the said Order, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the said Order-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all property, movable and immovable, including lands, buildings, works, vehicles, workshops, aircrafts, cash balance, reserve funds, bank deposits, investments and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property of the Bangladesh Biman established by the said Order, hereinafter referred to as the Biman, shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all debts and liabilities incurred, all obligations undertaken, all contracts entered into and all agreements made by or with the Biman before such repeal shall be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken, entered into or made by or with the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the Biman before such repeal shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Corporation and may be continued or proceeded with accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all officers, consultants, advisers, auditors and other employees of the Biman shall stand transferred to the Corporation and shall be deemed to have been appointed or engaged by the Corporation on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before such repeal:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government or the Corporation may alter their remuneration or terms and conditions of service whenever it deems fit so to do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer or other matter specified in sub-section (2), make such orders as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Sub-section (1) was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Biman Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XXXII of 1987)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “and” was omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Biman Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XLIII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (aa) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Biman Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XLIII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Section 28A was inserted by section 2 of Bangladesh Biman Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act. No. XXI of 2009) (with effect from 11th July, 2007).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
530	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">  THE BANGLADESH COUNCIL OF SCIENTIFIC AND INDUSTRIAL RESEARCH ORDINANCE, 1978 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> COUNCIL OF SCIENTIFIC AND INDUSTRIAL RESEARCH ORDINANCE, 1978 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO.V OF 1978).[10th February, 1978]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research for the purpose of initiation, promotion and guidance of scientific and industrial research and commercial utilisation and dissemination of the results of such research and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research Ordinance, 1978.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (a) “Advisory Committee” means an Advisory Committee constituted under section 15;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(aa)      “Advisory Council” means the Advisory Council constituted under section 13;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Board” means the Board of the Council constituted under section 7;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Council” means the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “member” means a member of the Council and includes the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Council to be called the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head Office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The head office of the Council shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council may establish branch offices, laboratories, institutes, centres and research establishments at such other places in Bangladesh as the Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The functions of the Council shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to 3[ initiate], promote and guide scientific, industrial and technological research having a bearing on problems connected with the establishment and development of industries and such other allied matters as the Government may refer to it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to establish, maintain and develop laboratories, workshops, institutes, centres and organisations for furtherance of scientific and industrial research with the object of utilising and exploiting the economic resources of the country in the best possible manner;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to give grants-in-aid for specific scientific, industrial and technological research schemes and projects of the Universities as by law established and other research institutions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to adopt measures for the commercial utilisation of discoveries and inventions resulting from the researches carried on by the Council, Universities or by any other research organisation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to establish and award fellowships in areas of research covered by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to collect and disseminate information on scientific, industrial and technological matters and publish scientific papers, reports and periodicals on such matters;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to encourage establishment of industrial research organisations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to maintain contact with scientific, industrial and technological research organisations of other countries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to take out patents and make arrangement for the industrial utilisation of research processes developed in the institutes and laboratories established by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         to establish such libraries, museums, experimental plantations and herbaria as the Board may consider appropriate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        to do such other acts and things as may be necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to 4[ the provisions of sub-section (2) and] the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction and administration of the affairs and business of the Council shall vest in a Board which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (2) The Board shall be subject to the superintendence and control of the Government and, in the discharge of its functions, be guided on question of policy and administration of the affairs and business of the Council by such general or special instructions as may, from time to time, be given to it by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Board shall consist of a whole-time Chairman, 6[ four] whole-time members for the Science and Technology, 7[ Administration,] Finance and Development Divisions of the Council and such number of part-time members, not exceeding four, as may be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other members shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as it may determine and shall, subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance, hold office for a period of three years and shall be eligible for re-appointment for such further period or periods of similar duration as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other members, except the member in charge of Finance, shall be appointed from amongst persons actively engaged in the pursuit of science and technology and eminent in their own fields of specialisation 8[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the condition specified in this sub-section may be relaxed in the case of appointment of part-time members.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman or any other member may, at any time, resign his office by a notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that his resignation shall not take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may, at any time, terminate, by order in writing, the appointment of the Chairman or any other member without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disqualifications of members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. No person shall be appointed as, or continue to be, a member who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is, or at any time has been, disqualified for employment in, or dismissed from, Government service; or(b)            is, or at any time has been, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is, or at any time has been, adjudicated insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        stands declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Chairman and other members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Chairman shall be the chief executive of the Council 9[ and shall, subject to such general or special direction as may be given to him by the Government, be responsible for the efficient administration and proper conduct of the affairs of the Council].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other members shall exercise such powers as may be prescribed and perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be assigned to them by the Board from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Secretary</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. 10[ (1) There shall be a Secretary of the Council who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Secretary shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or assigned to him by the Board and the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Administration of laboratories, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) Each, or a group, of the laboratories, institutes, centres or research establishments of the Council, shall be placed in the charge of a Director 11[ who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Director shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed by regulations or as may be assigned to him by the Board and the Chairman and shall, in discharging his responsibilities, be assisted by 12[ an Advisory Committee].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and at such places as may be prescribed by regulations:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman when he thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Three members shall constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in the absence of the Chairman, by a member authorised by the Chairman in writing in that behalf or in default of such authorisation, by the person elected for the purpose by the members present from amongst themselves.(4) At a meeting of the Board each member shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman or, as the case may be, the person presiding over the meeting, shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) At a meeting of the Board no member shall vote on any matter in which he has any personal interest directly or indirectly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Advisory Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) As soon as may be, the Government shall, after the constitution of the Board, appoint, for the purpose of providing general guidelines to, and overseeing the activities of, the Council, an Advisory Council which shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ (a) the Minister in-charge of the Ministry or Division concerned with the administration of this Ordinance, who shall also be its President;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Chairman, who shall also be its Vice-President;(c) all other members of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        one officer, not below the rank of Joint Secretary, from the Science and Technological Division to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        one officer, not below the rank of Joint Secretary, from the Ministry of Industries to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         one officer, not below the rank of Joint Secretary, from the Ministry of Commerce to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        one officer, not below the rank of Joint Secretary, from the Ministry of Finance to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        one officer, not below the rank of Divisional Chief, from the Planning Commission to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         one person from the University Grants Commission to be nominated by the Chairman of that Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         one person from the Federation of Chambers of Commerce and Industries to be nominated by the President of that Federation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        one person, not below the rank of Director, from each of such research institutions as the Government may decide to be nominated by the Chairman of such institution;(l) two eminent scientists or technologists to be nominated by the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       two Directors of the Council to be nominated by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Such member of the Advisory Council as may be nominated by its President shall act as the Member-Secretary of the Advisory Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The meetings of the Advisory Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Advisory Council shall meet as often as necessary, but at least once in a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The meetings of the Advisory Council shall be convened by its President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Advisory Council not less than five of its members shall be present.(4) The meetings of the Advisory Council shall be held in accordance with such procedure as may be prescribed by regulations and, until such regulations are made, in accordance with such procedure as may be determined by the Advisory Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Advisory Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ 15. (1) The Council may, in such manner as may be prescribed by regulations, constitute as many Advisory Committees as it may consider necessary to assist it, or any one or a group of laboratories, institutes, centres or research establishments under its administrative control, in the discharge of its or their functions and assign to each such Committee such duties as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An Advisory Committee shall follow such procedure as may be prescribed by regulations.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The expenditure of the Council shall be met from out of a fund to which shall be credited-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government and local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) donations, fees, subscriptions and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        income from the properties, investments and royalties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        loans raised by the Council with the approval of the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        receipts from other sources.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Fund of the Council shall be kept in such bank or banks as may be approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowing of money</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Council may, with the previous approval of the Government, borrow money in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Council may, subject to such regulations as may be made in this behalf and the availability of budgetary provisions, create such posts and appoint, on such terms and conditions as it may determine, such officers, consultants, advisers, auditors and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions under this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no post carrying a monthly initial pay of Taka sixteen hundred or above shall be created without the approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Council shall, by such date before the commencement of every financial year as the Government may specify, submit to the Government for approval a Budget, in such form as the Government may specify, for each financial year, showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Board shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as the Government may specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General) in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (2), the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Council and may examine the Chairman or any member, officer or employee of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Auditor-General shall, as soon as possible after completion of the audit, send to the Council his audit report and the Council shall forward it, with its comments thereon, to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Council shall take steps forthwith to remedy any defects or irregularities pointed out in the audit report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Council shall furnish to the Government such reports and statements as the Government may, from time to time, require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of audited accounts together with an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Agreement of technical advice, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Council may enter into any agreement with any person to render technical advice on, or to carry out, any scientific, technological or industrial research or investigation on behalf of that person and charge for such research or investigation such fee as may be determined by the Board:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such agreement shall be entered into with any Government Department or any other organisation under the control of the Government, except upon such terms and conditions and on payment of such fee, if any, as the Government may determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that any such agreement with any foreign agency shall be subject to the approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Discoveries, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. Discoveries, inventions or improvements, if any, made in the processes, apparatus and machineries by any officer or other employee of the Council in the course of his official duty or by any other person working under grant from the Council shall be the property of the Council and may be made available for use to any person applying for them, subject to such conditions and on payment of such fees or royalties or otherwise, as the Board may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Rewards for discoveries, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Where any useful discovery, invention or improvement in the processes, apparatus or machineries has been made by any officer or other employee of the Council or by any other person working on its behalf, the Council may pay to such officer, employee or other person such cash rewards, share of royalty or consultation fee as it may, in consultation with the Government, determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such payment shall be made to a Government servant except with the approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that any power conferred upon it by this Ordinance shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable by such member or officer as may be specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Declaration of secrecy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Chairman, every member of the Board, every member of 15[ an Advisory Committee] and every officer and other employee of the Council shall, before entering upon his duties, make a declaration to the effect that he shall not, except in the discharge of his duty as Chairman, member, officer or employee, or with the previous approval of the Board, disclose any information concerning the work of the Council or the contents of any document in the possession of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. (1) The Council may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dissolution of the existing Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, or in any contract or in any other instrument, upon the establishment of the Council, the Scientific and Technological Research Division Resolution No. I (24)/73-BCSIR, dated the 16th November, 1973, shall stand revoked and the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, hereinafter referred to as the said Council, established thereunder shall stand dissolved, and upon such dissolution,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, and all properties, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances and funds of the said Council and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property and all books of accounts, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all debts, liabilities and obligations of the said Council subsisting immediately before its dissolution shall stand transferred to, and be deemed to be the debts, liabilities and obligations of, the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        services of all officers, advisers, consultants and employees of the said Council shall, notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the terms and conditions of their service, stand transferred to the Council and they shall be deemed to be officers, advisers, consultants and employees of the Council appointed by it on the same terms and conditions of service as were applicable to them in the said Council unless such terms and conditions are altered, not being to their disadvantage, by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Council before its dissolution shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        all rules, regulations and bye-laws of the said Council shall, mutatis mutandis, and in so far as they are not inconsistent with any of the provisions of this Ordinance, continue to be in force until repealed or altered by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clauses (a) and (aa) were substituted for clause (a) by section 2 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (e) was omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word “initiate” was substituted for the word “initial” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “the provisions of sub-section (2) and” were inserted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Sub-section (2) was substituted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word “four” was substituted for the word “three” by section 5 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The word and comma “Administration,” were inserted by section 5 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The colon (:) was substituted for the full-stop (.) and thereafter the proviso was added by section 5 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The words and commas “and shall, subject to such general or special direction as may be given to him by the Government, be responsible for the efficient administration and proper conduct of the affairs of the Council” were added by section 6 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 Sub-section (1) was substituted by section 7 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The words “who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government” were added by section 8 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The words “an Advisory Committee” were substituted for the words “a local committee to be constituted by the Board in such manner as may be prescribed by regulations” by section 8 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 Clause (a) was substituted by section 9 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 The words “an Advisory Committee” were substituted for the words “a local committee” by section 11 of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LII of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align:
