531	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH EXPORT PROCESSING ZONES AUTHORITY ACT, 1980</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH EXPORT PROCESSING ZONES AUTHORITY ACT, 1980</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXXVI OF 1980).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[26th December, 1980]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act for the establishment of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the establishment of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority for creation, development, operation, management and control of export processing zones and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority Act, 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Authority” means the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Board” means the Board of Governors of the Authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Executive Board” means the Executive Board of the Authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Executive Chairman” means the Executive Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “zone” means a place or places to be specified by the Government under section 10 as an export processing zone for the purposes of setting up export oriented industries.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Act, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish an Authority to be called the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">General direction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 3A. (1) The general direction and administration of the affairs of the Authority shall vest in the Executive Board which may, subject to sub-section (2), exercise all powers and do all acts and things as may be exercised or done by the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Executive Board, in discharging its functions, shall act in accordance with the guidance, order and instructions given by the Board of Governors of the Authority from time to time.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head office of the Authority shall be located at Chittagong.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority may establish its offices and branches at such places as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Objects of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 4A. The objects of the Authority shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to foster and generate economic development of Bangladesh by encouraging and promoting foreign investments in a Zone;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to diversify the sources of foreign exchange earnings by increasing export of Bangladesh through a Zone 4[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to encourage and foster the establishment and development of industries and commercial enterprises in a zone in order to widen and strengthen the economic base of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to generate productive employment opportunity and to upgrade labour and management skills through acquisition of advanced technology.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board of Governors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ 5. (1) There shall be a Board of Governors of the Authority which 6[ shall, subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), consist] of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Minister-in-charge of the Ministries or Divisions dealing with industries, commerce, finance, planning, foreign affairs, energy and ports and shipping, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Governor, Bangladesh Bank, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Secretaries of the Ministries or Divisions dealing with industries, commerce, finance, planning, foreign affairs, energy, ports and shipping and internal resources, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) Chairman of the Executive Board, who shall also be the Secretary of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 7[ Prime Minister], or a member, who is a Minister, nominated by the 8[ Prime Minister], shall be the Chairman of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (3) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, include in the Board any person or exclude from the Board any member with approval of the Prime Minister.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5A. (1) The Board-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) shall formulate the policies for operation and management of the Authority and the zones;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) shall review, from time to time, the activities and performance of the Executive Board and the zones;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) may give orders or issue instructions which are deemed appropriate for the purpose of efficient management of the affairs of the Authority and the zones.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The policies formulated, orders given and instruction issued by the Board shall be deemed to be the policies formulated, orders given and instructions issued by the Government and shall be followed accordingly; and they shall not require any formal approval of any Ministry or Division dealing with the matters for their implementation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Executive Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5B. (1) There shall be an Executive Board of the Authority consisting of a Chairman and three other members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman of the Executive Board shall be called the Executive Chairman and he shall be the Chief Executive officer of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Executive Chairman and other members of the Executive Board shall be appointed by the Government and shall hold office on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If a vacancy occurs in the office of the Executive Chairman or if the Executive Chairman is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of his absence, illness or any other cause, the Government shall make such arrangement for discharging the functions of the Executive Chairman as it may consider expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceedings of the Executive Board shall be invalid or be called in question merely on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Executive Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Save as provided in this section, the Board of Governors and the Executive Board shall regulate the procedure for their meetings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All meetings of the Board of Governors shall be convened by the Secretary of the Board in consultation with its Chairman and shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Executive Board shall be convened by the Executive Chairman and shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Board of Governors shall be presided over by its Chairman and, in his absence, by a member of the Board, who is a Minister, authorised by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All meetings of the Executive Board shall be presided over by its Chairman.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Consultative Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ 6A. (1) 11[ The Executive Board shall, in the discharge of its functions, be aided] and advised by a Consultative Committee which shall consist of the following members:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) one member to be nominated by the Internal Resources Division from among its officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) one member to be nominated by the Ministry of Industries from among its officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) one member to be nominated by the Ministry of Commerce from among its officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) one member to be nominated by the Export Promotion Bureau from among its officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) one member to be nominated by the Finance Division from among senior bankers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) one member to be nominated by the Ministry of Industries from among prominent industrialists;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) one member to be nominated by the Government from among industrialists of each Zone;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) Director General, Department of Industries, or his nominee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) Division Chief (Industries), Planning Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) Commissioner of the Division in which a Zone is situated or his nominee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) Chairman of the Water Supply and Sewerage Authority within the area of which a Zone is situated;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) Chairman of Chittagong Port Authority or Port of Chalna Authority to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) Chairman of the body, by whatever name called, responsible for the development or improvement of the urban area within which a Zone is situated;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) Chairman, Bangladesh Small and Cottage Industries Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) one member to be nominated by the Federation of Bangladesh Chamber of Commerce and Industries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) four members to be nominated by the Federation of Bangladesh Chamber of Commerce and Industries, one from among Presidents of Chamber of Commerce and Industry of each division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q) one member to be nominated by the Authority from among the owners or shareholders of the enterprises set up in a Zone;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r) one officer of the Authority to be nominated by it who shall also be the Secretary of the Consultative Committee; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(s) such other members as may be nominated by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 12[ Executive Chairman] shall ex-officio be the Chairman of the Consultative Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ (3) The meetings of the Consultative Committee shall be convened by its Chairman and shall be held at such time and place as may be determined by him.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Consultative Committee shall be presided over by the 14[ its Chairman] or, in his absence, by a member of the 15[ Executive Board authorised by him].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Consultative Committee not less than one third of the total number of its members shall be present.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Post Sanction Clearance Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ 6B. (1) There shall be a committee to be called the Post Sanction Clearance Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Committee shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Executive Chairman, ex-officio, who shall also be its Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Controller of Capital Issues, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Registrar of Joint Stock Companies, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) General Manager, Exchange Control Department, Bangladesh Bank, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) an officer of the Authority to be nominated by it, who shall also be the Secretary of the Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Committee shall assist the Executive Board in matters of registration of companies, capital issues and foreign exchange transactions in respect of, and in all other matters connected with the operational needs of, sanctioned industries in a zone.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Save as provided in this section, the Committee shall regulate the procedure of its meetings:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Committee shall meet at least once in a month.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The meetings of the Committee shall be convened by its Secretary and shall be presided over by its Chairman.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The functions of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The functions of the Authority shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to take possession of land to be acquired or requisitioned by the Government for the purpose of creation and development of a zone;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ (b) to allot land and building-spaces in a zone to investors on sale, lease or on rent and to allow them to mortgage the allotted lands for raising loan from financial institutions or commercial banks;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to provide infrastructure facilities, including buildings, utilities and warehouses;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18[ (d) to process applications for setting up of industries within a Zone and accord sanction in accordance with the guidelines given by the Government from time to time;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to provide customs bonded facilities in accordance with customs regulations for importation into a zone of building materials for construction purposes and packaging materials, raw materials and intermediate goods for the purpose of processing for exports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to allow import of raw materials or semi processed or other goods required for use in the zone and export of semi processed, processed or other goods to be specified by the 19[ Board] in such manner as may be prescribed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to assist in transportation of imported raw materials and intermediate goods in bonded condition and export of finished products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to provide necessary banking facilities within the zone in consultation with the Bangladesh Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to establish liaison with the port, municipal and other authorities to make arrangement for transportation of imported raw materials and intermediate goods on bonded condition and for export of finished products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to sanction employment of foreign nationals in accordance with the guidelines given by the Government from time to time, to posts for which local expertise is not available for efficient running of the industries in a zone;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20[ (jj) subject to the approval of the Government, to enter into any contract or agreement of any kind for the purposes of this Ordinance;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to do such other acts and things as may be necessary to be done in connection with, or conducive to, the performance of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment, etc, of warehouses</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21[ 7A. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, the Authority may, if the Government so directs, set up, maintain and manage public warehouses at any place in Bangladesh to provide customs bonded facilities in accordance with customs regulations for importation into Bangladesh of raw materials, packaging materials, semi-processed goods and accessories required for export oriented industries.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) There shall be a fund of the Authority to which shall be credited-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants and loans from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans from such other sources as the Government may approve;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) proceeds from the land allotted for setting up of industries in the zone;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) rental of buildings leased out to the industries set up in the zone;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) fees and service charges, if any, received for services rendered;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) any other sums not specified accruing to or due to the Authority from any other source.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fund of the Authority shall be used to meet expenditure in connection with the functions of the Authority under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to borrow</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Authority may 22[ * * *] borrow money for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to create zones</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare any place or places to be specified in the notification to be an Export Processing Zone for the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Acquisition of land for a zone</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Where any land or any interest in any land is required by the Authority for any of its purposes under this Act that land or the interest therein may be acquired by the Government under the Land Acquisition Act, 1894 (I of 1894), for the Authority and the land or interest therein so acquired shall be deemed to be required for a public purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to exempt Zones from operation of certain laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23[ 11A. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt a Zone from the operation of all or any of the provisions of all or any of the following enactments or, direct that any such enactment or any provision thereof shall, in its application to a Zone, be subject to such modifications or amendments as may be specified therein, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) The Stamp Act, 1899 (II of 1899);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) The Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) The Excises and Salt Act, 1944 (I of 1944);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) The Foreign Exchange Regulation Act, 1947 (VII of 1947);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) The Employment of Labour (Standing Orders) Act, 1965 (VIII of 1965);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) The Industrial Relations Ordinance, 1969 (XXIII of 1969);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) The Land Development Tax Ordinance, 1976 (XLII of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) The Income-tax Ordinance, 1984 (XXXVI of 1984) 24[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) The Municipality Taxation Act, 1881 (Ben. Act IX of 1881);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) The Explosives Act, 1884 (IV of 1884);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) The Electricity Act, 1910 (IX of 1910);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) The Boilers Act, 1923 (V of 1923);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) The Building Construction Act, 1952 (E.B. Act II of 1953);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) The Fire Service Ordinance, 1959 (E.P. Ord. XVII of 1959);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) The Factories Act, 1965 (E.P. Act IV of 1965);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) the chittagong municipal corporation ordinance, 1982 (xxv of 1982).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25[ 11B. In addition to the Committees constituted under this Ordinance, the Board of Governors or the Executive Board may, from time to time, appoint such other Committee or Committees as may be necessary to assist them in the discharge of their functions.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inclusion in or exclusion from Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26[ 11C. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, the Government may, by order in writing, include in, or exclude from, the Consultative Committee or the Post Sanction Clearance Committee under section 6A and 6B respectively or any other Committee appointed under section 11B with the approval of the Prime Minister.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Permission for setting up industry in the zone, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) A person desiring to set up an industry in a zone shall make an application to the Authority in the prescribed form for permission in that behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority or any person authorised by it in this behalf shall, on receipt of an application made under sub section (1), process it in accordance with the principle to be laid down by the 27[ Board] in this behalf and shall, if it is satisfied that the applicant fulfils the requirements for setting up an industry in the zone, grant him a permission in the prescribed form.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Allotment of land etc, in a zone</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Authority may, subject to such terms and conditions as it may determine, allot, or lease out on rental basis or otherwise; land and building spaces in a zone to a person who has been granted permission under section 12 to set up an industry in that zone.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Permission to banks to operate in a Zone</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28[ 14. The Authority may, with the approval of the Bangladesh Bank, permit banks, foreign and local, to operate within a Zone and to have as their constituents persons not resident in Bangladesh and to accept deposits on current account or otherwise from such persons.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bonded facilities, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in any other law for the time being in force, there shall not, subject to such rules as may be prescribed, be leviable-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) On any goods, including raw materials, imported into a zone any customs duty, sales tax, octroi or excise duty or import licence or permit fee or any other charges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) On any goods exported from a zone any duty or any other charges.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Types of industries to be set up in a zone, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Authority may, with the previous approval in writing of the Government, determine, from time to time, the type or types of industries to be set up in a zone.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Authority shall, by such date in each year as may be fixed by the Government, submit to the Government for approval a budget, in such form as the Government may specify, for each financial year, showing the estimated receipt and expenditure during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit and accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The accounts of the Authority shall be maintained in such manner and form as may be prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the provisions of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) Act, 1974 (XXIV of 1974), the accounts of the Authority shall be audited by an Auditor, being a chartered accountant within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Authority, with the prior approval of the Government, on such remuneration to be paid by the Authority as the Government may fix.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The auditor appointed under sub section (2) shall examine the annual balance sheet of the Authority together with the accounts and vouchers relating thereto and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Authority; and shall at all reasonable times have access to the books, accounts and other documents of the Authority, and may in relation to such accounts examine any member or officer of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditor shall report to the Government on the accounts examined by him and in his report state whether, in his opinion, the books of accounts have been properly maintained and they exhibit the true picture of the Authority's affairs, and in case he has called for any explanation or information from the Authority, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government, may at any time, issue direction to the auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Authority for the protection of the interest of the Government and of the creditors of the Authority or upon the sufficiency of the procedure in auditing the accounts of the Authority, and may, at any time, enlarge or extend the scope of the audit or direct that a different procedure in audit be adopted or that any other examination be made by the auditors if in its opinion the public interest so requires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Authority shall submit to the Government, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, a report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority shall submit to the Government at such times and at such intervals as the Government may specify-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) such returns, accounts, statements, estimates and statistics as may be required by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) information and comments asked for by the Government on any specific subject;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) copies of documents required by the Government for examination or for any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Authority may appoint such officers and other employees and engage such consultants, advisers, auditors and contractors as it may consider necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. [Government directions, etc.- Omitted by section 13 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. LII of 1986).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. The Authority may, with the approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters not required to be provided for by rules and for which provision is necessary or expedient for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal of difficulties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29[ 24. If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Government may, by order, do anything which appears to it to be necessary for the purpose of removing the difficulty.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21 Section 7A was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22 The commas and words “, with the prior approval of the Government,” were omitted by section 7 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XLIX of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23 Section 11A was inserted by section 8 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XLIX of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24 The semi-colon (;) was substituted for the full-stop (.) and the entries (i) to (p) were added by section 10 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. LII of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25 Section 11B was inserted by section 11 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. LII of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26 Section 11C was inserted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Act, 1994 (Act No. XXII of 1994)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27 The word “Board” was substituted for the word “Government” by section 12 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. LII of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28 Section 14 was substituted by section 9 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XLIX of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29 Section 24 was added by section 14 of the Bangladesh Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. LII of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
532	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH HANDLOOM BOARD ORDINANCE 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH HANDLOOM BOARD ORDINANCE 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXIII OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[31st December, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to make provision for the establishment of the Bangladesh Handloom Board.WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the establishment of the Bangladesh Handloom Board for the development of handloom industry and welfare of persons engaged in handloom industry and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Handloom Board Ordinance 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Bangladesh Handloom Board established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “handloom” means a weaving device operated manually for production of fabrics other than 100% silk or artsilk and includes the following types of looms falling outside the scope of the Factories Act, 1965 (E.P. Act IV of 1965), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) shuttle pit loom including carpet loom and tape loom;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) fly shuttle pit loom;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) fly shuttle frame loom;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) semi-automatic or Chittaranjan loom;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v) Hattersley's loom;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi) special type looms used by tribal people;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vii) “cottage loom”, that is, power looms up to three units located in household and driven by power;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(viii) any other loom which is operated in the household for production of heavy or light fabrics;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “member” means a member of the Board and includes the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Board to be called the Bangladesh Handloom Board for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Head Office</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Board shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may establish as many branches at such other places as it thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Management</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Board shall act on commercial consideration having due regard to the public interest and shall, in discharging its functions, be guided on question of policy by such directions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Composition of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Full-time members</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) not more than four persons to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Part-time members</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Registrar, Co-operative Societies, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the Director of Textiles, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (dd) the Chairman, Bangladesh Sericulture Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the Chairman, Bangladesh Jatiya Samabay Shilpa Samity Limited, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) a representative of the Bangladesh Textile Mills Corporation of the rank of a Director to be nominated by that Corporation; 2[ [ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ff) representatives from amongst the weavers in Bangladesh, not exceeding two in number, to be nominated by the Government; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) one person to be nominated by the Government in the Ministry of Finance from amongst the officials of the banks and other financial institutions engaged in rural banking.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The members other than the ex-officio members shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of their appointment or, as the case may be, nomination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The full-time members shall be appointed on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A member other than an ex-officio member may, at any time, resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman shall be the Chief Executive of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Chairman and the other full-time members shall perform such functions as may be assigned to them, from time to time, by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Disqualifications and removal of members</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) No person shall be or shall continue to be a member who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) is, or at any time has been, disqualified for employment in, or dismissed from, Government service; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) is, or at any time has been, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) is, or at any time has been, adjudicated insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) stands declared by a competent court to be of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) is a minor; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence granted by the Chairman or, in the case of the Chairman, by the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that this clause shall not apply in the case of the ex-officio members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2) of section 6, the Government may, by order in writing, remove any other member if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) refuses or fails to discharge, or becomes, in the opinion of the Government, incapable of discharging, his responsibilities under this Ordinance; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) has, in the opinion of the Government, abused his position as member; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) has knowingly acquired, or continued to hold, without the permission in writing of the Government, directly or indirectly or through a partner, any share or interest in any contract or employment with, or by or on behalf of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to undertake survey, census and planning for rational growth of handloom industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to maintain statistics relating to handloom industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to conduct enquiries and investigations relating to handloom industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to promote handloom industry primarily with the help of the primary, secondary and apex 3[ weavers' societies];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to render promotional and advisory services to units of handloom industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to arrange credit facilities for handloom industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to make arrangement for supply of yarn to the weavers at reasonable price primarily through 4[ weavers' societies];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to make arrangement for supply of consumables like dyes, chemicals, spares and accessories to the weavers primarily through 5[ weavers' societies];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to make arrangement for marketing at home and abroad primarily through 6[ weavers' societies] of articles manufactured by handloom industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to undertake and organise publicity and propaganda for the popularisation of handloom products both at home and abroad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to make arrangement for maintenance of depots primarily through 7[ weavers' societies] for the supply of raw materials to, and purchase of finished products from, handloom industries and also for maintenance of common facilities for design, yarn preparation, bleaching, dyeing, calendaring, printing and finishing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to render promotional and extension facilities for standardisation for domestic and export sales of handloom products and grant certificate of quality and of the country of origin;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) to provide training facilities and promote research;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) to prepare and implement common facility schemes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) to collect fees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) to float subsidiary companies; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q) to do such other acts and things as may be necessary or conducive to be done for the smooth operation and rational growth of handloom industry.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Registration etc of weavers’ societies</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"> 8A. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, any primary, secondary or apex weavers' society as mentioned in section 8 shall be formed, registered, inspected and controlled in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) Save as hereinafter provided, the meetings of the Board shall be conducted in accordance with such procedure as may be prescribed by regulations and, until such regulations are made, in such manner as the Chairman may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The meetings of the Board shall be held on such dates and at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that at least one meeting of the Board shall be held every month.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than four members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by any other member authorised in writing in this behalf by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in the case of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if any decision on any matter taken by a majority of the members present and voting appears, in the opinion of the Chairman, to be inconsistent with the Government policy in the matter, the Chairman shall refer it to the Government whose decision in the matter shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Fund of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) There shall be a fund of the Board to which shall be credited-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the grants and loans received from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans raised in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) aids and grants received from foreign countries or organisations with the prior approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) income from investments and properties; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) fees, if any, collected by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fund of the Board shall be utilised by the Board to meet charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance and all payments of the Board shall be made out of that Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The fund of the Board shall be kept in such bank or banks as may be approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to borrow</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, borrow money for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance and for servicing any loan obtained by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Budget</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Board shall, by such date before the commencement of any financial year as the Government may direct, submit to the Government for approval a budget, in such form as the Government may specify, for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Surplus Funds</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Any surplus money remaining after payment of all taxes and other dues shall be credited to a fund to be called the Surplus Fund and shall be utilised for such purpose and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Board shall maintain in accounts in such manner and form as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Audit</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter referred to as the Auditor-General) in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of audit under sub-section (1) the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Board and may examine the Chairman, any member or any officer or other employee of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Auditor-General shall submit his audit report to the Government and shall forward a copy thereof to the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Reports, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Board shall furnish to the Government such reports and statements as the Government may, from time to time, require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of audited accounts together with annual report on the conduct of its affairs during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Board may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no post shall be created by the Board without the previous approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Declaration of fidelity and secrecy</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. All officers and employees of the Board shall, before entering upon their duties, make a declaration of fidelity and secrecy in such form as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Chairman, any member or any officer, consultant or employee of the Board for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recovery of dues</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. Without prejudice to the right of the Board to recover its dues in any other manner, all sums due to the Board shall be recoverable as an arrear of land revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Board may delegate to the Chairman any of its powers under this Ordinance or the rules or regulations made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman may likewise delegate to any member or officer any of his powers under this Ordinance or the rules or regulations made thereunder not being a power delegated to him by the Board under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Winding up</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. No provisions of law relating to the winding up of bodies corporate shall apply to the Board, and the Board shall not be wound up except by order of the Government and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make regulations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Transfer of functions, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract, deed or agreement or in any other instrument, upon the establishment of the Board all functions relating to handloom and handloom manufacture of the Bangladesh Handloom Goods Export Corporation Limited, a company under the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913), shall stand transferred to the Board and all shares of the Bangladesh Jatiya Samabaya Shilpa Samiti Ltd. in the said Corporation held by the shareholders of the said Shilpa Samiti shall, on payment by the Board of the par value of the shares allotted to and paid by such shareholders, stand transferred to, and vest in, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Transfer of textile facility cetnres to the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement or in any other instrument, upon the establishment of the Board-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all textile facility centres, hereinafter referred to as the said facility centres, existing immediately before the establishment of the Board and administered by the Bangladesh Small and Cottage Industries Corporation established under section 3 of the Bangladesh Small and Cottage Industries Corporation Act, 1957 (E.P. Act XVII of 1957), or, as the case may be, by any other Government agency shall, along with all their assets, liabilities and obligations, including all rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all properties, movable and immovable, funds, cash and bank balances, grants and all other interests and rights in, or arising out of, such properties and books and accounts, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto, stand transferred to, and vested in, the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) services of such officers and other employees of the said facility centres as the Government may direct, shall notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the terms and conditions of service, stand transferred to the Board and they shall be deemed to be officers and other employees of the Board appointed by it on the same terms and conditions of service as were applicable to them before their transfer unless such terms and conditions are altered, not being to their disadvantage, by the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all suits and other proceedings instituted by or against the said facility centres before their transfer shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (dd) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XXVI of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “and” was omitted and thereafter clause (ff) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No.XXVI of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “weavers' societies” were substituted for the words “weavers' co-operative societies” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Act 1990 (Act No. LII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “weavers' societies” were substituted for the words “weavers' co-operative societies” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. LII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “weavers' societies” were substituted for the words “weavers' co-operative societies” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. LII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words “weavers' societies” were substituted for the words “weavers' co-operatives” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. LII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The words “weavers' societies” were substituted for the words “weavers' co-operatives” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. LII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Section 8A was inserted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Handloom Board (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. LII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
533	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH JUTE CORPORATION (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1976   </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE BANGLADESH JUTE CORPORATION (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLIX OF 1976).[30th June, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal the Bangladesh Jute Corporation Act, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Bangladesh Jute Corporation Act, 1973 (XXVII of 1973);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Jute Corporation (Repeal) Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on the first day of July, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal of Act XXVII of 1973, and saving</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) On the coming into force of this Ordinance, the Bangladesh Jute Corporation Act, 1973 (XXVII of 1973), hereinafter referred to as the said Act, shall stand repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the said Act,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, and all property, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances, funds, investments and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property, and all books of accounts, registers, records and documents, of the Bangladesh Jute Corporation, hereinafter referred to as the Jute Corporation, shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Bangladesh Jute Marketing Corporation established under the Jute Marketing Corporation Act, 1957 (E.P. Act XII of 1957), hereinafter referred to as the Jute Marketing Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts and liabilities incurred, all obligations undertaken, all contracts entered into and all agreements made by or with the Jute Corporation and subsisting or having effect immediately before such repeal shall be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken, entered into or made by or with the Jute Marketing Corporation; (c) all Officers and other employees of the Jute Corporation shall stand transferred to and become officers and employees of the Jute Marketing Corporation and shall hold office or service in the Jute Marketing Corporation on the same terms and conditions as were enjoyed by them immediately before such repeal and shall continue to do so until these terms and conditions are altered by the Government or by the Jute Marketing Corporation:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no officer or other employee whose services are so transferred shall be entitled to any compensation because of such transfer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the Jute Corporation before such repeal shall be deemed to be suits and proceeding by or against the Jute Marketing Corporation and shall be proceeded or otherwise dealt with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer and other matters specified in sub-section (2), make such orders as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
534	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE BANGLADESH MALARIA ERADICATION BOARD (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH MALARIA ERADICATION BOARD (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. X OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[23rd February, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal the Bangladesh Malaria Eradication Board Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Bangladesh Malaria Eradication Board Order, 1972 (P.O.
