No. 99 of 1972), and to provide for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Malaria Eradication Board (Repeal) Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal of PO No 99 of 1972</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) The Bangladesh Malaria Eradication Board Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 99 of 1972), hereinafter referred to as the said Order, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the said Order,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Bangladesh Malaria Eradication Board, hereinafter referred to as the said Board, constituted under the said Order shall stand dissolved;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all projects, assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all property, movable and immovable, including cash and bank balance, funds, investments and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property and all books of accounts, registers, records and all other documents of the said Board shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all debts and liabilities incurred, all obligations undertaken, all contracts entered into and all agreements made by or with the said Board and subsisting or having effect immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance shall be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken or entered into or made by or with the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Board and pending immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Government and may be continued and proceeded with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the conditions of service, all officers and other employees of the said Board shall unless the Government in any case otherwise directs, stand transferred to the Government on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may alter their remuneration or the terms and conditions of their service if such alteration is considered necessary for the sake of uniformity and in the interest of equity in service.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer and other matters specified in sub-section (2), make such orders as it considers expedient; and any such order shall be deemed to be, and have effect as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
535	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH PETROLEUM CORPORATION ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE BANGLADESH PETROLEUM CORPORATION ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXXVIII OF 1976).[13th November, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Petroleum Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Corporation for the purposes of import, refining and processing of crude petroleum, blending of lubricants, import, export and marketing of petroleum products including by-products and lubricants (but excluding natural gas), and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Petroleum Corporation Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Directors of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Corporation” means the Bangladesh Petroleum Corporation established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Director” means a Director of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “enterprise” means any firm or company engaged in any activity related to the processing, refining, blending or marketing of petroleum including its import, export, purchase, storage, sale or distribution; (f) “petroleum” means hydro-carbons in liquid or solid state, processed or unprocessed, including by-products and lubricants but does not include natural gas; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and incorporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, Government shall establish a Corporation to be called the Bangladesh Petroleum Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head Office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Corporation shall be at 1[ Chittagong].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation may establish offices at such other places as the Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Authorised Capital</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The authorised share capital of the Corporation shall be one crore Taka to be subscribed by the Government in the manner determined by the Government from time to time according to the requirements of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the Corporation may, for carrying out all or any of the functions, have separate capital raised by loan or grant from, or in such other manner and from such other sources including banks, local or foreign, as may be approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Corporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Subject to the provisions of the Petroleum Act, 1974 (LXIX of 1974), and this Ordinance, the functions of the Corporation shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to acquire, import crude petroleum and other refined petroleum products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to refine crude petroleum and manufacture of various grades of refined petroleum products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to set up refineries and ancillary facilities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to import lubricating oil, both in the form of base stock, necessary additives and other chemicals as well as finished products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to manufacture blended lubricating products;            (f) to set up lubricating plants including plants for recycling or revamping of used lubricants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to process and set up facilities for processing of refinery waste or residual products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to plan and instal petroleum (crude and refined) storage facilities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to determine allocation of petroleum products against the marketing companies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to procure inland oil tankers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to establish and expand petroleum marketing facilities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to export petroleum and petroleum products;            (m)       to act as managing agents of, or to enter into any management or any other agreement or contract with, any firm or company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) to supervise, co-ordinate and control the affairs of the enterprises;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) to discharge any other function assigned or delegated to it by the Government from time to time; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) to do such other acts and things as may be necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Subject to the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction and administration of the affairs and business of the Corporation shall vest in a Board of Directors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In discharging its functions, the Board shall act on commercial considerations having due regard to public interest generally and shall be guided on question of policy by such instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Board shall consist of a Chairman and such other Directors, not exceeding five of whom two shall be ex-officio, as may be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) One of the Joint Secretaries of the Ministry of Petroleum and Minerals and one of the Joint Secretaries of the Ministry of Finance shall be the ex-officio Directors.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Chairman and other Directors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Chairman and other Directors, excluding ex-officio Directors, shall be whole time officers of the Corporation and subject to the provisions of section 11, hold office for a term of three years and shall be eligible for appointment thereafter for a further term or terms of such duration as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman or any other Director excluding an ex-officio Director, may, at any time, resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that his resignation shall not take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and the other Directors shall divest themselves of any directorship held by them in any other corporation or in any company otherwise than on behalf of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Chairman and other Directors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Chairman shall be the Chief Executive of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other Directors shall exercise such powers, perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be prescribed or as may be assigned by the Board from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Until the first Board is constituted, the Chairman appointed under section 8(1) shall exercise all powers and do all acts and things as may be exercised or done by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disqualifications and removal of Directors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) No person shall be or shall continue to be a Director who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) is, or at any time has been, disqualified for employment in or dismissed from Government service; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is, or at any time has been, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) is, or at any time has been, adjudicated insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is found to be a lunatic or becomes of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) is a minor; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence granted by the Chairman or in the case of the Chairman, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by order in writing, remove the Chairman or any other Director if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        refuses or fails to discharge or becomes, in the opinion of the Government, incapable of discharging his responsibilities under this Ordinance; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) has, in the opinion of the Government, abused his position as Chairman or any other Director; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) has knowingly acquired or continued to hold without the permission in writing of the Government directly or indirectly or through a partner any share or interest in any contract or employment with or by or on behalf of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and at such places as may be prescribed :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman when he thinks so fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, the number of Directors present shall be three.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in the absence of the Chairman by the Director authorised by the Chairman in writing in that behalf, or in default of such authorisation, by the person elected for the purpose by the Directors present from amongst themselves.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Board such Director shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No Director shall vote on any matter in which he has any personal interest directly or indirectly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Formation of new companies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government, sponsor formation of new companies for carrying out any of the purposes of this Ordinance, hold shares in such companies and permit any person whether or not a Bangladesh national, to hold shares therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reserve Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Subject to such conditions as may be prescribed, the Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government, establish a Reserve Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Profit on crude oil, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Corporation may realise, at such rates as may be approved by the Government, profit on the crude oil, refined petroleum and petroleum products imported by it and sold to the refineries and petroleum marketing companies, or on the surplus refinery products exported by it on purchase from the refineries.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Operation of Accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Corporation may open and operate any account with any bank or banks.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Investment in securities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Corporation may invest its funds in such shares and securities as may be authorised by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disinvestment of shares</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine, disinvest any share held by it in any company.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Corporation shall, by such date before the commencement of every financial year as the Government may direct, submit, in such manner and form as may be prescribed, to the Government for approval, a statement to be called the annual budget-statement, showing estimated receipts and expenditure of the Corporation in respect of that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Account and Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Corporation shall maintain proper accounts and other relevant records, and prepare annual statement of accounts, including the profit and loss accounts and balance-sheet, in accordance with such general directions as may be issued, and in such form as may be prescribed, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Corporation shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed with the approval of the Government by the Corporation on such remuneration as it may think fit, and such remuneration shall be paid by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance-sheet and other accounts of the Corporation and shall examine it together with the account books and vouchers relating thereto; and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the corporation, and shall at all reasonable times have access to the books, accounts and other documents of the Corporation, and may in relation to such accounts examine any Director or officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditors shall report to the Government upon the annual balance-sheet and accounts, and in their report they shall state whether in their opinion, the balance-sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of the Corporation's affairs, and if they have called for any explanation or information from the Board whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Corporation shall furnish to the Government such reports and statements as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government statement of audited accounts together with annual report on the conduct of its affairs during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Corporation may, subject to such regulations as may be made in this behalf, appoint such officers, consultants, advisors, auditors and employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. The Corporation may, by general or by special order in writing, direct that such of its powers, shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by such of its Directors or officers as may be specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Alteration, etc, of Memorandum of Association, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Notwithstanding the provisions of the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913), the Corporation may amend, alter or modify the Memorandum and Articles of Association of any Company wholly owned by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Acquisition of land, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) The Corporation may acquire, for carrying out the purposes of the Ordinance, by purchase, lease, exchange or otherwise any land or interest in land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The acquisition under this section of any land or interest in land shall be deemed to be an acquisition for a public purpose within the meaning of the Land Acquisition Act, 1894 (I of 1894) and the provision of the said Act shall apply to all such proceedings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public Servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Chairman, Directors, officers, advisors or employees of the Corporation shall, while acting or purporting to act in pursuance of the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules or regulations made thereunder, be deemed to be Public Servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings lie against the Chairman, any Director or any officer, adviser, consultant or employee of the Corporation for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up of the Corporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. No provision of law relating to the winding up of companies shall apply to the Corporation and the Corporation shall not be wound up save by order of the Government and in such manner as it may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. The Government, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) The Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of certain functions and rights, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. Upon the establishment of the Corporation under section 3,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the functions to be performed by the Corporation under section 6 shall not be performed by the Bangladesh Oil and Gas Corporation, also called PETROBANGLA except to the extent covered specifically by any production sharing agreement or contract existing immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) subject to clause (a), all rights, liabilities and obligations of the Government or PETROBANGLA which, whether arising out of any contract or otherwise, were acquired or incurred by it for any of the purposes referred to in section 6 before the date of the establishment of the Corporation, shall be deemed to have been acquired or incurred by the Corporation and shall be the rights, liabilities and obligations respectively of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the assets and shares, undertakings and liabilities vested in the Government and enumerated in the Schedule shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the services of such officers and other employees, as may be agreed upon between the Corporation and the PETROBANGLA, shall be transferred to the Corporation on the same terms and conditions of service as were applicable to them immediately before the establishment of the Corporation:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Corporation may vary or alter any condition of service of such officers or employees subject to its being not to their disadvantage.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to amend the Schedule</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. The Government may, from time to time by notification in the official Gazette, amend the Schedule so as to include therein or exclude therefrom any item or vary the description of any item included therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “Chittagong” was substituted for the word “Dacca” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Petroleum Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
536	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION ORDINANCE 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: center;">THE BANGLADESH PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION ORDINANCE 1977</p><p style="text-align: center;">(ORDINANCE NO. LVII OF 1977)</p><p style="text-align: right;">[28th November, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">   An Ordinance to establish a Public Service Commission to replace the two Public Service Commissions established by the Public Service Commissions Ordinance 1977.WHEREAS it is expedient to establish a Public Service Commission to replace the two public service commissions established by the Public Service Commissions Ordinance, 1977 (Ordinance No. VIII of 1977), for the purposes hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">   NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975 and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Public Service Commission Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definition</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, “Commission” means the Bangladesh Public Service Commission established under section 3.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of Bangladesh Public Service Commission</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be established a public service commission to be called the Bangladesh Public Service Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The number of members of the Commission, including the Chairman, shall be not less than six nor more than fifteen.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions to be subject to the Ordinance, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The exercise of the functions of the Commission under clause (2) of Article 140 of the Constitution in respect of any matter referred to therein shall be subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, any regulation made under that article or any other law for the time being in force affecting such matter.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Exclusion from the purview of the Commission</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance or in any other law for the time being in force, consultation with the Commission shall not be necessary-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in respect of any appointment to or any other matter relating to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) a post in a divisional office, a district office or a subordinate office to which appointment may be made by the head or other officer of that office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) a civil service or a civil post which is, or is declared by Government to be, a lower subordinate service or, as the case may be, a lower subordinate post;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) any service or post appointment to which was excluded from the purview of any public service commission before the commencement of this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) such other service or post as the President may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify in this behalf;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in respect of any ad hoc appointment, or of any matter relating to such appointment, made during the period from the 16th day of December, 1971, to the 8th day of April, 1972; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) in respect of appointment of such class of persons in the service of the Republic, or of any matter relating thereto, as the President may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Explanation::</strong>-In this section, “divisional office”, “district office” and “subordinate office” means such office as the Government may, by order, declare to be such an office for the purpose of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power of review</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance or in any other law for the time being in force, the President may review such test or examination conducted, or advice given, by any public service commission during the period from the 26th day of March, 1971, to the 8th day of April, 1972, and pass such orders in respect thereof as he could under any law in force immediately before the 16th day of December 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Repeal and savings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Public Service Commissions Ordinance 1977 (Ordinance No. VIII of 1977), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any matter pending immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance with or before the Public Service (First) Commission or the Public Service (Second) Commission established under the said Ordinance shall stand transferred to, and shall be deemed to be pending with or before, the Commission and shall be disposed of accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A member of the Public Service (First) Commission or the Public Service (Second) Commission established under the said Ordinance who was holding office immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance shall, after such commencement, hold office for the remainder of his term as a member of the Commission as if he were appointed as such member on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to him and shall accordingly exercise and perform the functions of such member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
537	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH RIFLES (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> RIFLES (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXXV OF 1976).[8th November, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for special provisions for maintaining discipline among certain members of the Bangladesh Rifles.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for special provisions for maintaining discipline among certain members of the Bangladesh Rifles;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Rifles (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “authority” means an authority specified in column 2 of the Schedules;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “member” means 1[ a departmentally promoted Deputy Director, Assistant Director, Deputy Assistant Director, or a subordinate officer, Rifleman and Signalman] of the Bangladesh Rifles and includes any civilian employee serving in connection with the Bangladesh Rifles mentioned in column 1 of the Schedules; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “misconduct” means conduct prejudicial to good order or service discipline or contrary to the Government Servants (Conduct) Rules, 2[ 1979], or unbecoming an officer or gentleman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Application of other laws not barred</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Ordinance shall be in addition to, and not in derogation of, the Bangladesh Rifles Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 148 of 1972).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Where a member is guilty of -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) misconduct;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) dereliction of duty;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       act of cowardice and moral turpitude;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       corruption; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        inefficiency,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">the authority concerned specified in column 2 of the First Schedule may impose on such member any of the penalties mentioned in section 5.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The following shall be the penalties which may be imposed upon a member under this Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        dismissal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        removal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        discharge from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        compulsory retirement; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        reduction to lower rank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inquiry</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) When a member is to be proceeded against any of the offences mentioned in section 4, the authority concerned specified in column 2 of the First Schedule shall frame a charge and specify therein the penalty proposed to be imposed and communicate it to the member, hereinafter called the accused, requiring him to show cause within a specified time which shall not be less than seven days and not more than ten days from the date the charge has been communicated to him why the penalty proposed to be imposed on him shall not be imposed and also state whether he desires to be heard in person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If, after consideration of the cause shown by the accused, if any, and hearing him in person, if the accused so desires, the authority concerned finds the accused guilty of the charge, he shall, within twenty days of the receipt of the explanation, impose upon the accused the proposed penalty or any other lesser penalty under section 5.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. 3[ * * *] A member on whom a penalty has been imposed under section 6 may, within seven days of the receipt of the order of punishment, appeal against the order imposing upon him any penalty under section 4 to the appellate authority concerned specified in column 3 of the First Schedule, who shall, within fifteen days of the date of appeal, communicate to the appellant his decision which shall be final 4[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where, in any case, the order imposing penalty has been made by the Government, the member on whom the penalty has been imposed may apply to the Government for review of the order.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Discharge, etc, of members without assigning reasons</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. If the authority specified in column 2 of the Second Schedule is of the opinion that continuance in service of a member mentioned in column 1 is inexpedient or not in the interest of the Bangladesh Rifles, he may, without assigning any reason, either discharge or may make order for premature retirement with such service benefits to which such member may be entitled 5[ under this Ordinance or any rules] applicable to him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compensation pension, gratuity, etc, of members compulsorily or prematurely retired</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ 8A. (1) Subject to any order of the President as to the amount of compensation pension or gratuity to be paid, a member compulsorily retired under sub-clause (c) of clause (1) of Article 11 of the Bangladesh Rifles Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 148 of 1972), whether before or after the commencement of this Ordinance, or under clause (d) of section 5 or prematurely retired under section 8 shall, except as hereinafter provided, be entitled to such compensation pension or gratuity or provident fund benefits as would have been admissible to him on the date of the retirement under the Rules applicable to his service or post if he had been discharged from service on account of the abolition of his post without alternative suitable employment being provided:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the compulsory retirement follows a period of suspension ordered under clause (2) of Article 11 of the Bangladesh Rifles Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 148 of 1972), such compensation pension or gratuity or provident fund benefits shall be admissible only for the period of service rendered excluding the period of suspension.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A member who is compulsorily or prematurely retired from service shall not be entitled to any leave preparatory to retirement. ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Court’s jurisdiction barred</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. No order passed under any of the provisions of this Ordinance shall be called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words and commas “a departmentally promoted Deputy Director, Assistant Director, Deputy Assistant Director, or a subordinate officer, Rifleman and Signalman” were substituted for the words “a subordinate officer, Rifleman, Signalman” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Rifles (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. IV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The figure “1979” was substituted for the figure “1966” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Rifles (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1980 (Act No. XXXII of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The brackets and figure “(1)” was omitted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Rifles (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. IV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The colon (:) was substitutate for the full stop (.) and the proviso was added by section 3 of the Bangladesh Rifles (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. IV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “under this Ordinance or any rules” were substituted for the words “under the rules” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Rifles (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1980 (Act No. XXXII of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Section 8 A was inserted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Rifles (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1980 (Act No. XXXII of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
538	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH SANGBAD SANGSTHA ORDINANCE, 1979 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> SANGBAD SANGSTHA ORDINANCE, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO XX OF 1979).[31st March, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Sangbad Sangstha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Sangbad Sangstha as a national news agency for undertaking and promoting news agency service in Bangladesh, obtaining international news agency service, mobilisation of national news, and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Sangbad Sangstha Ordinance, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless context otherwise requires,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Board of Directors of the Sangstha constituted under section 7;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)         “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)         “Director” means a Director of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)         “Managing Director” means the Managing Director of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “Sangstha” means the Bangladesh Sangbad Sangstha established under section 3.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and Incorporation of the Sangstha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be a Sangstha to be called the Bangladesh Sangbad Sangstha for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Sangstha shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head Office of the Sangstha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Sangstha shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Sangstha may establish its branches at such other places as the Board may decide.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Sangstha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The functions of the Sangstha shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to carry out the responsibility of national news agency of Bangladesh by securing news from home and abroad, disseminating the same to the people of Bangladesh in general through mass media and organising transmission of national news abroad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to secure world-wide news ? political, diplomatic, financial, economic and commercial, cultural and sports from international news agencies and exchange news with national news agencies of other countries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to sell all kinds of news, general, economic and commercial features and photo to all mass media and news agencies within and outside Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to sign agreements with international news agencies, national news agencies of other countries for securing and disseminating news and facilities for the same;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to organise systematic programme for news agency business; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to do such other acts and things as may be connected with or incidental to the carrying out of the functions of the Sangstha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management of the Sangstha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction, management and administration of the affairs of the Sangstha shall vest in a Board which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Sangstha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board in discharging its functions shall, as far as practicable, act having due regard to public interest generally and be guided by such general or special instruction as may be given to it from time to time by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Board shall consist of -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Chairman who shall be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Managing Director, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) three Directors to be appointed by the Government, from amongst the officers not below the status of Joint Secretary, one each from the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, Ministry of Finance and the Posts, Telegraph and Telephone Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) five Directors to be appointed by the Government from the editors of newspapers who subscribe news from the Sangstha, of whom at least three must be from Dacca; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) one person to be appointed by the Government from amongst the employees of the Sangstha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Terms of office of the Chairman and other Directors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Save as otherwise provided, the Chairman and other Directors shall hold office during pleasure of the Government for a period not exceeding three years from the date of appointment but are removable by the Government for permanent incapacity or other cause; and a retiring Chairman or Director shall be eligible for reappointment for another term only.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When a person appointed as Director, ceases to represent the particular interest which he was appointed to represent shall also cease to be the Director, and his seat shall be deemed to have been vacated and a person shall thereupon be appointed to fill the vacancy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any vacancy in the office of a Director shall be filled in by fresh appointment and a Director so appointed shall hold office for the remaining period for which the Director in whose place he is appointed would have held office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman and other Directors shall serve without remuneration but may be paid such travelling and other expenses when engaged on business of the Board as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Vacating the office, disqualifications, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) No person shall be or shall continue to be the Chairman or a Director who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) is a salaried official of the Sangstha other than the Managing Director and an employee appointed as Director;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is or, at any time, has been convicted of an offence which, in the opinion of the Government, is an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        stands declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is a person who is subject to a disqualification imposed by or under any law for the time being in force to hold any public office; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) is, or, any time has been adjudicated an insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)          absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence granted by the Chairman or, in case of the Chairman, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Chairman or any other Director, by reason of illness or other incapacity or absence from Dacca, is unable, at any time, to perform the duties of his position, or if the position of the Chairman or any other Director is, at any time, vacant, the Government may make a temporary appointment of any person to act in his place or in such position upon such terms and conditions and for such time as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) Meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the meeting of the Board may otherwise be convened by the Managing Director in consultation with the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Seven Directors including the Chairman shall form the quorum at a meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Meeting of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman, and, in his absence, by a person elected for the purpose by the Directors present from amongst themselves.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All matters of a meeting of the Board shall be decided by the votes of the majority of the Directors present and voting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) At a meeting of the Board each Director shall have one vote, but in the event of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Validity of the proceeding</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board; and a vacancy in the Board or a temporary absence of a Director for any reason shall not impair the right of the remaining Directors to act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All acts done by the person acting in good faith as the Chairman or a Director shall be valid, notwithstanding that it may afterwards be discovered that his appointment was invalid by reason of any defect or disqualification or had been terminated by virtue of any provision contained in any law for the time being in force:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this section shall be deemed to give validity to any act of the Chairman or a Director after his appointment has been shown to be invalid or to have been terminated.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Managing Director</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Managing Director shall be appointed by the Government from amongst the journalists having not less than fifteen years experience in journalism on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government and he shall also be the Chief Editor of the Sangstha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Managing Director shall be a whole time officer and the Chief Administrative Officer of the Sangstha and, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, he shall administer and manage the affairs and fund of the Sangstha, and shall have supervision over and direction of the work of the Sangstha and of the officers and employees, technical or otherwise, employed for the purpose of carrying out the work of the Sangstha, and shall also discharge such duties as may be assigned to him by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Sangstha may, subject to such general or special orders as the Government may give from time to time and subject to such terms and conditions as the Government may determine, appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its affairs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board, subject to approval of the Government and in accordance with the general and specific standing orders of the Government, shall prescribe the procedure for appointment of its officers and employees and for taking disciplinary action against them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of Powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order be exercisable also by the Chairman, or by such director or officer of the Sangstha as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Chairman, Director and every officer and employee of the Sangstha shall be indemnified by the Sangstha against all losses and expenses incurred by him in or in relation to the discharge of his duties, except such as have been caused by his wilful act or default.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Funds of the Sangstha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Sangstha shall have its own fund which shall be utilised by it to meet charges in connection with the affairs of the Sangstha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fund of the Sangstha shall consist of -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        fees from the subscribers of the news;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        gifts and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        sale proceeds and royalties of news items, features, photos and such other allied matters;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         grants and contributions from agencies, foundations and organisations; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        other sources.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All money of the fund of the Sangstha shall be kept in any bank or banks approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Sangstha shall, by such date before the commencement of every financial year as the Government may direct, submit to the Government for approval a budget, in such form as the Government may specify, for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Sangstha shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The accounts of the Sangstha shall be audited every year by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh, hereinafter referred to as the Auditor-General, in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Auditor-General may in addition to the yearly audit either of his own motion or upon a request received in this behalf from the Government undertake such audit of the accounts of the Sangstha at such time as may be considered necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of audit, the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him shall have access to all records, books, documents, accounts, cash and other properties of the Sangstha and may examine, the Chairman, any Director or any officer or other employee of the Sangstha and the Sangstha shall at the time of such audit, produce the account books and connected documents and furnish such explanations and information as the Auditor-General or an officer authorised by him in this behalf may ask for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Auditor-General shall submit an audit report to the Government, with a copy to the Sangstha, in which he shall state whether, in his opinion, accounts of the Sangstha are properly drawn up and, if he has called for any explanation or information from the Sangstha, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Sangstha shall comply with any directive issued by the Government for the modification of the matters objected to in audit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Sangstha shall furnish to the Government such returns, reports and statements as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Sangstha shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government, a statement of accounts audited by the Auditor-General together with an annual report giving therein a true and faithful account of its activity during that year and its proposal for the next financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The copies of the audited accounts and annual report received by the Government under sub-section (2) shall be published in the official Gazette and shall be laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up of the Sangstha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. No provision of law relating to the winding up of companies or corporations shall apply to the Sangstha and the Sangstha shall not be wound up save by an order of the Government and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules and regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) The Government may make rules for the purpose of giving effect of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Sangstha may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made by Government, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All rules and regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publications.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of assets, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23.
