Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement or in any other instrument or notification or order, on the commencement of this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all properties, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances, grants and funds of the erstwhile Associated Press in Bangladesh and vested in the Government under the Bangladesh (Vesting of Property and Assets) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 29 of 1972), and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such properties and all books of accounts, register, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Sangstha;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all debts, liabilities and obligation of whatever kind of the erstwhile Associated Press in, and in relation to, Bangladesh shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, be the debts, liabilities and obligations of the Sangstha;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) every officer or other employee of the erstwhile Associated Press serving in Bangladesh immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance shall stand transferred to the Sangstha and continue to be in the service of the Sangstha on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if an officer or other employee is considered by the Sangstha as surplus of requirement, his employment shall be terminated by the Sangstha with due notice and with such compensation as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that, notwithstanding anything contained in any terms and conditions of service or in any award, settlement or agreement for the time being in force, the Government or the Sangstha, with the prior approval of the Government, may alter the remuneration, whether by way of reduction or otherwise, and other terms and conditions of service of any officer or other employee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ARMED POLICE BATTALIONS ORDINANCE, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXV OF 1979).[31st March, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the constitution of Armed Police Battalions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the constitution of Armed Police Battalions and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title 1[ * * * ] </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. 2[ * * *] This Ordinance may be called the Armed Police Battalions Ordinance, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) [Omitted by section 2 of the Armed Police Battalions (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXVIII of 2003). ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Armed Policeman” means a member of the Force other than an officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (aa) Armed Personnel” means an Armed Policeman;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “battalion” means a full unit composed of several companies of the Force commanded by a Commanding Officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Commanding Officer” means an officer commanding a battalion or a body of Armed Policemen;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “company” means a sub-unit composed of several platoons forming part of a battalion;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (dd) “discipline force” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the army, navy or air force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the police force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) any other force declared by law to be disciplined force or declared by the Government, by notification in the official Gazette, to be disciplined force within the meaning of this definition.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Force” means the Armed Police Battalions constituted under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “officer” means a superior officer or a subordinate officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “platoon” means a body of Armed Policemen composed of a number of sections commanded by a subordinate officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (hh) “Rapid Action Battalion” means a Rapid Action Battalion raised under this Ordinance;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “Second-in-Command” means an officer posted to assist the Commanding Officer or an officer in command of an Armed Police Battalion during the absence of the Commanding Officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) “Section” means a group of Armed Policemen commanded by a subordinate officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “Special   Court” means,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in the case of an offence committed by a superior officer, a Court consisting of the Additional Inspector General of Police and another officer not below the rank of Superintendent of Police, constituted by the Government upon the recommendation of the Inspector General of Police, presided over by the Additional Inspector General of Police and assisted by the Public Prosecutor or a Deputy Superintendent of Police authorised in this behalf by Inspector General of Police or any Court Inspector:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the accused person is an officer of the rank of Superintendent of Police, the other officer of the Court shall be of the rank of Deputy Inspector General of Police, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in the case of an offence committed by a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman, a Court consisting of an officer of the rank of Deputy Inspector General of Police to be nominated by the Inspector General of Police and another officer not below the rank of an Inspector of Police, constituted by the Inspector General of Police, presided over by an officer of the rank of Deputy Inspector General of Police and assisted by a Public Prosecutor or a Deputy Superintendent of Police authorised in this behalf by the Inspector General of Police or any Court Inspector:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the accused person is an officer of the rank of Inspector of Police, the other officer of the Court shall be of the rank of a Deputy Superintendent of Police;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) “subordinate officer” means an Inspector or Sub-Inspector of Police;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) “Summary Court” means,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in the case of an offence committed by a superior officer, a Court consisting of a Deputy Inspector General of Police and another officer not below the rank of Superintendent of Police, constituted by the Additional Inspector General of Police and presided over by the Deputy Inspector General of Police:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the accused person is an officer of the rank of Superintendent of Police, the other officer of the Court shall also be of the rank of Deputy Inspector General of Police; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in the case of an offence committed by a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman, a Court consisting of the Commanding Officer of the battalion concerned and another officer not below the rank of an Inspector of Police, constituted by the Additional Inspector General of Police and presided over by the said Commanding Officer:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the accused person is an officer of the rank of Inspector of Police, the other officer of the Court shall be of the rank of Deputy Superintendent of Police;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) “superior officer” means an officer of and above the rank of Deputy Superintendent of Police.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The expressions “reason to believe”, “criminal force”, “assault”, “fraudulently” and “voluntarily causing hurt” shall have the meanings assigned to them respectively in the Penal Code (Act No. XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Raising and maintaining of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be raised and maintained in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance a Force to be called the Armed Police Battalions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Force shall consist of such number and classes of officers and Armed Policemen and shall be constituted in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ (3) The Force shall include one or more Rapid Action Battalion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Rapid Action Battalion shall have such number and classes of officers and Armed Personnel and shall be constituted in such manner and under such conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance or in any other law for the time being in force, Armed Personnel and officers in Rapid Action Battalion may, as and when necessary, be appointed on secondment or deputation, as the case may be, from among the persons who are in the service of the Republic, including any disciplined force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) All Rapid Action Battalions shall be under the direct control and superintendence of an officer not below the rank of Deputy Inspector General of Police or equivalent in any disciplined force as may be determined by the Government and such officer shall be appointed on secondment or deputation from among the persons who are in the service of the Republic, including any disciplined force.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Members of the Force to be subject to the Ordinance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Every person appointed or enrolled to the Force shall, wherever he may be, remain subject to this Ordinance until he is discharged in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance or is transferred out of the Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Superintendence, etc of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Superintendence of the Force shall vest in the Government and the Force shall be administered, commanded and controlled by the Inspector General of Police in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance and any rules made thereunder and such orders and instructions as may be made or issued by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Duties of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Force shall be employed for the purpose of the following duties, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) internal security duties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (aa) intelligence in respect of crime and criminal activities;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) recovery of unauthorised arms, ammunitions, explosives and such other articles as the Government may, from time to time, direct;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (bb) investigation of any offence on the direction of the Government;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) apprehension of armed gangs of criminals;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) assisting other law enforcing agencies including the Police for maintaining law and order; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) such other duties as the Government may, from time to time, assign.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Duties of the Rapid Action Battalion</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ 6A. A Rapid Action Battalion along with other Battalions of the Force, shall perform all duties mentioned in section 6, but no Battalion, except Rapid Action Battalion, shall perform any duty mentioned in clauses (aa) and (bb) of section 6.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to direct Rapid Action Battalion to investigate offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6B. (1) The Government may, at any time, direct the Rapid Action Battalion to investigate any offence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When any direction is issued under sub-section (1), the Commanding Officer of the concerned Rapid Action Battalion shall assume the control of investigation of such offence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Commanding Officer of a Rapid Action Battalion may himself investigate any such offence or direct an officer subordinate to him to investigate the offence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Procedure to be followed in respect of investigation of an offence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6C. (1) An officer of a Rapid Action Battalion shall, while investigating an offence, follow the procedure prescribed in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act No. V of 1898) or in any other law, as the case may be, for the investigation of such offence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act No. V of 1898) or in any other law for the time being in force, the concerned officer shall, on completion of the investigation of any offence under this Ordinance, file his report to the Officer-in-Charge of the concerned police-station, and the Officer-in-Charge shall, within forty eight hours of the receipt of such report, forward the same as it is to the competent Court or tribunal, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers of officer in respect of investigation of an offence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6D. An officer of any Rapid Action Battalion may, while investigating an offence or performing any duties under this Ordinance with respect to the cases originated from that offence, exercise all such powers and perform all such functions and duties as may be exercised or performed by a police officer under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act No. V of 1898).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Discharge from the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. Every Armed Policeman shall, subject to this Ordinance, be entitled to receive his discharge from the Force on the expiration of the period for which he was appointed or enrolled and may, before the expiration of that period, be discharged from the Force by the Inspector General of Police or such other Officer, and subject to such conditions, as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences triable by Special   Court</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) An officer or an Armed Policeman, who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) begins, excites, causes or joins in any mutiny or sedition or, being present at any mutiny or sedition, does not make his utmost endeavour to suppress it, or, knowing, or having reason to believe in the existence, of any mutiny or sedition, does not, without delay, give information thereof to his Commanding Officer or superior officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) uses or attempts to use, criminal force to commit an assault on his superior officer knowing or having reason to believe him to be such superior officer, whether on or off duty; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) abandons or delivers up any post or guard or wireless station which is committed to his charge or which it is his duty to defend; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) in the presence of an enemy or any person in arms against whom it is his duty to act, casts away his arms or his ammunition, or intentionally uses words or any other means to induce any other subordinate officer or Armed Policeman to abstain from acting against the enemy, or any such person or to discourage any such subordinate officer or Armed Policeman from acting against the enemy, or any such person; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) directly or indirectly holds correspondence with, or communicates intelligence to, or assists, or relieves, any enemy or person in arms against the State, or omits to disclose immediately to his Commanding Officer or superior officer any such correspondence or communication coming to his knowledge; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) directly or indirectly assists or relieves with money, victuals or ammunition, or knowingly harbours or protects any enemy or person in arms against the State; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) without authority leaves his Commanding Officer, or his post or party; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) quits his guard, post, party or patrol without being regularly relieved or without leave; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) uses criminal force to, or commits an assault on, any person bringing provisions or other necessaries to camp or quarters, or forces a safeguard, or without authority breaks into any house or any other place for plunder, or destroys or damages any property of any kind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) intentionally causes or spreads a false alarm in action, camp, battalion headquarters or barracks; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) accepts illegal gratification from any person; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) commits or attempts to commit rape on any woman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by a Special   Court, be punished with,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in the case of an offence mentioned in clause (a) or (l), transportation for life, or rigorous imprisonment for a term of not less than ten years;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of an offence mentioned in clause (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f), rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) in the case of an offence mentioned in clause (g), (h), (i), (j) or (k) rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Special Court may take cognizance of any offence punishable under this section either of its own motion or on a complaint by any person and shall follow such procedure as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An officer or an Armed Policeman accused of an offence under this Ordinance shall have the right to conduct his own defence or to have assistance of any superior or subordinate officer of his battalion or of any legal practitioner of his own choice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any person aggrieved by a judgment of a Special   Court may prefer an appeal within thirty days of the delivery the judgment,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in the case of superior officer, to the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman, to the Inspector General of Police.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) When a Special Court passes sentence of transportation for life, the proceedings of the case shall be submitted,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in the case of superior officer, to the President; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman, to the Inspector General of Police,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">and the sentence shall not be executed unless it is confirmed by the President or, as the case may be, by the Inspector General of Police.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) In any case submitted under sub-section (5), the President or, as the case may be, the Inspector General of Police may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) confirm the sentence, or pass any other sentence warranted by law, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) annul the conviction, and convict the accused of any offence of which the Special Court might have convicted him, or order a new trial on the same or an amended charge, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) may acquit the accused:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no order of confirmation shall be made under this sub-section until the period allowed for preferring an appeal has expired, or, if an appeal is preferred within such period, until such appeal is disposed of.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences triable by Summary   Court, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) An officer or an Armed Policeman who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) is in a state of intoxication when on or detailed for any duty, or on parade, or on the line march; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) strikes, or forces or attempts to force, any sentry; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) being in command of a guard, post or patrol, refuses to receive any prisoner duly committed to his charge, or, whether in such command or not, releases any prisoner without proper authority or negligently suffers any prisoners to escape; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) being deputed to any guard, post or patrol, quits it without being regularly relieved or without leave; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) being in command of a guard, post or patrol, permits gambling or other behaviour prejudicial to good order and discipline; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) being under arrest or in confinement, leaves his arrest or confinement before he is set at liberty by proper authority; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) is grossly insubordinate or insolent to his superior officer in the execution of his office; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) refuses to superintend or assist in the making of any field work or other police work of any description ordered to be made either in headquarters or in the field; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) strikes or otherwise misbehaves with a subordinate officer or an Armed Policeman; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) being in command at any post or on the march and receiving a complaint that any one under his command has beaten or otherwise maltreated or oppressed any person, or has committed any riot or trespass, fails, on proof of the truth of the complaint, to have due reparation made as far as possible to the injured person and to report the case to the proper authority; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) designedly, or through neglect, injures or loses or fraudulently or without due authority disposes of his arms, clothes, tools, equipment, ammunition, accoutrements, any means of transport or other necessaries or any such articles entrusted to him or belonging to any other person; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) malingers, feigns or produces disease or infirmity in himself, or intentionally delays his cure or aggravates his disease or infirmity; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) with intent to render himself or any other person unfit for service, voluntarily causes hurt to himself or any other person; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) commits extortion, or without proper authority extracts from any person carriage, porterage or provisions; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) designedly, or through neglect, kills, injures, makes away with or ill-treats or loses his horse or any animal used in the public service; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) disobeys the lawful command of his officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q) plunders, destroys or damages any property of any kind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r) being a sentry, sleeps at his post or quits it without being regularly relieved or without leave; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(s) designedly or through neglect fails to apprehend an offender; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"> </p></div></div>
539	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH SERICULTURE BOARD ORDINANCE 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH SERICULTURE BOARD ORDINANCE 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXII OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[30th December, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to make provision for the establishment of the Bangladesh Sericulture Board.WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the establishment of the Bangladesh Sericulture Board for the welfare of persons engaged in sericulture and sericulture industry and for matters connected therewith; NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Sericulture Board Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Bangladesh Sericulture Board established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board appointed under section 6;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “filature raw silk” means raw silk reeled from silkworm cocoons with the help of any instrument worked by any form of energy, including electrical energy, which is mechanically transmitted and is not generated by human or animal agency;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “member” means a member of the Board and includes the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “regulations” means regulations made under section 21;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “rules” means rules made under section 20;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “spun silk” means silk yarn spun from pierced or spoilt cocoons, Eri cocoons, pieces of silk, noils or other silk waste.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Board to be called the Bangladesh Sericulture Board for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Head Office, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Board shall be at Rajshahi.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may establish offices and branches at such places as it may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Management</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Board in discharging its functions shall be guided on questions of policy by such directions as may be given to it, from time to time, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>The Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Full-time members</strong>-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) not more than three persons to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Part-time members</strong>-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Registrar of Co-operative Societies, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the Director of Textiles, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) four persons to be nominated by the Government, one each from amongst the silkworm rearers, silk reelers, silk weavers and silk dealers; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) one person to be nominated by the Government in the Ministry of Finance from amongst the officials of the banks and other financial institutions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The members other than the ex-officio members shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of their appointment or, as the case may be, nomination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The full-time members shall be appointed on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The members other than the ex-officio members may, at any time, resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman shall be the Chief Executive of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Chairman and the other full-time members shall perform such functions as may be assigned to them, from time to time, by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Disqualifications and removal of members</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) No person shall be, or shall continue to be, a member who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) is, or at any time has been, disqualified for employment in, or dismissed from, Government Service; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) is, or at any time has been, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) is, or at any time has been, adjudicated insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) stands declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) is a minor; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence granted by the Chairman, or, in the case of the Chairman, by the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that this clause shall not apply in the case of the ex-officio members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2) of section 6, the Government may, by order in writing remove any member if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) refuses or fails to discharge, or becomes, in the opinion of the Government, incapable of discharging, his responsibilities under this Ordinance; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) has, in the opinion of the Government, abused his position as member; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) has knowingly acquired, or continued to hold, without the permission in writing of the Government, directly or indirectly or through a partner, any share or interest in any contract or employment with, or by or on behalf of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to plan and develop sericulture and silk industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to undertake, assist or encourage scientific, technological and economic research and training in sericulture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to devise means for improved methods of mulberry cultivation, castor cultivation and other related plants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to rear, develop and distribute healthy silkworm seeds;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to reel silkworm cocoons and to improve the quality and production of raw silk, if necessary, by making it compulsory for all raw silk to be marketed only after the same has been tested and graded in properly equipped raw silk conditioning houses;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to provide technical advice to the persons engaged in charkha reeling and filature;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to improve the quality of raw silk and silk products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to collect and collate statistics on sericulture and sericulture industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to make arrangements for credit facilities for sericulturists;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to make arrangements for supply to silk reelers, weavers and printers of necessary raw materials including dyes, chemicals, spares and accessories as required for sericulture and silk industry at fair price;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to make arrangements for marketing of sericulture and silk products and publicity for their popularisation both at home and abroad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to render promotional and extension facilities for standardisation of silk products for export and to provide for training facilities to silk rearers, reelers, spinners, weavers and printers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) to prepare, implement and operate common facilities schemes for the persons engaged in sericulture and sericulture industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) to take steps for establishment of spun silk mills;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) to collect cess;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) to do such acts and things as may be necessary or convenient to be done in connection with, or incidental or conductive to, the performance of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) Save as hereinafter provided, the meetings of the Board shall be conducted in accordance with such procedure as may be prescribed by regulations and, until such regulations are made, in such manner as the Chairman may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The meetings of the Board shall be held on such dates and at such times and place as may be determined by the Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that at least one meeting of the Board shall be held every month.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than three members, including the Chairman, shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by any other member authorised in writing in this behalf by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting and, in the case of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if any decision taken by a majority of the members present and voting appears, in the opinion of the Chairman to be inconsistent with the Government policy in the matter, the Chairman shall refer it to the Government whose decision in the matter shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Fund of the Board, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) There shall be a fund of the Board to which shall be credited-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants and loans from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans raised in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) aids and grants received from foreign countries or organisations with the prior approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) income from investments and properties; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) cess collected under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fund of the Board shall be utilised by the Board to meet the charges in connection with the functions under this Ordinance and all payments of the Board shall be made out of that fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The fund of the Board shall be kept in such bank or banks as may be approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Board may invest its funds in such securities as may be authorised by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to borrow</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government, borrow money in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Imposition of cess</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) With effect from such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint, there shall be levied and collected a cess, for the purposes of this Ordinance, on all filature raw silk and spun silk at such rate or rates as the Government may from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, fix.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The cess shall be payable by the reelers of filature raw silk and spun silk and shall be paid by them to the Board within one month from the date of the receipt of the notice of demand from the Board in that behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The cess shall be recoverable as an arrear of land revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) For the purposes of assessing the amount of the cess payable under this section,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Board shall, by notification in the official Gazette, fix the period in respect of which assessments shall be made, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) every person liable to pay cess shall furnish to the Board, within such time as may be prescribed by regulations, a return specifying the total quantity of filature raw silk or spun silk reeled during such period.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If any assessee fails to furnish the return under clause (b) of sub-section (4) within the prescribed time, or furnishes a return which the Board has reason to believe to be incorrect or defective, the Board may assess the amount payable by such assessee in such manner as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Any assessee feeling himself aggrieved by an assessment made under this section may, within three months of the receipt of the notice under sub-section (2), apply to the Government for the cancellation or modification of the assessment, and the Government shall, after giving the Board and the assessee an opportunity of being heard, pass such order as it thinks proper, and such order shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The proceeds of the cess after deducting the cost of collection, if any, shall be credited to the fund of the Board and shall be applied by the Board for meeting the expenses of measures taken in the performance of its functions and for contributing towards a contributory provident fund constituted and maintained in such manner as may be prescribed by regulations for the benefit of the employees of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Budget</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Board shall, by such date in each year as may be fixed by the Government, submit to the Government for approval a statement to be called the annual budget statement in such form as the Government may specify for the next succeeding financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Account and audit</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Board shall maintain proper accounts and other relevant records, and prepare annual statement of accounts in accordance with such general directions as may be issued, and in such form as may be specified, by the Government in consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor-General, hereinafter referred to as the Auditor-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Government on such remuneration as the Government may think fit, and such remuneration shall be paid by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), the Auditor-General may, at any time, either on his own motion or upon a request made in this behalf by the Government, undertake such audit of the accounts of the Board as may be considered necessary, and the Board shall, at the time of such audit, produce the books of accounts and connected documents at such place or places as the Auditor-General or any officer authorised by him in this behalf may ask for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance-sheet and other accounts of the Board and shall examine it together with the account books and vouchers relating thereto; and shall have a list delivered to</p><p style="text-align: justify;">him of all books kept by the Board, and shall, at all reasonable times, have access to the books of accounts and other documents of the Board, and may, in relation to such accounts, examine any member or officer of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The auditors shall report to the Government upon the annual balance-sheet and accounts, and in their report they shall state whether in their opinion the balance-sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of affairs of the Board and, if they have called for any explanation or information from the Board, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Board shall comply with any direction issued by the Government for the rectification of matters objected to in the audit report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Statement of accounts, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Board shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of the accounts audited by the auditors together with comments, if any, of the Board thereon and an annual report on the conduct of its affairs during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall furnish to the Government such other statements, returns and reports as the Government may, from time to time, require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Board may, on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed by regulations, appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no post shall be created by the Board without the previous approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Board may delegate to the Chairman or any member or officer, any of its powers under this Ordinance or the rules or regulations made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman may likewise delegate to any member or officer any of his powers under this Ordinance or the rules or regulations made thereunder not being a power delegated to him by the Board under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Winding up of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. No provisions of law relating to the winding up of companies shall apply to the Board and the Board shall not be wound up save by the order of the Government and in such manner as it may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Board or any member, officer or other employee of the Board for anything which is, in good faith, done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make regulations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette, and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Transfer of Sericulture establishments, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement or in any other instrument, upon the establishment of the Board,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Sericulture Extension Programme, and all sericulture nurseries and silk factories, hereinafter referred to as the said sericulture establishments, of the Small and Cottage Industries Corporation established under the Bangladesh Small and Cottage Industries Corporation Act 1957 (E.P. Act XVII of 1957), shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all properties, movable and immovable, funds, cash and bank balances and grants of the said sericulture establishments and all other interests and rights in, or arising out of, such properties and all books of accounts, registers, records and other documents of whatever nature relating thereto, shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all debts, liabilities and obligations of whatever kind of the said sericulture establishments subsisting immediately before its transfer shall be the debts, liabilities and obligations of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) services of all officers and employees of the said sericulture establishments shall, notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the terms and conditions of service, stand transferred to the Board and they shall be deemed to be officers and employees of the Board appointed by it on the same terms and conditions of service as were applicable to them before their transfer unless such terms and conditions are altered, not being to their disadvantage, by the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) all suits and other proceedings instituted by or against the said sericulture establishments before their transfer shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words and comma “Sericulture Research and Training Institute,” were omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Sericulture Board (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXIV of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
540	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH SHISHU ACADEMY ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> SHISHU ACADEMY ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXIV OF 1976).[22nd September, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh  Shishu Academy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Shishu  Academy for promotion of cultural, scientific and recreational activities for children, and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975 and the 8th November, 1975 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Shishu Academy Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Academy” means the Bangladesh Shishu  Academy established under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Board” means the Board of Management of the Academy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Academy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Director” means the Director of the Academy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “prescribed” means prescribed by regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and incorporation of the Academy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, establish an Academy to be called the Bangladesh  Shishu Academy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Academy shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, among others, to acquire, hold, manage and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The headquarters of the Academy shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">General direction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The general direction and administration of the affairs and business of the Academy shall vest in a Board of Management which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Academy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board, in discharging its functions, shall be guided by such directions as the Government may, from time to time, give.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board of Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 5. The Board of Management of the Academy shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Chairman of the Academy who shall also be the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Principal, Institute  of Fine Arts, ex-officio;(c) one representative from the Ministry of Youth and Sports to be nominated by that Ministry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) one representative from the Finance Division to be nominated by that Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) one representative from the Education Division to be nominated by that Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (ee) one representative from the Ministry of Women and Children Affairs to be nominated by that Ministry;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) one representative from the Council of Child Welfare to be nominated by that Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the Director, Science  Museum, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the Director or, if there are more than one Director, the most senior Director of the Academy, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) four persons, of whom two shall be women, interested in the promotion of children's activities to be nominated by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Academy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to such limits as may be determined by the Government, the functions of the Academy shall be to make arrangements for production of children's literature, promotion of cultural, scientific and recreational activities for children and for paintings and dramas by children.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, the Academy may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        establish, promote, organise or otherwise deal with any institution or organisation to further the object of the Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) receive moneys, securities and such other instruments and any other property, movable or immovable, for and on behalf of the Academy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) invest the moneys and fund of the Academy and vary the investments as and when it may deem fit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) purchase, sell, endorse, transfer, negotiate or otherwise deal in securities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) pledge, hypothecate, mortgage or otherwise charge the properties of the Academy with the prior approval of the Government ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) enter into contracts and agreements and execute necessary documents:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such contract or agreement shall be made and documents executed with a foreign Government, foreign agency or an international organisation without the prior approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        conduct research and arrange publication of research papers and materials;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        do such other acts as are necessary for and conducive to further the object of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of the Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Government shall appoint the Chairman of the Academy on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of the Director, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. 3[ (1) The Government may appoint such number of Directors, Deputy Directors and Assistant Directors of the Academy as it considers necessary on such terms and conditions as it may determine.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 4[ Directors, Deputy Directors and Assistant Directors] shall be whole time officers of the Academy and shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed and, until so prescribed, as may be assigned to them by the Government or the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, appoint such officers, specialists, and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman when he so thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The meetings of the Board shall be conducted in accordance with such procedure as may be prescribed and, until such regulations are made, in such manner as the Chairman may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than three members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman or, in his absence, by a member elected for that purpose by the members present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) At a meeting of the Board, each member shall have one vote, and, in the event of an equality of votes, the Chairman shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Divisions of the Academy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Academy may have such Divisions as the Board may consider necessary to set up for efficient discharge of the functions of the Academy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund of the Academy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) There shall be a fund of the Academy to which shall be credited-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants and loans from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans raised in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        aids and grants received from foreign countries or organisations with the prior approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        donations and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        income from investments and properties; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         all other receipts of the Academy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fund shall be utilised by the Academy to meet charges in connection with the functions under this Ordinance and all payments of the Academy shall be made out of that fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All moneys of the Academy shall be deposited with any bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers to borrow</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Academy may, with the previous approval of the Government, borrow money in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts of Academy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Academy shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Academy shall, by such date as may be fixed by the Government, submit to the Government for approval a budget in such form as the Government may specify for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The accounts of the Academy shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General) in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of audit under sub-section (1), the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Academy and may examine the Chairman, members, Director, Assistant Directors or any other officer or employee of the Academy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Auditor-General shall submit his audit report to the Government and shall forward a copy thereof to the Academy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Academy shall furnish to the Government such reports and statements as the Government may, from time to time, require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Academy may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under sub-section (1) shall be published in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Section 5 was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh  Shishu Academy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (ee) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh  Shishu Academy (Amendment) Act, 1994 (Act No. XXV of 1994)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Sub-section (1) was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh  Shishu Academy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words and comma “Directors, Deputy Directors and Assistant Directors” were substituted for the words “Director and the Assistant Directors” by section 3 of the Bangladesh  Shishu Academy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
541	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH TELEGRAPH AND TELEPHONE BOARD ORDINANCE, 1979 </h2>
