<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> TELEGRAPH AND TELEPHONE BOARD ORDINANCE, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XII OF 1979).[27th February, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the constitution of a Board for the purpose of efficient management, operation and development of telegraphs and telephones.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the constitution of a Board for the purpose of efficient management, operation and development of telegraphs and telephones;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Telegraph and Telephone Board Ordinance, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Bangladesh Telegraph and Telephone Board constituted under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “prescribed” means prescribed by regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, constitute, for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance, a Board to be called the Bangladesh Telegraph and Telephone Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall consist of -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) four whole-time members, including a finance member who shall be an officer having experience in public finance administration; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) 1[ three] part-time members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other members shall be appointed by the Government from amongst persons who are in the service of the Republic and shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and functions of the Chairman and members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Chairman shall be the chief executive of the Board and shall be responsible for the efficient management, operation and development of the telegraphs and telephones.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other members shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or as may, from time to time, be assigned to them by the Government or the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Control, management and operation of the telegraphs and telephones</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The general control and supervision of the affairs of the telegraphs and telephones in Bangladesh shall vest in the Board which may exercise all such powers and do all acts and things as may be necessary for the efficient management, operation and development of the telegraphs and telephones.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall, in the discharge of its functions, act on commercial considerations with due regard to the public interest and shall be guided on the questions of policy by such general and special instructions as may, from time to time, be given by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of undertaking of the Board to a public limited company</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 5A.(1) Notwithstanding anything contained to the contrary in this Ordinance, the Government may, in public interest, by agreement, transfer the entire undertaking of the Board to a public limited company registered under the Companies Act, 1994, on such terms and conditions as may be specified in the agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) As soon as the entire undertaking of the Board has been transferred to the Company, the Government shall notify the fact in the official Gazette and shall, by the same notification, declare that the Board has been dissolved.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation: The word "undertaking of the Board" includes its officers and employees, business, projects, schemes, assets, rights, powers, license, authorities and privileges, its properties, movable and immovable, reserve funds investments, deposits, borrowings, liabilities and obligations of whatever nature, but does not include those related to the submarine cable as referred to in section 5B.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Upon dissolution of the Board, all officers and employees who were serving under the dissolved Board shall, notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the terms and conditions of service, be deemed to be officers or, as the case may be, employees of the Company on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the said Company or, until so determined, on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them in the dissolved Board prior to its dissolution :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that any such officer or employee may, after 24 (twenty four) months of the dissolution, exercise his option not to continue in the service of the Company.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If any officer or employee of the dissolved Board opts not to continue his service in the Company and intends to continue his service in the government, he shall be retained in the service of the government and the conditions of the service as were applicable to him shall continue to be applicable to him in such manner as if he never ceased to be in the service of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may, if deems necessary, by notification published in the official Gazette, make further provisions regarding absorption, posting on deputation, lien, retention in the service of the Government as well as other conditions of service, including the creation of supernumerary posts, in respect of officers and employees of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer of the undertaking of the Board under sub-section (1) or the dissolution thereof under sub-section (2) make, by notification published in the official Gazette, such order as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of undertaking of the Board related to the submarine cable</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5B. Notwithstanding anything contained to the contrary in this Ordinance, before the dissolution of the Board under section 5A, the Government may, by agreement, transfer such undertaking of the Board as is related to the submarine cable, including landing station (SEA-ME-WE 4), to a public limited company registered under the Companies Act, 1994, on such terms and conditions as may be specified in the agreement.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Special powers of the Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The affairs of the Board shall generally be conducted in accordance with the decision of the majority of its members but the Chairman may, where he considers it necessary in the interest of efficient management of the affairs of the telegraphs and telephones so to do, with the prior approval of the Government, over-rule such decision and, where he so over-rules, his decision shall be deemed to be the decision of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places and shall be conducted in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until regulations are made in this behalf, such meeting shall be held at such times and places and shall be conducted in such manner as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than four members, at least one of whom shall be a part-time member, shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to the provisions of section 6, all questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in the case of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman or, in his absence, by a member elected for the purpose by the members present from amongst themselves.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All decisions of the Board shall forthwith be transmitted to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (a)    to establish, maintain and operate, telegraphs and telephones in any part of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(aa) to prepare and execute development plans;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to exercise all powers of the Government under the Telegraph Act, 1885 (XIII of 1885), other than those under 4[ sections 4, 7, 8, 15 and 19B] of the said Act, and all powers of the telegraph authority under the said Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to associate with any international organisation engaged in any activity falling within the functions of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to establish and maintain institutes for the instruction and training of persons engaged or likely to be engaged in any activities connected with telegraphs and telephones;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to determine the structure and strength of its organisation, manage its affairs, plan its future investments and maintain its financial position in accordance with sound business and financial principles;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to operate and maintain, at all times, its facilities and properties and, from time to time, make all necessary renewal and repairs thereto in accordance with sound engineering, telegraph, telephone and business practices;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to carry out all technical and engineering projects and works;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to make all purchases of plant, machinery and stores either in the country or abroad in accordance with the procedure laid down by the Government and, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, also to dispose of stores and equipments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to discharge with the prior approval of the Government the functions specified in the First Schedule to this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to do all other matters and things connected with, or ancillary to, any of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers and other employees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Board may, for the efficient performance of its functions, appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Telegraph and telephone finance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The telegraph and telephone finance shall be administered separately from the general revenues of the Government and, for this purpose, separate accounts shall be maintained for the Board by the Bangladesh Bank and drawals from the accounts shall be made by the officers authorised by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of separate administration of telegraph and telephone finance under sub-section (1), the provisions of the Second Schedule shall apply and the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, amend or repeal any of the provisions of that Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Board shall provide for all administrative and operating expenses, depreciation of assets, interests on all loans and also build up a reserve fund by depositing a percentage of the surplus revenue after meeting the obligatory expenses.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board to review and revalue assets</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board shall, as soon as possible, initiate a review and revaluation of the assets of the Government in respect of telegraphs and telephones in accordance with sound financial principles and reconstruct the capital structure and financial obligations of the assets in accordance with the same principles and shall carry out such revaluation not often than every five years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowing power</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Board may, with the approval of the Government, borrow funds from internal source or from an external agency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Board shall, by such date in each year as may be directed by the Government, prepare the capital and revenue budgets of the Board and submit to the Government along with necessary statements and clarifications for further processing of the budget.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Board shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as may be directed by the Government in consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh, hereinafter referred to as the Auditor-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Auditor-General in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (2), the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in that behalf, shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Government held and controlled by the Board and may examine the Chairman or any member, officer or other employee of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Auditor-General shall submit his annual audit report to the President and forward a copy thereof to the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may, at any time, require the Auditor-General to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Board for the efficient management of its financial matters.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Board shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, submit to the Government a report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall submit to the Government at such times and intervals as the Government may specify-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) such returns, accounts, statements, estimates and statistics as may be required by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) information and comments asked for by the Government on any specific subject;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) copies of documents required by the Government for examination or any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Board may, by general or special order, delegate to the Chairman or any member or officer any of its functions subject to such conditions a may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, make regulations to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) Upon the constitution of the Board under section 3, the Telegraph and Telephone Board Ordinance, 1975 (Ord. XLVII of 1975), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance, shall stand repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal under sub-section (1),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Telegraph and Telephone Board established under the said Ordinance, hereinafter referred to as the dissolved Board, shall stand dissolved;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, and all properties, movable and immovable, including lands, buildings, works, workshops, machinery, leases, leaseholds, licences, cash and bank balances, funds and investments of the dissolved Board and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Government for the purposes of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all debts, obligations and liabilities incurred, all contracts entered into and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with or for the dissolved Board immediately before its dissolution shall be deemed to have been incurred, entered into or engaged to be done by, with or for Government for the purposes of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all rates, charges and fees levied by the dissolved Board shall, until they are varied by the Board, continue to be levied at the same rate at which they were levied immediately before the constitution of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the dissolved Board immediately before its dissolution shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by or against the Government and shall be proceeded or otherwise dealt with accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) (i) every person in the service of the Republic who were required to serve the dissolved Board under clause (e) of section 7 of the said Ordinance shall stand transferred to the Board on the same terms and conditions of service as were applicable to them immediately before their transfer to the dissolved Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) every person other than those mentioned in sub-clause (i) who were serving under the dissolved Board shall, notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the terms and conditions of service, stand transferred to the Board and they shall be deemed to be officers or, as the case may be, employees of the Government appointed by it on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government or, until so determined, on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them in the dissolved Board:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that any such person may, within such time as may be specified by the Government, exercise his option not to continue in the service.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “three” was substituted for the word “two” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Telegraph and Telephone Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. III of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Sections 5A and 5B were inserted by section 2 of The Bangladesh Telegraph and Telephone Board (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act. No. XXV of 2009) (with effect from 1st June, 2008).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clauses (a) and (aa) were substituted for clause (a) by section 2 of the Bangladesh Telegraph and Telephone Board (Amendment) Act, 1995 (Act No. XVI of 1995)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words and figures “sections 4, 7, 8, 15 and 19B” were substituted for the words and figures “section 7 and 15 ” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Telegraph and Telephone Board (Amendment) Act, 1995 (Act No. XVI of 1995)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
542	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE BANGLADESH TRAVEL AGENCIES (REGISTRATION AND CONTROL) ORDINANCE, 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH TRAVEL AGENCIES (REGISTRATION AND CONTROL) ORDINANCE, 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLVIII OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[12th October, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the registration and control of travel agencies in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the registration and control of travel agencies in Bangladesh and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Travel Agencies (Registration and Control) Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Registration Authority” means an officer authorised by Government by notification in the official Gazette to exercise all or any of the powers of the Registration Authority under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Registration Certificate” means a certificate issued by the Registration Authority to carry on the business of travel agency;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “travel agency” means the business of making travel arrangements that is, the work of providing transportation, residence and such other facilities as are connected with the travel on the basis of commission charges.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition against establishing or continuing a travel agency without registration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. No travel agency shall be established or continued except in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Application for registration, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Any person intending to establish a travel agency and any person intending that a travel agency already in existence should be continued as such, shall, in the prescribed form and on payment of the prescribed fee, make an application to the Registration Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Registration Authority may, on receipt of the application make such enquiries as it considers necessary, and either grant the application, or, for reasons to be recorded in writing, reject it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If the Registration Authority grants the application, it shall issue, in the prescribed form, a Registration Certificate to the applicant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and continuance of travel agency</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) A travel agency not in existence on the coming into force of this Ordinance shall not be established except after a Registration Certificate has been issued under sub-section (3) of section 4 to the travel agency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A travel agency already in existence shall not be continued for more than six months from the date on which this Ordinance comes into force, unless an application for its registration has, within thirty days of such date, been made under sub-section (1) of section 4.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A travel agency already in existence, in respect of which an application under sub-section (1) of section 4 has been made within thirty days of the coming into force of this Ordinance, may, notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), continue pending the disposal of the application, but shall close down immediately if the Registration Certificate under sub-section (3) of section 4 is refused.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cancellation of the Registration Certificate of a travel agency</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. If, after making such enquiries as it may think fit, the Registration Authority is satisfied that a registered travel agency has been responsible for any irregularity in business dealings or for any maladministration in the conduct of its affairs or has failed to comply with the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder, it may, by order in writing, cancel the Registration Certificate of the travel agency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. If the Registration Authority rejects an application for registration under section 4, or cancels the Registration Certificate under section 6, the applicant may, within thirty days from the date of the order of the Registration Authority, prefer an appeal to the Government and the order made by the Government shall be final and given effect to by the Registration Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. Any person who contravenes any of the provisions of this Ordinance, or any rule or order made thereunder shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to Taka two thousand, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. No Court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Ordinance except upon a complaint in writing made by the Registration Authority, or by an officer authorised by it in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) prescribing the information and documents to be furnished by an applicant for obtaining Registration Certificate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) prescribing the forms to be used under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) prescribing the procedure to be followed on applications and other proceedings under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) prescribing the fees payable in respect of Registration Certificate issued under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) prescribing the conditions of Registration Certificate issued under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) regulating the conduct of travel agency in their business and prescribing a code of conduct for travel agents.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
543	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE CHITTAGONG DIVISION DEVELOPMENT BOARD ORDINANCE, 1976</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE CHITTAGONG DIVISION DEVELOPMENT BOARD ORDINANCE, 1976</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXXIX OF 1976).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[16th November, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Development Board for the Chittagong Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Development Board for the Chittagong Division and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and extent</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Chittagong Division Development Board Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Chittagong Division except the areas within the Chittagong Hill Tracts and the Chittagong  Municipality.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Chittagong Division Development Board established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Chittagong Division” does not include the areas within the Chittagong Hill Tracts and the Chittagong  Municipality;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Board to be called the Chittagong Division Development Board for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 4. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Minister, to be nominated by the President, who shall also be its Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) two members of Parliament, to be nominated by the President, who shall also be its Vice-Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) one member of Parliament from each sub-division in the Chittagong Division, to be nominated by the President, by rotation, for a term of one year;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the Commissioner, Chittagong Division, ex-officio, who shall also be its Secretary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the Deputy Commissioners of the districts in the Chittagong Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) such other members, not exceeding one-fifth of the total number of members of Parliament of Chittagong Division, as may be nominated by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All members, other than the ex-officio members, shall hold office during the pleasure of the President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman shall be the chief executive of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman and other members shall perform such functions as the Board may assign to them from time to time or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of a vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The head office of the Board shall be located at the headquarters of the Chittagong Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, establish offices at any other place in the Chittagong Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Save as hereinafter provided, the Board shall regulate the procedure for its meetings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Meetings of the Board shall be held on such date and at such time and place as may be determined by the Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that at least one meeting of the Board shall be held in every two months.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than 2[ ten] members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in the case of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman or, in his absence, by a member authorised in writing by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[Omitted]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. [Consultative Committee.- Omitted by section 5 of the Development Boards Laws Amendment Act, 1980 (Act No. XIV of 1980).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to prepare projects and schemes for the development of Chittagong Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to approve of projects and schemes involving not more than 3[ twenty-five lakh] Taka each and to submit other projects and schemes to the Government for approval;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to execute approved projects and schemes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to supervise execution of approved projects and schemes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to advance funds, on such terms and conditions as it may determine, for the execution of development schemes sponsored by various development agencies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to grant loans, on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed, to any person for setting up or development of any small-scale or cottage industry or project;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to do such other acts and things as may be necessary or convenient to be done in connection with, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Execution of projects and schemes through other agencies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in section 8, the Board may require any local authority or Government agency within whose jurisdiction any area covered by any project or scheme approved under section 8 lies to execute the project or scheme, or any portion thereof, in consultation with the Board, and the expenditure incurred on the execution of any such project or scheme or portion thereof shall be borne as may be agreed to between the Board and the local authority or Government agency or, in the event of disagreement, as may be determined by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Board may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no post shall be created by the Board without the prior approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1)There shall be formed a Fund to be known as the Chittagong Division Development Board Fund which shall vest in the Board and shall be utilised by the Board to meet charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance, including the payment of salaries and other remuneration to the officers and other employees of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chittagong Division Development Board Fund shall comprise-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a non-lapsable revolving fund, not exceeding Taka five crore, to be granted by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans raised by the Board with the sanction of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) receipts from any other source.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Board shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a budget in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit and accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Board shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General) in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (2), the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Board and may examine the Chairman or any member, officer or employee of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Auditor-General shall, as soon as possible after completion of the audit, send to the Board his audit report and the Board shall forward it, with its comments thereon, to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Board shall take steps forthwith to remedy any defects or irregularities pointed out in the audit report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Board shall submit to the Government, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, a report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall submit to the Government at such time and at such interval as the Government may specify-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) such returns, accounts, statements, estimates and statistics as may be required by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) information and comments asked for by the Government on any specific subject;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) copies of documents required by the Government for examination or any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of entry</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Chairman or any member, or any other person authorised by the Chairman in this behalf, may, with or without assistants or workmen, enter into or upon any land in order-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to make any inspection, survey, experiment, valuation or inquiry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to take level of such land;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to dig or bore into the sub-soil;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to set out boundaries and intended lines of work;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to mark such levels, boundaries and lines by placing marks and cutting trenches; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to do any other thing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">whenever it is necessary to do so for any of the purposes of this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such entry shall be made without giving the occupier of the land at least twenty-four hours' notice of the intention to make such entry.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compulsory acquisition of land for the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. Any land required by the Board for carrying out its functions under this Ordinance shall be deemed to be needed for a public purpose and such land may be requisitioned or acquired for the Board by the Government or the Deputy Commissioner, as the case may be, in accordance with any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Board may, by general or special order, delegate to the Chairman or any member or officer any of its functions subject to such conditions as it may think fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to issue directions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Government may, from time to time, issue directions to the Board to take such measures as it considers necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance; and the Board shall comply with all such directions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Board, the Chairman or any member, officer or employee of the Board for anything done or intended to be done in good faith under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. No provision of law relating to the winding up of bodies corporate shall apply to the Board, and the Board shall not be wound up except by order of the Government and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Board may, with the approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters not required to be provided for by rules and for which provision is necessary or expedient for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Section 4 was substituted by section 5 of the Development Boards Laws Amendment Act, 1980 (Act No. XIV of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “ten” was substituted for the word “four” by section 5 of the Development Boards Laws Amendment Act, 1980 (Act No. XIV of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “twenty-five lakh” were substituted for the words “ten lakh” by section 5 of the Development Boards Laws Amendment Act, 1980 (Act No. XIV of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
544	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE CHITTAGONG HILL TRACTS DEVELOPMENT BOARD ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE CHITTAGONG HILL TRACTS DEVELOPMENT BOARD ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXVII OF 1976).[21st October, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Development Board for the Chittagong Hill Tracts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Development Board for the Chittagong Hill Tracts and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Chittagong Hill Tracts Development Board Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Chittagong Hill Tracts Development Board established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Vice-Chairman” means the Vice-Chairman of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Board to be called the Chittagong Hill Tracts Development Board for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. 1[ (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Deputy Commissioners of the districts of Chittagong Hill Tracts 2[ , Bandarban and Khagrachari], ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) 3[ four] full-time members to be appointed by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) One of the full-time members, to be specified by the Government, shall act as the Secretary of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Full-time members shall hold office on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman shall be the Chief executive of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman and other members shall perform such functions as the Board may assign to them from time to time or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of a vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The head office of the Board shall be located at Rangamati.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, establish offices at any other place in the Chittagong Hill Tracts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Save as hereinafter provided, the Board shall regulate the procedure for its meetings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Meetings of the Board shall be held on such date and at such time and place as may be determined by the Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that at least one meeting of the Board shall be held in every two months.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than three members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in the case of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman or, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Consultative Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) There shall be a Consultative Committee consisting of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Chairman of the Board who shall also be its Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the three Rajas or their nominees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) one representative of the Headmen from each subdivision in the 4[ districts of Chittagong Hill Tracts 5[ , Bandarban and Khagrachari]], to be nominated by the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) one Chairman of the Union Parishad from each subdivision 6[ of the districts of Chittagong Hill Tracts 7[ , Bandarban and Khagrachari]], to be nominated by the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) such other members, official or non-official, as may be nominated by the Chairman with the approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The nominated members of the Consultative Committee shall hold office for such period, and the members thereof shall be paid such travel costs for attending meetings, as may be determined by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Board shall regulate the procedure for the meetings of the Consultative Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Consultative Committee shall advise the Board in the formulation and execution of its projects and schemes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to prepare projects and schemes for the development of Chittagong Hill Tracts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (b) to approve of projects and schemes involving not more than twenty-five lakh Taka each for the thana headquarters, unions and villages;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to execute approved projects and schemes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to supervise execution of approved projects and schemes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to advance funds, on such terms and conditions as it may determine, for the execution of development schemes sponsored by various development agencies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to do such other acts and things as may be necessary or convenient to be done in connection with, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Execution of projects and schemes through other agencies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9.
