and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) every person in the service of the Republic serving in, or in connection with the affairs of the superseded Bureau shall, if so required by the Government, serve under the Bureau established by this Ordinance, on such terms and conditions, not being to his disadvantage as the Government may, in consultation with the Bureau, determine; and the person so serving under the Bureau shall, except in the matter of dismissal, removal or reduction in rank, be subject to the power and control of the Bureau in the same manner and to the same extent as any officer or employee appointed by the Bureau.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Section 5 was substituted by section 2 of the Export Promotion Bureau (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Directors-General” by section 3 of the Export Promotion Bureau (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Directors-General” by section 4 of the Export Promotion Bureau (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Directors-General” by section 5 of the Export Promotion Bureau (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Directors-General” by section 5 of the Export Promotion Bureau (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
552	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FILM CLUBS (REGISTRATION AND REGULATION) ACT 1980</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FILM CLUBS (REGISTRATION AND REGULATION) ACT 1980</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXVIII OF 1980).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[15th July, 1980]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the registration and regulation of film clubs. WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the registration and regulation of film clubs and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Film Clubs (Registration and Regulation) Act 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “authority” means the authority constituted under section 3 of the Censorship of Films Act 1963 (XVIII of 1963);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “certified film” has the meaning assigned to it in the said Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “film” means a cinema tograph film;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “film club” means any club, society, or organisation, by whatever name called, established for the purpose of exhibiting films to its members, and includes a federation or association of such film clubs;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>No film club to function without registration</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. No film club shall function as such unless it is registered in accordance with the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Registration of film clubs</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) A film club shall, before it commences its functions as such, make an application, in the prescribed form and on payment of prescribed fee, accompanied by a copy of its constitution, to the authority for its registration.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A film club shall not be entitled to registration under this Act unless the constitution thereof provides for the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the address of the head office of the club;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the objects for which the club has been formed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the conditions of membership of the club;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the conditions under which films shall be exhibited;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the sources of income of the club;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the custody of the fund of the club;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the annual audit of the fund of the club and the manner of such audit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If the authority is satisfied that the film club has complied with all the requirements of sub-sections (1) and (2), it shall register the film club in the prescribed register and issue a certificate of registration in the prescribed form.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If the authority finds that the film club has not complied with all the requirements of sub-sections (1) and (2), it shall, by an order in writing, reject the application.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A film club in existence immediately before the commencement of this Act shall not continue to function as such for more than three months from the date of such commencement unless, within thirty days of such commencement, an application for its registration has been made under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) If an application of an existing film club for registration is rejected, the club shall cease to function as such from the date on which the order of the authority rejecting the application is communicated to it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Reports, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Every registered film club shall furnish to the authority-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) within three months of the close of each year, a report on the activities of the club during that year together with its audited accounts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) such statements, reports and records as the authority may require from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The authority, or any officer duly authorised by it in this behalf, may at all reasonable times inspect the books of accounts and other records of a film club.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Period of validity of registration</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) A certificate of registration issued under section 4 shall remain valid for a period of two years from the date of issue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A certificate of registration may be renewed for a period of two years at a time on payment of the prescribed fee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Exhibition of films</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) A registered film club shall, at least seven days before the exhibition of any film, inform in writing the authority and the Deputy Commissioner of the district where the film will be exhibited of the place, date and time of such exhibition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A registered film club may exhibit a film supplied by any foreign diplomatic mission in Bangladesh only if the request for supplying such film has been made to the mission with the prior approval of the authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Cancellation of registration</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. If, at any time, the authority has reason to believe that a registered film club is acting in contravention of its constitution or has contravened any of the provisions of this Act or the rules made thereunder, then, without prejudice to the provisions of section 10, it may, after giving the club an opportunity of being heard, cancel its registration.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appeal</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Any film club aggrieved by an order of the authority under section 4 or section 8 may, within thirty days from the date on which the order is communicated to it, prefer an appeal to the Government, and the decision of the Government on such appeal shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) If any film club contravenes any of the provisions of this Act or any rule made thereunder, every member or office-bearer of the council, committee or body, by whatever name called, to which, by the constitution of the club, its executive functions and the management of its affairs are entrusted shall, unless he proves that the contravention took place without his knowledge or consent, be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand taka, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No Court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Act except upon a complaint in writing made by the authority or by any officer authorised by it in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
553	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE FINANCE ACT, 1979   </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE FINANCE ACT, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. V OF 1979).[30th  June, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purposes hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Finance Act, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act, 1931 (XVI of 1931), and the declaration made thereunder, this Act shall, except as otherwise provided, come into force on the first day of July, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XI of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The following amendments shall be made in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 2, in clause (6A), in sub-clause (a), after the words “payment made by a company”, the comma, words and figure “, including a company the income, profits and gains of which is exempted from payment of taxes under section 14A” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 4, after sub-section (2D), the following new sub-section (2E) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(2E) where, in any previous year the assessee has incurred expenses and he offers no explanation about the nature or source of the money from which the expenses were met or the explanation offered by him is not, in the opinion of the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes, satisfactory, the amount of expenses may be deemed to be the income of the assessee for such previous year.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 10,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in sub-section (2), after clause (vibb), the following new clauses (vic) and (vid) shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(vic) an investment allowance equivalent to twenty per cent of the cost of a passenger vessel or a fishing trawler referred to in clause (vibb) in respect of the year in which the passenger vessel or the fishing trawler is first put to use for public utility;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vid) in respect of depreciation of ships, other than ships ordinarily plying on inland waters, registered in Bangladesh and brought into use in Bangladesh for the first time on any day between the first day of July, 1979, and the thirtieth day of June, 1983, being the property of the assessee, a sum equivalent to 40 per cent in the first year, 30 per cent in the second year and 30 per cent in the third year on the original cost to the assessee, notwithstanding anything contrary contained in clause (vi):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the ship, other than the ship ordinarily plying on inland waters, in respect of which the depreciation is claimed, fulfils such specifications as may be specified in this behalf by the Government by notification in the official Gazette;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the prescribed particulars have been duly furnished;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) where the full effect cannot be given to such allowance in any year owing to there being no profits or gains chargeable for that year, or owing to the profits or gains chargeable being less than the allowance, then, subject to the provisions of clause (b) of the proviso to sub-section (2) of section 24, the allowance or part of the allowance to which effect has not been given, as the case may be, shall be added to the amount of the allowance for depreciation for the following year and deemed to be the part of that allowance, or, if there is no such allowance for that year, be deemed to be the allowance for that year and so on for succeeding years; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the aggregate of all such allowances made under this Act shall, in no case, exceed the original cost to the assessee of the ship other than the ship ordinarily plying on inland waters:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the ship, other than the ship ordinarily plying on inland waters, to which the depreciation at 40%, 30% and 30% has been allowed shall not be entitled to the allowances referred to in clause (vi);”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in sub-section(4), in clause (e), for the full stop at the end a semi-colon shall be substituted and thereafter the following new clause (f) shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(f) any allowance in respect of such expenditure on publicity and advertisement as may be prescribed.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p justify;">Amendment of Ben Act V of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In the Amusements Tax Act, 1922 (Ben. Act V of 1922), CHAPTER I shall stand repealed on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act XXXII of 1934</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The amendments set out in the First Schedule to this Act shall be made in the Tariff Act, 1934 (XXXII of 1934).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act I of 1944</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The following amendments shall be made in the Excises and Salt Act, 1944 (I of 1944), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) throughout the Act, except in clause (b) of section 2, for the words “National Board of Revenue” the word “Board” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) for section 2 the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“ 2. Definitions.- In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “admission” includes admission as a spectator or as one of an audience, and admission for the purpose of amusement by taking part in an entertainment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Board” means the National Board of Revenue constituted under the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 76 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “broker” or “commission agent” means a person who, in the ordinary course of business, makes contracts for the sale or purchase of excisable goods for others;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “charge for admission” includes any payment made by a person who having been admitted to one part of a place of entertainment is subsequently admitted to another part thereof, for admission to which a payment involving a duty or a higher rate of duty is required, and any payment for seats or other accommodation in a place of entertainment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “curing” includes wilting, drying, fermenting and any process for rendering an unmanufactured product fit for marketing or manufacture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “distributor” means a person appointed by a manufacturer in or for a specified area to purchase excisable goods from him for sale to a wholesale dealer in that area;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “enterprise” includes a company, firm, establishment, institution, club or any other association of persons by whatever name called;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “entertainment” includes any cinema show, theatrical performance, musical performance, amusement, exhibition, show or performance in any other manner or by whatever name called, games and sports to which persons are admitted on payment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “Excise Officer” means any officer of the Excise Department or any person invested by the Board with any of the powers of an Excise officer under this Act or the rules made thereunder;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) “excisable goods” means goods specified in Part I of the First Schedule as being subject to a duty of excise and includes salt;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) “excisable services” means services, facilities, utilities and entertainments specified in Part II of the First Schedule as being subject to a duty of excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) “factory” means any premises, including the precincts thereof, wherein or in any part of which excisable goods other than salt are manufactured, or wherein or in any part of which any manufacturing process connected with the production of these goods is being carried on or is ordinarily carried on;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       “manufacture” includes any process incidental or ancillary to the completion of a manufactured product and any process of remanufacture, re-making, re-conditioning or repair and the process of packing or re-packing such product; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in relation to tobacco, includes the preparation of cigarettes, cigars, cheroots, biris, cigarette or pipe or hookah tobacco, chewing tobacco or snuff; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in relation to salt, includes collection, removal, preparation, steeping, evaporation, boiling, or any one or more of these processes, the separation or purification of salt obtained in the manufacture of saltpetre, the separation of salt from earth or other substance so as to produce alimentary salt and the excavation or removal of natural saline deposits or efflorescence; and the word “manufacturer” shall be construed accordingly and shall include not only a person who employs hired labour in the production or manufacture of excisable goods, but also any person who engages in their production or manufacture on his own account if those goods are intended for sale; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) in respect of gold and silver and products thereof, also any person dealing in gold and silver and products thereof who, whether or not he carries out any process of manufacture himself or through his employees or relatives, gets any process of manufacture carried out on his behalf by any person who is not in his employ, and any person so dealing in gold and silver and products thereof shall be deemed to have manufactured for all purposes of this Act all products of gold or silver in which he deals in any capacity whatever;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) “sale” and “purchase”, with their grammatical variations and cognate expressions, mean any transfer of the possession of goods by one person to another in the ordinary course of trade or business for cash or deferred payment or other consideration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) “saltpetre” includes rasi, sajji, and all other substances manufactured from saline earth, and kharinun and every form of sulphate or carbonate of soda;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q)        “salt factory” includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) a place used or intended to be used in the manufacture of salt and all embankments, reservoirs, condensing and evaporating pans, buildings and waste places situated within the limits of such place as defined from time to time by the Collector of Excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) all drying grounds and storage platforms and store-houses appertaining to any such place;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) land on which salt is spontaneously produced; and a “private salt factory” is one not solely owned or not solely worked by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r) “wholesale dealer” means a person who buys or sells excisable goods wholesale for the purpose of trade or manufacture, and includes a broker or commission agent who, in addition to making contracts for the sale or purchase of excisable goods for others, stocks such goods belonging to others as an agent for the purpose of sale.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 4, after sub-section (3), the following new sub-section (4) shall be added on such date as the Government may, by notifications in the official Gazette, appoint, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(4) Where under this Act any entertainment is subject to a duty dependent on the charge for admission to such entertainment and-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the proprietor or enterprise of an entertainment admits any person to any place of entertainment as a spectator or as an audience for the purpose of amusement by taking part in it without any payment or on payment of an amount less than the amount normally charged for admission thereto, the duty shall nevertheless be levied and collected on the amount which would have been charged for such entertainment had it not been provided free of charge or at a concessional rate; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the amount with reference to which the duty shall be payable shall be the amount charged for admission to an entertainment, exclusive of the duty and any other tax, which a spectator or as audience pays or would have to pay but for any special relation ship between the parties in question.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- For the purpose of clause (a),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “proprietor” in relation to any entertainment, includes any person responsible for the management thereof; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in case there are different classes of seats in the entertainment ‘place of entertainment' means the class to which such person is admitted.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 33, in clause (b), for the words and comma “Deputy Collector, Assistant Collector or Superintendent of Excise” the words and comma “Deputy Collector of Excise, Assistant Collector of Excise or Superintendent of Excise” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 37, in sub-section (2), after clause (xi), the following new clauses</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xia) and (xib) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(xia) provide for the supply and use of stamps or stamped tickets or for the stamping of tickets sent to be stamped; and for securing the defacement of stamps when used; for controlling the use of barriers or mechanical contrivances in use for admission of persons to the entertainments; for the checking of admissions and for the renewal of damaged or spoiled stamps;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xib) provide for the maintenance of books of accounts, registers, bills and tickets and for the submission of returns and statements;”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) the First Schedule shall be amended in the manner set out in the Second Schedule to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act X of 1950</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. In the Estate Duty Act, 1950 (X of 1950), in section 25A, in clause (3), in the proviso, for the words “five lakh” the words “ten lakh” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act III of 1951</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. In the Sales Tax Act, 1951 (III of 1951), in section 22, for the figure and letter “38A” the figure and letters “38AA” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act XV of 1963</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The following amendments shall be made in the Wealth-tax Act, 1963 (XV of 1963), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 2, in clause (e), sub-clause (iii) shall, be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 5, in sub-section (1), in clause (xi), for the full stop at the end a semi-colon shall be substituted and thereafter the following new clause (xii) shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(xii) a house owned and occupied by an assessee for the purpose of his own residence, subject to the following limits, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) where the value of such house does not …………the whole of such value; exceed Taka ten lakh,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) where the value of such house exceeds Taka ten lakh, ………..Taka ten lakh.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) for the Schedule the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act IV of 1969</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The following amendments shall be made in the Customs Act, 1969 (IV of 1969), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 30, in sub-section (2), after the words “of this section”, the comma, word and figure, “, section 31” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) for section 31 the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“31. Date for determination of export duty.- The rate of duty applicable to, and the rate of exchange for computation of the value of, any goods exported shall be the rate of duty or, as the case may be, the rate of exchange prevailing on the date of the delivery of the bill of export under section 131:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the export of any goods is permitted without a bill of export or in anticipation of the delivery of such a bill, the rate of duty applicable to, and the rate exchange for the computation of the value of, such goods shall be the rate of duty or, as the case may be, the rate of exchange applicable on the date on which loading of the goods on the outgoing conveyance commences.”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income-tax and Super-tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-sections (2), (3), (4) and (5), in making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1979,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) income-tax shall be charged at the rate specified in Part 1 on the Third Schedule, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the rates of super-tax shall, for the purpose of section 55 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), be those specified in Part II of the Third Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1979,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any income chargeable under the head “Salaries” or any income chargeable under the head “Interest on Securities” the income-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of income-tax payable according to the rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Ordinance, 1978 (XXI of 1978), on his total income the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) where the total income of a company includes any profits and gains from life insurance business, the super-tax payable by the company shall be reduced by an amount equal to 12.5 per cent of that part of its total income which consists of such inclusion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1979, where the assessee is a co-operative society, the tax shall be payable at the rate specified in paragraph A of Part I, or paragraph B of Part I and paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule as if the assessee were a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of the said Part II applied, whichever treatment is more beneficial to the assessee:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in calculating for the purposes of this sub-section, the amount of income-tax at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I of the Third Schedule, no deduction in respect of any allowance or sums referred to in the proviso to the said paragraph shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) (a) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1979, where the total income of an assessee not being a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule does not apply, includes any profits and gains derived from the export of goods out of Bangladesh, income-tax and super-tax, if any, payable by him in respect of such profits and gains shall, subject to the provisions of clauses (b) and (c), be reduced by an amount computed in the manner specified hereunder:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amount.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Where the goods exported abroad had not been manufactured by the assessee who exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30 per cent of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)   and where the export sales during the  relevant year exceed the export sales of the preceding year:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Plus an additional 1 per cent for every increase of 10 per cent in export sales over those of the preceding year, subject to an overall maximum of 40 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)   and where the export sales during the relevant year do not exceed the export sales of the preceding year:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Minus 1 per cent for every decrease of 10 per cent in export sales over those of the preceding year, subject to an overall minimum of 20 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Where the goods exported had been manufactured by the assessee who had exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Where the export sales do not exceed 10 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Nil.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Where the export sales exceed 10 per cent but do not exceed 20 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30 per cent of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) where the export sales exceed 20 per cent but do not exceed 30 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">40 per cent of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) where the export sales exceed 30 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">50 per cent of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)   Nothing contained in clause (a) shall apply in respect of the following goods or class of goods, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)    tea,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)   raw jute,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)  jute manufacture,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)  raw hides and skin and wet-blue leather,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)   such other goods as may be notified by  the National Board of Revenue from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) The National Board of Revenue may make rules providing for the computation of profits and the tax attributable to export sales and for such other matters as may be necessary to give effect to the provisions of this sub-section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) In cases to which section 17 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), applies the tax chargeable shall be determined as provided in that section but with reference to the rates imposed by sub-section (1), and in accordance, where applicable, with the provisions of sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) For the purposes of making deduction of tax under section 18 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), the rates specified in Part I and Part II of the Third Schedule shall apply as respects the year beginning on the first day of July, 1979, and ending on the thirtieth day of June, 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) For the purposes of this section and of the rates of tax imposed thereby, the expression “total income” means total income as determined for the purposes of income-tax or super-tax, as the case may be, in accordance with the provisions of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922); and the expression “Public company” means a company-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)    in which not less than fifty per cent of the shares are held by the  Government, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)           whose shares were the subject of dealings in a registered stock exchange in the taxable territories at any time during the previous year and remained listed on the stock exchange till the close of that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
554	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ACT 1980</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FINANCE ACT 1980</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXIII OF 1980).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[30th June, 1980]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws.WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to live effect to the Financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purposes here in after appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Finance Act, 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act, 1931 (XVI of 1931), and the declaration made thereunder, this Act, shall, except as otherwise provided, come into force on the first day of July, 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendment of Act VI of 1898</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In the Post Office Act, 1898 (VI of 1898) for the First Schedule thereto the contents of First Schedule to this Act shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act II of 1899</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In the Stamp Act 1899 (II of 1899), for Schedule (1) thereto the Schedule set out in the Second Schedule to this Act shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendment of Act XI of 1922</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The following amendments shall be made in the Income tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 2, in clause (6C), for the semi colon at the end a comma shall be substituted and thereafter the following shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“receipts in the nature of compensation or damages for cancellation or termination of contracts and licences by the Government or any person, cancellation of indebtedness which makes any debtor taxable, goodwill money, salami or premia receivable on account of all leases or transfer of any business;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 4, in sub section (3),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in clause (via), the words and comma “not being winning from lotteries,” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) In clause (xii),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) after sub-clause (f), a new sub-clause (ff) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(ff) in respect of a building the erection of which is begun and completed at any time between the first day of July, 1980 and the thirtieth day of June, 1985 (both days inclusive) and the building is intended to be, and is actually, used for residential purposes only, for a period of five years from the date of such completion, subject to the following limits, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in a case where annual value off such building does not exceed twelve thousand Taka The whole of such value;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in a case where annual value of such building exceeds twelve thousand Taka Twelve thousand Taka:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where an assessee claims exemption in respect of more than one such building the exemption under this sub clause shall be restricted to such portion of the aggregate annual value of such building as does not exceed twelve thousand Taka;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in sub clause (g), for the full stop at the end a semi-colon shall be substituted and thereafter the following new sub clause (h) shall be added, namely:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(h) in respect of a building the erection of which is begun and completed at any time between the first day of July, 1980 and the thirtieth day of June, 1985 (both day inclusive) and which is intended to be, and is actually, used for residential purposes only, for a period of five years from the date of such completion, subject to the condition that the plinth area of the building is not more than one thousand square feet. The exemption under this sub clause shall also apply in the case of housing companies, societies and estates where the construction comprises bungalows, flats, apartments or units (hereinafter referred to as units) each containing plinth area of not more than one thousand square feet provided the construction comprises not less than twenty five units.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) in clause (xiib), in the proviso, for the words “five thousand taka” the words “ten thousand taka” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 5A, in sub section (3), in the Explanation, in clause (b), after the words “service as”, the words “Appellate or Inspecting” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) In section 7, in sub-section (1), in the third proviso, for the words “two thousand and four hundred taka”, “one thousand and two hundred taka” and “nine hundred taka” the words “three thousand and six hundred Taka”, “one thousand and eight hundred Taka” and “one thousand and five hundred Taka” shall respectively, be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 9, in sub-section (1), in clause (iv) after the words “mortgage or other capital charge”, the words “for purposes of extension or reconstruction or improvement” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) in section 9A, in sub-section (2) in clause (v), after the words “mortgage or other capital charge”, the words “for purposes of reclamation or improvement” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) in section 10, in sub-section (4), for clause (e) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(e) any allowance in respect of expenditure on entertainment in excess of the amounts specified below:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendment of Act I of 1944</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The following amendments shall be made in the Excises and Salt Act, 1944 (I of 1944), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) for section 11 the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“11. Recovery of sums due to Government.- (1) When under this Act or the rules made thereunder a duty is payable to the Government by any person or a penalty is adjudged against any person or a notice or demand is served upon any person calling for the payment of any amount unpaid which may be payable by way of duty, penalty or under any bond or other instrument executed under the rules and such duty, penalty or other sum is not paid within the time it was required to be paid, an Excise Officer empowered by the Board may at any time-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) deduct or require any other Excise Officer to deduct the amount so payable from any money owing to such person or due which may be in the hands or at the disposal or under the control of such Officer or of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) require, by a notice in writing, any person owing any money to the person from whom such duty or penalty or any other sum is recoverable or due, to pay to such Officer the amount specified is the notice, or the whole of such money if it is less than the amount so recoverable or due, within seven days of the receipt of the notice or within such longer time as may be allowed by such Officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) recover such amount by attachment and sale of excisable goods or any plant, machinery and equipment used for the manufacture of such goods or any other goods in the factory or bonded warehouse or in any premises where any excisable services are provided or rendered;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) stop removal of any excisable goods from such factory, bonded warehouse or premises till such amount is paid or recovered in full; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) require any officer of customs to recover such amount by detaining and selling any goods belonging to such person which are under the control of the customs authorities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the amount is not recovered from such person in the manner provided in sub section (1), the Excise Officer may prepare a certificate signed by him specifying the amount due from the person liable to pay the same and send it to the Collector of the district in which such person resides or owns any property or conducts his business and the said Collector shall, on receiving such certificate, proceed to recover the amount specified in the certificate as a public demand or as if it were an arrear of land revenue.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 12A, in sub section (2), after the words “any goods”, the words “or services” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in CHAPTER III, for the heading the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“APPOINTMENT OF EXCISE OFFICERS AND THEIR POWERS AND DUTIES”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) for section 13 the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“13. Appointment of Excise Officers.- For the purposes of the Act and the rules made thereunder, the Board may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint, in relation to any area specified in the notification, any person to be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Collector of Excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a Collector of Excise (Appeal);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) an Additional Collector of Excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) a Joint Collector of Excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) a Deputy Collector of Excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) an Assistant Collector of Excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) a Superintendent of Excise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) an Excise Officer with any other designation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13A. Powers and duties of Excise Officers.- An Excise Officer appointed under section 13 shall exercise such powers and discharge such duties as are conferred or imposed on him by or under this Act; and he shall also be competent to exercise all powers and discharge all duties conferred or imposed upon any officer subordinate to him:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, notwithstanding anything contained in this Act or the rules, the Board may, by general or special order, impose such limitations or conditions in the exercise of such powers and discharge of such duties as it thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13B. Delegation of powers.- The Board may, by notification in the official Gazette, and subject to such limitations or conditions, if any, as may be specified therein, empower by name or designation-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any Additional Collector of Excise or any Joint Collector of Excise to exercise any of the powers of a Collector of Excise under this Act or the rules;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any Deputy Collector of Excise to exercise any of the powers of an Additional Collector of Excise or a Joint Collector of Excise under this Act or the rules;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any Assistant Collector of Excise to exercise any of the powers of a Deputy Collector of Excise or a Joint Collector of Excise under this Act or the rules;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) any other Excise Officer to exercise any of the powers of an Assistant Collector of Excise under this Act or the rules.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13C. Entrustment of functions of the Excise Officers to certain other officers.- The Board may, by notification in the official Gazette, entrust, either conditionally or unconditionally, any functions of any Excise Officer under this Act or the rules to any officer of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13D. Power to arrest.- (1) Any Excise Officer duly empowered by the Board in this behalf may arrest any person whom he has reason to believe to be liable to punishment under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person accused or reasonably suspected of committing an offence under this Act or any rules made thereunder, who on demand of any officer duly empowered by the Board in this behalf refuses to give his name and residence, or who gives a name or residence, which such officer has reason to believe to be false, may be arrested by such officer in order that his name and residence may be ascertained.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 15, for the words “Police and Customs” the words and commas “Police, Customs, Commerce, Industry and Food” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) in section 33, for clause (b) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) subject to such limitations and conditions as the Board may, by notification in the official Gazette, determine from time to time, by an Additional Collector of Excise, a Joint Collector of Excise, a Deputy Collector of Excise, an Assistant Collector of Excise or a Superintendent of Excise.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) in section 37, in sub section (2), after clause (ix), the following new clause (ixa) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(ixa) provide for taking account of goods manufactured and of materials and components, either imported or locally procured, used in the manufacture of excisable goods;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) the First, Schedule shall be amended in the manner set out in the Fourth Schedule to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendment of Act LXI of 1950</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. In the Protective Duties Act, 1950 LXI of 1950),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) Throughout the Act, unless otherwise specified-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for the words “Central Government” the word “Government” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for the word “Pakistan” the word “Bangladesh” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) for the words, comma and figure “Tariff Act, 1934” the words, comma and figure “Customs Act, 1969” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2, in sub section (1), clause (b) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 3, sub section (3) shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendment of Act III of 1951 ( III of 1951)</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. Annual value of holding. The Annual value of a holding shall mean, in municipal areas, gross annual rental at which the holding may reasonably be expected to let, and in areas notified under sub section (2) of section 1, the annual value of the holding as may be determined in the prescribed manner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Explanation</strong>: In determining the gross annual rental at which a holding may be expected to let, regard may be had to the rents of holdings in the vicinity, of like size and amenities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Revision or alteration of annual value of holding.- When the annual value of a holding in respect of areas, other than municipal areas, is revised or altered in the prescribed manner, the annual value of that holding shall be deemed to have been revised or altered under this Act accordingly, and the Urban Immovable Property Tax on such holding shall be imposed on the basis of the revised or altered annual value thereon.”</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 7, sub section (2) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) for the Schedule the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of EP Ord LXXXII of 1958</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Goods dutiable.- (1) Except as hereinafter provided, customs duties shall be levied at such rates as are prescribed in the First Schedule and the Second Schedule or under any other law for the time being in force on</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) goods imported into, or exported from, Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) goods brought from any foreign country to any customs-station, and without payment of duty there, transhipped or transported for, or thence carried to, and imported at, any other customs station; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) goods brought in bond from one customs station to another.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, levy, subject to such conditions, limitations or restrictions as it may deem fit to impose, a regulatory duty on all or any of the goods specified in the First Schedule at a rate not exceeding fifty per cent of the rate, if any, specified therein read with any notification issued under sub section (1) of section 2 or sub section (1) of section 3 of the Protective Duties Act, 1950 (LXI of 1950), or at a rate not exceeding hundred per cent of the value of such goods, as determined under section 25 and may, by a like notification, levy a regulatory duty on all or any of the goods exported from Bangladesh,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in the case of goods enumerated in the Second Schedule at a rate not exceeding thirty per cent of the rate specified in the Second Schedule or of the amount which would represent the value of such goods as determined under section 25; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in the case of goods not enumerated in the Second Schedule, at a rate not exceeding thirty per cent of the amount which represents the value of such goods as determined under section 25.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The regulatory duty levied under sub section (2) shall be in addition to any duty imposed under sub section (1) or under any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any notification issued under sub section (2) shall, if not earlier rescinded, stand rescinded on the expiry of the financial year in which it was issued.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) in section 22, in the proviso, in clause (a), the words “Central Government or any excise duty levied by the Provincial" shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) in section 28, for the words, comma and figures “the Tariff Act, 1934 (XXXII of 1934)” the words “this Act” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) for section 82 the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“82. Procedure in case of goods not declared or warehoused or transhipped after unloading within a specified period.- If any goods are not entered and declared for home consumption or warehoused or transhipped within forty five days of the date of unloading thereof at a customs-port or a land customs station, or within thirty days of the date of unloading thereof at a customs airport or within not be ascertained, be sold under the orders of the appropriate officer:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) animals and perishable and hazardous goods may, with the permission of the appropriate officer, be sold at any time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) arms, ammunition or military stores may be sold or otherwise disposed of at such removal for home consumption of any dutiable goods without payment of customs duties thereon.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) In section 98,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for the Foreign Travel Tax.- Omitted by section 7 of ????? ?? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ???)?</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Ord XLII of 1976</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. In the Land Development Tax Ordinance, 1976 (Ord. XLII of 1976), in section 3, in sub section (1),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in clause (b),</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in sub clause (i), for the words “fifteen taka” the words “twenty two Taka and fifty Poisha”, and for the words “three taka” words “six Taka” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) after sub clause (i) amended as aforesaid, the following new sub clause shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub sections (2), (3), and (5), in making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1980, income tax shall be charged at the rates as specified in Third Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1980,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any income chargeable under the head “Salaries” or any income chargeable under the head “Interest on Securities”, the income tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of income tax payable according to the rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Act, 1979 (V of 1979), on his total income the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) where the total income of a company includes any profits and gains from life insurance business, the income tax payable by the company shall be reduced by an amount equal to 12.5 per cent of that part of its total income which consists of such inclusion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1980, where the assessee is a co operative society, the tax shall be payable at the rate specified in paragraph A, or clause (c) of sub paragraph (i) of paragraph B, of the Third Schedule, whichever treatment is more beneficial to the assessee:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in calculating for the purposes of this sub section, the amount of income tax at the rates specified in paragraph A of the third Schedule, no deduction in respect of any allowance or sums referred to in the proviso to the said paragraph shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) (a) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1980, where the total income of an assessee not being a company to which the proviso to sub paragraph (i) of paragraph B of the Third Schedule does not apply, includes any profits and gains derived from the export of goods out of Bangladesh, income tax payable by him in respect of such profits and gains shall, subject to the provisions of clauses (b) and (c), be reduced by an amount computed in the manner specified hereunder:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amount</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)    Where the goods exported abroad had not been manufactured by the assessee who exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30 per cent. of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)   and where the export sales during the relevant year exceed the export sales of the preceding year:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Plus an additional 1 per cent. for every increase of 10 per cent. in export sales over those of the preceding year, subject to an overall maximum of 40 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)   and where the export sales during the relevant year do not exceed the export sales of the preceding year:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Minus 1 per cent. for every decrease of 10 per cent. in export sales from those of the preceding year, subject to an overall minimum of 20 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)   Where the goods exported had been manufactured by the assessee who had exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) where the export sales do not exceed 10 per cent. of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Nil</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)   where the export sales exceed 10 per cent. but do not exceed 20 per cent. of the total sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30 per cent. of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)   where the export sales exceed 20 per cent. but do not exceed 30 per cent. of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">40 per cent. of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) where the export sales exceed 30 per cent. of the total sales;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">50 per cent. of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)   Nothing contained in clause (a) shall apply in respect of the following goods or class of goods, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)    tea,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)   raw jute,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) jute manufacture,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)  raw hides and skin and wet?blue leather,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)   such other goods as may be notified by the National Board of Revenue from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)   The National Board of Revenue may make rules providing for the computation of profits and the tax attributable to export sales and for such other matters as may be necessary to give effect to the provisions of this sub?section,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) In cases to which section 17 of the Income tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), applies, the tax chargeable shall be determined as provided in that section but with reference to the rates imposed by sub-section (1), and in accordance, where applicable, with the provisions of sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) For the purpose of making deduction of tax under section 18 of the Income?tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), the rates specified in the</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Third Schedule shall apply as respects the year beginning on the first day of July, 1980, and ending on the thirtieth day of June, 1981.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) For the purposes of this section and of the rates of tax imposed thereby, the expression “total income” means total income as determined for the purposes of income?tax in accordance with the provisions of the Income?tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> 555	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE FINANCE ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLV OF 1976).[28th June, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purposes hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Finance Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, this section and sub-clause (c) of clause (15) of section 2 and sections 3 and 4 shall come into force at once, and other sections shall come into force on the first day of July, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act XI of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The following amendments shall be made in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 2, in clause (6C), after the word and figure “section 12”, the commas and words “, any winning from lotteries, crossword puzzles, races including horse races, card games and other games of any sort or from gambling or betting of any form or nature whatsoever” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 4, in sub-section (3),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        after clause (vi), the following new clause (via) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(via) any receipts which are of casual and non-recurring nature, not being winning from lotteries, to the extent such receipts do not exceed Taka two thousand in the aggregate:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that this clause shall not apply to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         capital gains chargeable under the provisions of section 12B;
