firm which has not been assessed under the provisions of clause (b) of sub-section (5) of section 23 in the manner applicable to a registered firm, any such loss shall be set off only against the income, profits and gains of the firm and not against the income, profits and gains of any of the partners of the firm; and where the assessee is a registered firm, any loss which cannot be set off against other income, profits and gains of the firm shall be apportioned between the partners of the firm and they alone shall be entitled to have the amount of the loss set off under this section.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in sub-section (2),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         in the proviso, for clauses (b) and (c) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(b) where depreciation allowance is, under clause (b) of the proviso to clause (vi) or clause (b) of the proviso to clause (vibb) of sub-section (2) of section 10, also to be carried forward, effect shall first be given to this sub-section;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) nothing herein contained shall entitle any assessee, being a registered firm, to have carried forward and set off any loss which has been apportioned between the partners, under the proviso to sub-section (1), or entitle any assessee, being a partner in an unregistered firm which has not been assessed under the provisions of clause (b) of sub-section (5) of section 23 in the manner applicable to a registered firm, to have carried forward and set off against his own income any loss sustained by the firm;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(cc)      where an unregistered firm is assessed as a registered firm under clause (b) of sub-section (5) of section 23, during any year, its losses shall also be carried forward and set off under this section as if it were a registered firm;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in Explanation 2, for paragraph (a) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(a)      no loss of an unregistered firm shall be carried forward and set off under this section, under any circumstances, against its income, profits and gains of the subsequent year if it is registered in that year under section 26A or is treated as a registered firm in such year under clause (b) of sub-section (5) of section 23; and”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(15)      in section 26A, sub-section (6) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(16)      in section 34, in sub-section (2), in the proviso, in clause (i),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in sub-clause (e), the word “and” at the end shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        after sub-clause (e) amended as aforesaid, the following new sub-clause (ee) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(ee)     in relation to the income, profits or gains which were first assessable in the year 1973-74, the words “five years” were substituted; and”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in sub-clause (f), for the figure “1974-75” the figure “1975-76” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on and from the first day of July, 1977;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(17) in section 44A, the comma and words “unless the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes is satisfied that there is an agent of such principal from whom the tax will be recoverable in the following year under the other provisions of this Act” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(18) in section 44B, in sub-section (3), for the words “tax thereon at the rate for the time being applicable to the total income of a company” the words and figure “income-tax at the rate of 30 per cent” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(19) in section 51, in sub-section (3), for the figure and letter “38A” the figure and letters “38AA” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(20) in section 66, for the words “High Court” and “Supreme Court” wherever occurring the words “High Court Division” and “Appellate Division” shall, respectively, be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(21) in section 66A, for the words “High Court” and “Supreme Court” wherever occurring the words “High Court Division” and “Appellate Division” shall, respectively, be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the Ben Act I of 1932</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In the Motor Vehicles Tax Act, 1932 (Ben. Act I of 1932), for the First Schedule the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
559	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS LAWS AMENDMENT ORDINANCE 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS LAWS AMENDMENT ORDINANCE 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(LXI OF 1977) (ORDINANCE NO. LXI OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[30th December, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to amend certain laws relating to financial institutions.WHEREAS it is expedient to amend certain laws relating to financial institutions for the purposes hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Financial Institutions Laws Amendment Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of certain laws relating to Financial Institutions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The laws mentioned in column I of the Schedule shall be amended in the manner indicated in column II thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Savings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Any appointment of a General Manager in the Sangstha, Bank or Corporation established by or under a law mentioned in column I of the Schedule made by the Government at any time before the promulgation of this Ordinance shall be deemed to have been made under the relevant provision of such law, as amended by this Ordinance, and every such appointment shall have effect accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
560	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FOODGRAINS SUPPLY (PREVENTION OF PREJUDICIAL ACTIVITY) ORDINANCE, 1979 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE FOODGRAINS SUPPLY (PREVENTION OF PREJUDICIAL ACTIVITY) ORDINANCE, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXVI OF 1979).[25th July, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for special measures for prevention of prejudicial activity relating to the storage, movement, transhipment, supply and distribution of foodgrains.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for special measures for prevention of prejudicial activity relating to the storage, movement, transhipment, supply and distribution of foodgrains;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS Parliament is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate action necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 93 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Foodgrains Supply (Prevention of Prejudicial Activity) Ordinance, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance to override all other laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. This Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything contained in the Industrial Relations Ordinance, 1969 (XXIII of 1969), or in any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) A person shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine which may extend to taka five thousand, or with both, if he engages in any activity prejudicial to the storage, movement, transhipment, supply and distribution of foodgrains.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall be deemed to have engaged in an activity prejudicial to the storage, movement, transhipment, supply and distribution of foodgrains, if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) being a person engaged or employed, whether as a worker, employee, contractor or otherwise, in connection with the storage, movement, transhipment, supply and distribution of foodgrains (hereinafter referred to as “person aforesaid”) absents himself or otherwise abstains from, his duties, whether or not in concert with others, without leave of absence or any reasonable excuse; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) incites or in any manner persuades any person aforesaid to be absent or to abstain from, or not to perform, his duties or prevents him from attending to and performing his duties; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        engages in any activity which causes disaffection among, or interferes with the discipline of, or obstructs the performance of duties by, any person aforesaid; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        instigates, directly or indirectly, the use of criminal force against any person aforesaid; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        does any act or thing which impedes, delays or restricts, or is calculated to impede, delay or restrict, the transportation, movement, supply or distribution of foodgrains; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         makes, prints, publishes or distributes any document containing, or spreading by any other means whatsoever, any false statement or information relating to storage, movement, transhipment, supply or distribution or foodgrains; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        causes, or does any act or thing calculated to cause, fear or alarm to the public or any section of the public in respect of availability of foodgrains.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on movement of certain persons and detention orders</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Where the Government, or any authority empowered by it in this behalf, is satisfied in respect of any person that with a view to preventing him from engaging in any activity prejudicial to storage, movement, transhipment, supply and distribution of foodgrains, it is necessary so to do, it may make an order directing that such person be detained for a period not exceeding three months.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A detention order under sub-section (1) may be executed at any place in Bangladesh in the manner provided for execution of warrants of arrest under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act V of 1898).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of arrest without warrant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Any police officer not below the rank of Sub-Inspector or any other person empowered by the Government in this behalf, may arrest without warrant any person who has been, or against whom a reasonable suspicion exists of his having been, concerned in an offence punishable under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
561	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE FOREIGN PRIVATE INVESTMENT (PROMOTION AND PROTECTION) ACT, 1980</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FOREIGN PRIVATE INVESTMENT (PROMOTION AND PROTECTION) ACT, 1980</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XI OF 1980).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[1st April, 1980]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the promotion and protection of foreign private investment in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the promotion and protection of foreign private investment in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Foreign Private Investment (Promotion and Protection) Act, 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “foreign capital” means capital invested in Bangladesh in any industrial undertaking by a citizen of any foreign country or by a company incorporated outside Bangladesh, in the form of foreign exchange, imported machinery and equipment, or in such other form as the Government may approve for the purpose of such investment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “foreign private investment” means investment of foreign capital by a person who is not a citizen of Bangladesh or by a company incorporated outside Bangladesh, but does not include investment by a foreign Government or an agency of foreign Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “industrial undertaking” means an industry, establishment or other undertaking engaged in the production or processing of any goods, or in the development and extraction of such mineral resources or products, or in the providing of such services, as may be specified in this behalf by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Words and expressions used but not defined in this Act shall have the same meaning as in the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Foreign private investment</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government may, for the promotion of foreign private investment, sanction establishment with foreign capital of any industrial undertaking-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) which does not exist in Bangladesh and the establishment whereof, in the opinion of the Government, is desirable; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) which is not being carried on in Bangladesh on a scale adequate to the economic and social needs of the country; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) which is likely to contribute to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the development of capital, technical and managerial resources of Bangladesh; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) the discovery, mobilisation or better utilisation of the natural resources; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) the strengthening of the balance of payment of Bangladesh; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) increasing employment opportunities in Bangladesh; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v) the economic development of the country in any other manner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Sanction of the establishment with foreign capital of an industrial undertaking under sub-section (1) may be subject to such conditions as the Government may deem fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Protection and equitable treatment</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Government shall accord fair and equitable treatment to foreign private investment which shall enjoy full protection and security in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Terms of sanction, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The terms of sanction, permission or licence granted by Government to an industrial undertaking having foreign private investment shall not be unilaterally changed so as to adversely alter the conditions under which the establishment of such undertaking was sanctioned; nor shall foreign private investment be accorded a less favourable treatment than what is accorded to similar private investment by the citizens of Bangladesh in the application of relevant rules and regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnification, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. In the event of losses of foreign investment owing to civil commotion, insurrection, or riot, foreign private investment shall be accorded the same treatment with regard to indemnification, compensation, restitution, or other settlement as is accorded to investments by the citizens of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Expropriation and nationalisation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Foreign private investment shall not be expropriated or nationalised or be subject to any measures having effect of expropriation or nationalisation except for a public purpose against adequate compensation which shall be paid expeditiously and be freely transferable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Adequate compensation for the purpose of sub-section (1) shall be an amount equivalent to the market value of investment expropriated or nationalised immediately before the expropriation or nationalisation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repatriation of investment</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) In respect of foreign private investment, the transfer of capital and the returns from it and, in the event of liquidation of industrial undertaking having such investment, of the proceeds from such liquidation is guaranteed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The guarantee under sub-section (1) shall be subject to the right which, in circumstances of exceptional financial and economic difficulties, the Government may exercise in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations in such circumstances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal of difficulty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. If any difficulty arises in giving effect to any provision of this Act, the Government may make such order, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, as may appear to it to be necessary for the purpose of removing the difficulty.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
562	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE GOVERNMENT OF BANGLADESH (SERVICES SCREENING) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE GOVERNMENT OF BANGLADESH (SERVICES SCREENING) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XV OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[28th April, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal the Government of Bangladesh (Services Screening) Order 1972. WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Government of Bangladesh (Services Screening) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 67 of 1972), and to provide for certain other matter connected therewith; NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Government of Bangladesh (Services Screening) (Repeal) Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Repeal of PO No 67 of 1972</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The Government of Bangladesh (Services Screening) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 67 of 1972), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to review</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Notwithstanding the repeal of the Government of Bangladesh (Services Screening) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 67 of 1972) by section 2, the Government may, at any time, either of its own motion or on application, review any order passed by it under clause (2) of Article 6 of that Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
563	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE GOVERNMENT SERVANTS (REVIEW OF PENALTIES) (DISSOLUTION OF REVIEW BOARD) ORDINANCE, 1978 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE GOVERNMENT SERVANTS (REVIEW OF PENALTIES) (DISSOLUTION OF REVIEW BOARD) ORDINANCE, 1978 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. II OF 1978).[19th January, 1978]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to dissolve the Review Board provided for in the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to dissolve the Review Board provided for in the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) Ordinance, 1975 (XLVIII of 1975), and to provide for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) (Dissolution of Review Board) Ordinance, 1978.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Dissolution of the Review Board, etc </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) The Review Board provided for in section 3A of the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) Ordinance, 1975 (XLVIII of 1975), hereinafter referred to as the Review Board, is hereby dissolved.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the dissolution of the Review Board under sub-section (1),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all such applications pending before the Review Board immediately before such dissolution as are not subject to transfer to any Review Committee constituted under the aforesaid Ordinance shall stand transferred to the Establishment Division for disposal; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Establishment Division shall, for the purpose of disposal of such applications, follow, so far as may be, the same procedure as were applicable to the Review Board in respect of such applications.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ord XLVIII of 1975 to be subject to this Ordinance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The Government Servants (Review of Penalties) Ordinance, 1975 (XLVIII of 1975), shall have effect subject to this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
564	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE GOVERNMENT SERVANTS (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1979 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE GOVERNMENT SERVANTS (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XI OF 1979).[22nd February, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to make special provisions for maintaining discipline among Government servants.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make special provisions for maintaining discipline among Government servants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Government Servants (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance to override all other laws, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. This Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything contained in any law, rules and regulations relating to Government servants or in the conditions of service of any Government servant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Where a Government servant-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) engages in any activity which causes disaffection among, or interferes with the discipline of, or obstructs the performance of duties by, any other Government servant; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) without leave of absence or any reasonable excuse, absents himself or otherwise abstains from, or fails to perform, his duties, whether or not in concert with others; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) incites or in any manner persuades any other Government servant to be absent or to abstain from, or not to perform, his duties; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) prevents any Government servant from attending to or performing his duties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">he shall be liable to be punished with any of the penalties mentioned in Section 4.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The following shall be the penalties which may be imposed under this Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) dismissal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) discharge from service; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) reduction in rank or pay.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inquiry and punishment</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) When a Government servant is to be proceeded against for any of the offences mentioned in section 3, the appointing authority or any person authorised by him 1[ in this behalf by general or special order] shall frame a charge and, by notice accompanied by the charge, require the Government servant, hereinafter called the accused, to show cause, within a period which shall not be less than two days nor more than five days from the date of the service of the notice, why he should not be punished under this Ordinance and also to state whether he desires to be heard in person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If, after consideration of the cause, if any, shown by the accused, and hearing him in person, if the accused appears for the purpose, the appointing authority 2[ or the person who framed the charge] finds the accused guilty of the charge, or if no cause is shown within the required period, the appointing authority 3[ or the person who framed the charge] shall, by notice specifying the penalty proposed to be imposed, require the accused to show cause within three days of the service of the notice, why the penalty specified therein shall not be imposed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) After considering the cause, if any, shown under sub-section (2), or if no cause is shown within required period, the appointing authority may impose upon the accused the penalty specified in the notice under sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) For the purpose of this section, a notice shall be deemed to have been validly served if it is served by delivery to the accused or by affixing it to a conspicuous place of his last known residence or by publication in not less than two daily newspapers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ Appeal and review]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) A Government servant on whom a penalty has been imposed under this Ordinance may, within seven days of the receipt of the order imposing the penalty, appeal against the order to an authority immediately superior to the appointing authority; and the appellate authority to whom the appeal has been made may pass such order on the appeal as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (2) Where the appointing authority is the President, the Government servant on whom a penalty has been imposed under this Ordinance may, within thirty working days of the receipt of the order imposing the penalty, apply to the President for review of the order and the President may pass such order on the application as he may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An order passed on appeal under sub-section (1) or on application under sub-section (2) shall be final.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Court’s jurisdiction barred</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. No proceeding or order under any of the provisions of this Ordinance shall be called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “in this behalf by general or special order” were inserted by section 2 of the Government Servants (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. VII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “or the person who framed the charge” were inserted by section 2 of the Government Servants (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. VII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “or the person who framed the charge” were inserted by section 2 of the Government Servants (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. VII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “in this behalf by general or special order” were inserted by section 2 of the Government Servants (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. VII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Sub-sections (2) and (3) were substituted for sub-section (2) by section 3 of the Government Servants (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. VII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
565	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE HOUSING AND BUILDING RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE, 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE HOUSING AND BUILDING RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE, 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLIX OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[19th October, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Housing and Building Research Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Housing and Building Research Institute and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Housing and Building Research Institute Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Committee” means the Executive Committee of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Council” means the Governing Council of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Director” means the Director of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Institute” means the Housing and Building Research Institute established by this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Ordinance, there shall be established an Institute to be called the Housing and Building Research Institute for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The head office of the Institute shall be located at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute may establish branches at such places as the Council may decide.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The general direction and superintendence of the affairs and business of the Institute shall vest in a Governing Council which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Council shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Minister in charge of the Ministry of Public Works and Urban Development, ex-officio, who shall also be its Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Secretary, Ministry of Public Works and Urban Development, ex-officio, who shall also be its Vice-Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) one person to represent the Planning Commission to be nominated by that Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) one person to represent the Ministry of Finance to be nominated by that Ministry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the Chief Engineer, Public Works Department, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the Chief Engineer, Housing and Settlement Directorate, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the Chief Architect, Directorate of Architecture, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the Director, Urban Development Directorate, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) two persons to represent the Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology to be nominated by that University, of whom one shall be from the Civil Engineering Department and the other from the Architecture and Physical Planning Department;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) one person to represent the University  of Dhaka to be nominated by that University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) one person to represent the Institution of Engineers, Bangladesh (not below the rank of Fellow) to be nominated by that Institution;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) one person to represent the manufacturers of building materials to be nominated by the Chamber of Commerce and Industries, Dacca;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) two persons to be nominated by the Government from among officers of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) one person to represent the practising consulting engineers in building design to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) one person to represent the building construction firms to be nominated by the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) the Director of the Institute, ex-officio, who shall also be its Secretary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The nominated members shall hold office for a term of two years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If any casual vacancy occurs in the office of a nominated member, a new member shall be nominated by the authority concerned to fill such vacancy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The functions of the Institute shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to promote technical and scientific studies and research on various problems of building construction and building materials industries and of human settlement as a whole;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to study the availability, development and utilisation of indigenous building materials;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to promote new and better uses of commonly used building materials;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to encourage adoption of quality control measures in building construction;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to initiate actions for the improvement of the technology, method of planning and designing of building construction and maintenance works in the housing sector;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to develop inexpensive and new materials and technology for building construction through pilot projects;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to initiate research programme and case-studies in the field of housing and building research in co-operation with the National Council for Science and Technology and other research institutes and universities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to evaluate its research activities and to initiate actions for adoption of research results;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to institute fellowships and scholarships for the purpose of encouraging research and technical and scientific studies in the field of housing and building construction;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to train research personnel and technicians for the purpose of carrying out its research activities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to provide for consultation and advisory services in the field of housing and building research;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to disseminate latest knowledge on the problems of housing and building construction;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) to publish regularly research reports, research bulletins, technical reports and other reports on the work done by it; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) to do such other acts and things as may be necessary or convenient to be done in connection with, or incidental or conductive to, the performance of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Meetings of the Council shall be convened by the Secretary of the Council, in consultation with the Chairman, at least twice in a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) At least ten days' notice shall be given for convening a meeting of the Council and such notice shall specify the agenda of the meeting and the date on which, and the time and place at which, the meeting shall be held.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Emergency meetings of the Council may be convened on twenty-four hours' notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Six members shall constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman and, in his absence, the Vice-Chairman shall preside over the meetings of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) All matters at a meeting of the Council shall be decided by the votes of the majority of the members present and voting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) At a meeting of the Council each member shall have one vote and in the event of equality of votes the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) No act or proceeding of the Council shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Executive Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) There shall be an Executive Committee consisting of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Director, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) four members to be nominated by the Chairman from among officers of the Institute who are doing research work or are qualified to do such work.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A nominated member of the Committee shall hold office for a period of three years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The meetings of the Committee shall be convened by the Director at such time and place as he may specify and shall be presided over by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Committee shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) initiate proposals and prepare programmes relating to the functions of the Institute for consideration and approval of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) be responsible for the implementation of all proposals and programmes approved by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) deal with such other matters relating to research and technical and scientific studies in the field of housing and building construction as may be referred to it by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) assist the Council in the discharge of its functions; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) exercise such other powers and perform such other functions as may be prescribed or as may be assigned to it by the Council from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Director of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) There shall be a Director of the Institute who shall be appointed by the Government for a period of five years on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When any temporary vacancy in the office of the Director occurs by reason of leave, illness or other cause, the Council shall make such arrangement for carrying out the functions of his office as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Director shall be the whole-time chief executive officer of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Director shall be responsible to ensure that the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules and regulations made thereunder are observed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) In an emergency arising out of the business of the Institute and requiring, in the opinion of the Director, immediate action, the Director may take such action as he may deem necessary and shall report to the Council for approval of the action so taken as early as possible.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Director may, subject to such conditions as may be prescribed, delegate any of his powers to any officer or employee of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The Director shall exercise such other powers as may be prescribed or as may be assigned to him, from time to time, by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Institute may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions in such manner and on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Council may, from time to time, appoint such committees as may be necessary to discharge such functions as may be assigned to them by the Council or to assist the Director in the performance of his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Institute shall have its own fund which shall be utilised by it to meet charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fund of the Institute shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) grants made by the local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) grants and aids received from aid-giving agencies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) donations and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) fees received by the Institute; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) all other sums received by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All money in the fund of the Institute shall be deposited with any bank approved by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Council shall, by such date before the commencement of every financial year as the Government may direct, submit to the Government for approval a budget, in such form as the Government may specify, for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Institute shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The accounts of the Institute shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter referred to as the Auditor-General) in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of audit under sub-section (1) the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all books, accounts, securities, stores and other properties of the Institute and may examine the members of the Council or any officer or employee of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Auditor-General shall submit his audit report to the Government and shall forward a copy thereof to the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Institute shall furnish to the Government such reports and statements on expenditure and on the progress of approved research programmes as the Government may, from time to time, require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) As soon as may be after the end of every financial year the Institute shall submit to the Government an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The members of the Council and the officers and employees of the Institute shall, while acting or purporting to act in pursuance of the provisions of this Ordinance or any rule or regulation made thereunder, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any member of the Council or any officer or employee of the Institute for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance or any rule or regulation made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Council may, with the prior approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Abolition of Housing and Building Research Centre</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any rules or regulations, on the commencement of this Ordinance, the Housing and Building Research Centre at Dar-us-Salam, Mirpur, Dacca, hereinafter referred to as the said Centre, shall stand abolished and upon such abolition-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all assets, including lands and buildings, workshops, machinery, apparatus and materials of the said Centre shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all debts, liabilities and obligations of the said Centre subsisting immediately before such abolition shall be the debts, liabilities and obligations of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all officers and other employees of the said Centre shall, notwithstanding anything contained in their terms and conditions of service, stand transferred to the Institute and shall hold office or service in the Institute on the same terms and conditions as were enjoyed by them immediately before such transfer and shall continue to do so until the terms and conditions are duly altered by the Institute or the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an officer or employee of the said Centre may, within such time as may be specified by the Institute, exercise his option not to continue in the service of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
566	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE INLAND SHIPPING ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE INLAND SHIPPING ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXII OF 1976).[21st September, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the survey, registration and control of navigation of vessels plying on inland waters.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the survey, registration and control of navigation of vessels plying on inland waters consistently with the present day requirements and for that purpose to replace the existing law relating to such vessels;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975 and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> CHAPTER I</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>PRELIMINARY</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Inland Shipping Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (a)    “certificate of competency” means a certificate of competency granted under section 36;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “certificate of registry” means a certificate of registry granted under section 18;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (bb) “certificate of service” means a certificate of service granted under section 37;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “certificate of survey” means a certificate of survey granted under section 3[ 9];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “dangerous goods” means such articles, goods or things as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be dangerous goods for the purposes of this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (dd) “Director-General” means the Director-General, Department of Shipping;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “inland ship” means every description of vessel ordinarily plying on inland waters and propelled wholly or in part by steam, liquid fuel, electricity or any other mechanical powers and includes 5[ * * *] a sailing boat, dumb barge and other craft which is not so propelled but is towed or pushed by a vessel so propelled;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “inland water” means any canal, river, lake or other navigable waters in Bangladesh and such portion of tidal water as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be inland waters for the purposes of this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “mercantile purposes”, in relation to an inland ship, includes carriage of passengers or goods by, or use for any service of, such inland ship for hire,
