Notwithstanding anything contained in sections 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26 and 27, the Authority may recover by suit any tolls, dues, rates, charges, damages, expenses, costs, or in case of sale the balance thereof, when the proceeds of sale are insufficient, or any penalty payable to or recoverable by the Authority under this Ordinance or any regulations made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Surplus of port dues to be paid to the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. The surplus, if any, of the moneys credited under section 36 of the Ports Act, 1908 (XV of 1908), to the account of the Port fund of the Authority, after defraying therefrom all expenses legally chargeable to the said account, shall be paid to the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public landing and bathing places</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) The Authority shall provide a sufficient number of landing places and bathing places within the Port from, upon or in which the public may be permitted to embark, land or bath free of charge.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority may occupy or remove or alter any landing place or bathing place, and prohibit the public from using such landing place or bathing place:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Authority shall in that case provide for the use of the public some other landing places or bathing places.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER IV</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">ESTABLISHMENT</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. The Authority may, from time to time, appoint such officers and other employees as it may consider necessary for the performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Members, etc to be public servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. The Chairman, members, officers and other employees of the Authority shall when acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any of the provisions of this Ordinance, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Authority or against the Board or the Chairman or any member, officer or other employee of the Authority in respect of anything in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers to Chairman, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. The Authority may, by general or special order, delegate to the Chairman or a member or an officer of the Authority any of its powers, duties or functions under this Ordinance subject to such conditions as it may think fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER V</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">FINANCE</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Authority Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. (1) There shall be formed a fund to be known as the Mongla Port Authority Fund which shall vest in the Authority and shall be utilised by the Authority to meet the charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance, including the payment of salaries and other remuneration to the Chairman, members, officers and other employees of the Authority.    (2) To the credit of the Mongla Port Authority Fund shall be placed-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) grants made by local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        sale proceeds of movable and immovable property and receipts for services rendered;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) loans obtained by the Authority with the special or general sanction of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) foreign aids and loans obtained from any source outside Bangladesh with the sanction of , and on such terms as may be approved by, the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) proceeds of all charges and recoveries made under the Ports Act, 1908 (XV of 1908) and the provisions of this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) all other sums receivable by the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowing power</p><p style="text-align: justify;">36. The Authority may, with the previous approval in writing of the Government, borrow money for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance or for servicing any loan obtained by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">37. The Authority shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a budget in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit and accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">38. (1) The accounts of the Authority shall be maintained by it in such form and manner as may be prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the provisions of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) Act, 1974 (XXIV of 1974), the accounts of the Authority shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Government, on such remuneration, to be paid by the Authority, as the Government may fix.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance-sheet of the Authority, and shall examine it together with the accounts and vouchers relating thereto and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Authority; and shall at all reasonable times have access to the books, accounts and other documents of the Authority, and may in relation to such accounts examine any officer of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditors shall report to the Authority upon the annual balance-sheet and accounts, and in their report state whether in their opinion the balance-sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of the Authority's affairs, and in case they have called for any explanation or information from the Authority, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may, at any time, issue directions to the auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Authority for the protection of the interest of the Government and of the creditors of the Authority or upon the sufficiency of their procedure in auditing the accounts of the Authority, and may, at any time, enlarge or extend the scope of the audit or direct that a different procedure in audit be adopted or that any other examination be made by the auditors if in its opinion the public interest so requires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cost of Port Police</p><p style="text-align: justify;">39. The Authority shall provide such sums as the Government may, from time to time, determine as a contribution for the maintenance of police employed for the protection of the port and the approaches to the Port.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER VI</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">PENALTIES AND PROCEDURE</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">40. Whoever contravenes any provision of this Ordinance or any rule or regulation made thereunder shall, if no other penalty is provided for such contravention, be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or 13[ with fine which may extend to taka fifty thousand], or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty for evading tolls, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">41. Any person who removes or attempts to remove, or abets within the meaning of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860), the removal of any goods, vessel, animal or vehicle with the intention of evading payment of the tolls, dues, rates or charges lawfully payable in respect thereof shall be punishable with fine which may extend to 14[ fifty thousand taka].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty for pollution etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ 41A. Any person who throws or allows to fall into the water, shore, bank or land within the limits of the Port any goods, ballast, ashes or any other thing whatsoever causing pollution of the water or environment shall be punishable with fine which may extend to one lakh taka.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compensation for damage to property</p><p style="text-align: justify;">42. (1) In case any damage or mischief is done to any dock, pier or work of the Authority by any vessel, through the negligence of the master thereof or of any of the mariners or persons employed therein, not being in the service of the Authority, any Magistrate of the first class having jurisdiction in the Port area may, on the application of the Authority and on declaration by it that payment for such damage or mischief has been refused or has not been made on demand, issue a summons to the master or owner of such vessel, requiring him to attend on a day and at an hour named in the summons to answer touching such damage or mischief.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If, at the time appointed in the summons, and whether the person summoned appears or not, it is proved that the alleged damage was done through such negligence as aforesaid, and that the pecuniary amount of the same does not exceed five thousand taka, the Magistrate may issue his warrant of distress, under which a sufficient portion of the boats, masts, spares, ropes, cables, anchors or stores of the vessel may be seized and sold to cover the expenses of and attending the execution of the distress, and the pecuniary amount of damage as aforesaid, and such amount shall be paid to the Authority out of the proceeds of the distress:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if, at the time of the damage or mischief, the vessel was under the orders of a duly authorised officer belonging to the pilot service of the Authority, and if such damage or mischief is in any way attributable to the order, act or improper omission of such officer, the case shall not be cognizable by the Magistrate under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">43. No Court shall take cognizance of any offence punishable under this Ordinance except on a complaint in writing made by the Authority or by an officer authorised for the purpose by the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recovery of dues as arrears of land revenue</p><p style="text-align: justify;">44. All fees and sums due on account of property for the time being vested in the Authority and all arrears of tolls, charges, rates and dues imposed under this Ordinance may be recovered as arrears of land revenue, in addition to the other modes provided by this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER VII</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">MISCELLANEOUS</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of entry</p><p style="text-align: justify;">45. (1) It shall be lawful for the Chairman or any member, or for any person either generally or specially authorised by the Chairman in this behalf,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to enter upon and survey, inspect or take level of any land;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to dig or bore into the sub-soil;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to set out the boundaries and intended lines of any work;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to mark such levels, boundaries and lines by placing marks and cutting trenches; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to do all other acts necessary to be done for any of the purposes of this Ordinance or for the preparation or execution of any plan or scheme in respect of the Port.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No person shall enter upon any land without previously giving the occupier of the land at least twenty-four hours' notice in writing of his intention to do so.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compulsory acquisition of land for the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">46. Any land required by the Authority for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance shall be deemed to be needed for a public purpose and such land may be requisitioned or acquired for the Authority by the Deputy Commissioner or any other officer in accordance with any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of yearly reports and returns</p><p style="text-align: justify;">47. (1) The Authority shall submit to the Government, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year but before the last day of December next following, a report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, after giving sufficient notice to the Authority, require it to furnish the Government with-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any return, statement, estimates, statistics, or other information regarding any matter under the control of the Authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a report on any subject with which the Authority is concerned; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) a copy of any document in the charge of the Authority; and the Authority shall comply with every such requisition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity to the Authority for acts of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">48. The Authority shall not be answerable-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        for any misfeasance, malfeasance or nonfeasance of any of its officers or other employees or of any person acting under the authority or direction of any such officer or other employee; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for any damage sustained by any vessel in consequence of any defect in any of the moorings, hawsers or other things within the limits of the Port which may be used by such vessel:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this section shall protect the Authority from a suit in respect of any negligence or default on its part or of any act done by or under its express order or sanction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Limitation of suits</p><p style="text-align: justify;">49. (1) No suit shall be instituted against the Authority or against the Chairman or any member, officer or other employee of the Authority or any person acting under their direction for anything done or purporting to be done under this Ordinance until the expiration of one month next after notice in writing has been delivered or left at the office of the Authority stating the cause of the suit and the name and place of residence of the intending plaintiff.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every such suit shall be commenced within six months next after the accrual of the right to sue and not afterwards.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up</p><p style="text-align: justify;">50. No provision of law relating to the winding up of bodies corporate shall apply to the Authority and the Authority shall not be wound up save by order of the Government and in such manner as it may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of Government to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">51. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of Officers on deputation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ 51A. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance or in any other law, rule or regulations for the time being in force, the Government may, if it considers necessary in the public interest, transfer on deputation any Officer                      </p></div></div>
579	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURE AWARD FUND ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURE AWARD FUND ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXXVII OF 1976)[11th November, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to establish the 1 Bangabandhu National Agriculture Award Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to establish a fund for the institution of national awards to promote the cause of agricultural development and to provide incentive and encouragement to efforts made in this direction, and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the 2[ Bangabandhu] National Agriculture Award Fund Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “agriculture” includes crop production, vegetable and fruit farming, dairy farming, livestock and poultry farming, fish cultivation and forestry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Award” means the National Agriculture Award instituted under section 5;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Board” means the Board of Trustees set up under section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Fund” means National Agriculture Award Fund established under section 3.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be established a fund to be called the National Agriculture Award Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To the credit of the Fund shall be placed-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        grants made by any local authority, statutory body or other body corporate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        donations made by any individual, association or institution;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        income accruing from investment made out of the moneys of the Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The moneys credited to the Fund shall be held by the Board in trust and shall be kept in a bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Board of Trustees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) There shall be set up a board to be known as the Board of Trustees of the National Agriculture Award Fund which shall consist of the following Trustees, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Minister-in-charge of the Ministry of Agriculture, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board;          3[ (aa) the Minister-in-charge of Forest &amp; Environment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(aaa) the Minister-in-charge of Fisheries and Livestock;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (aaaa)          two Members of Parliament to be nominated by the Government;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a retired Judge of the 5[ Supreme Court of Bangladesh] to be nominated by the Government who shall continue to be a Trustee till his successor is nominated;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Dhaka, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the Vice-Chancellor of the Agricultural University, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        one non-official to be appointed by the Government for a term of one year;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the Secretary, Ministry of Agriculture (Agriculture Division), who shall also be the Secretary to the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the aforesaid name sue or be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Institution of Awards</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Board shall institute one or more national awards to be called the National Agriculture Award.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Award shall be made annually and shall carry a citation and such amount in cash as may be determined by the Board from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The cash amount of the Award shall be paid out of the moneys of the Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ (4) The Award may be granted to any person or organisation including a co-operative society who or which has-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        achieved high productivity in agriculture or whose research or invention is beneficial to the cause of agriculture or who or which shows new direction for the development of agriculture in Bangladesh or published any book or article of immense value for the cause of agriculture development in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) played an important role or contributed to the preservation of environment and to the invention of new technology for the preservation of environment or to the protection of public life from environmental pollution;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) contributed to the invention of different technologies in agricultural development through bio-tech, hybrid seeds, tissue culture, environment friendly and sustainable agriculture system, etc.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) In any year the Award may be divided between two or among more persons or organisations if, in the opinion of the Board, all such persons or organisations are eligible for the Award.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) If, in the opinion of the Board, there is no suitable person or organisation for the Award in any year, the Board may withhold the Award for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Board shall have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to do or cause to be done all acts and things necessary for the grant of the Award;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to take all measures necessary for the proper administration and management of the moneys of the Fund;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to sanction expenditure connected with the administration and management of the Fund;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to invest moneys of the Fund in Government securities or in other profitable ventures or in such other manner as it may deem fit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to do or cause to be done all things ancillary or incidental to the purpose of the Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The meetings of the Board shall be held on such date and at such time and places and in such manner as may be prescribed by rules:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until rules are made in this behalf, the meetings of the Board shall be held as and when convened by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The accounts of the Fund shall be audited by not less than two auditors being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Board may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the procedure to be observed at a meeting of the Board and the number of Trustees required to form a quorum;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the procedure to be followed by the Board in making selection of person or organisation for the Award; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the manner in which and the persons by whom proposals or recommendations for the Award may be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The P.O. No. 29 of 1973 is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon repeal of the said P.O. all assets and moneys acquired thereunder shall become the assets of the Board of Trustees and moneys of National Agriculture Award Fund under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout the Act along with Long title and short title the word “Bangabandhu” was inserted before the word “National” by section 2 of the National Agriculture Award Fund (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act No. XXXIX of 2009.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Throughout the Act along with Long title and short title the word “Bangabandhu” was inserted before the word “National” by section 2 of the National Agriculture Award Fund (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act No. XXXIX of 2009.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clauses (aa) and (aaa) were inserted by section 3 of the President's Award Fund (Amendment) Act, 1997 (Act No. XIX of 1997)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (aaaa) was inserted by section 3 of the Bangabandhu Award Fund (Amendment) Act, 2002 (Act No. XXXIV of 2002)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “ Supreme Court of Bangladesh” were substituted for the words “High Court” by section 3 of the President's Award Fund (Amendment) Act, 1997 (Act No. XIX of 1997)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Sub-section (4) was substituted by section 4 of the President's Award Fund (Amendment) Act, 1997 (Act No. XIX of 1997)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
580	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE NEWSPAPERS (ANNULMENT OF DECLARATION) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE NEWSPAPERS (ANNULMENT OF DECLARATION) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. L OF 1976).[30th June, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal the Newspapers (Annulment of Declaration) Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Newspapers (Annulment of Declaration) Act, 1975 (XLII of 1975);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Newspapers (Annulment of Declaration) (Repeal) Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal of Act XLII of 1975</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The Newspapers (Annulment of Declaration) Act, 1975 (XLII of 1975), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
581	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE NOTE-BOOKS (PROHIBITION) ACT, 1980</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE NOTE-BOOKS (PROHIBITION) ACT, 1980</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XII OF 1980).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[9th April, 1980]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to prohibit printing, publication, import, distribution and sale of note-books on text-books for primary schools and secondary schools up to Class VIII.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to prohibit printing, publication, import, distribution and sale of note-books on text-books for primary schools and secondary schools up to Class VIII;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Note-Books (Prohibition) Act, 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Bangladesh School Text-Book Board established under the School Text-Book Act, 1954 (E.P. Act XIV of 1954);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “note-book” means any printed book that contains notes, annotations, explanations, comments, references, answers or solutions to any questions on any subject or matter in, or translations or paraphrases of any part of, any text-book but does not include any such book published by, or under the authority of, the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “text-book” means any text-book for primary schools or secondary schools up to Class VIII published by, or under the authority of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition of printing, etc, of the note-books 4Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) No person shall print, publish, import, sell, distribute or in any manner put into circulation or keep for printing, publication, sale, distribution or circulation of any note-book.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Nothing in sub-section (1) shall apply to any notes, comments or explanations dictated or given in writing by a teacher in a class for the use of the students of that class:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such notes, comments or explanations shall not be reproduced in writing or otherwise and circulated for the use of any other person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Whoever contravenes any provision of section 3 shall be punishable with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine which may extend to twenty five thousand Taka, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Court trying the contravention of any provision of section 3 shall order the forfeiture to Government of every copy of the note-book in respect of which such provision has been contravened and may also order the forfeiture to Government of the printing press found printing such note-book.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where any provision of section 3 has been contravened by a firm, company or other body corporate, every partner, director, manager, secretary or other officer thereof shall, if actively concerned in the conduct of the business of such firm, company or body corporate, be deemed to have contravened such provision unless he proves that the contravention took place without his knowledge or that he exercised all due diligence to prevent such contravention.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
582	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE OMBUDSMAN ACT 1980</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE OMBUDSMAN ACT 1980</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XV OF 1980).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[9th April, 1980]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the establishment of the office of Ombudsman and to define his powers and functions.WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the office of Ombudsman and to define his powers and functions and to provide for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Ombudsman Act 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “action” means action taken by way of decision, recommendation or approval or in any other manner and includes failure to act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “competent authority” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in relation to a Ministry, the Minister,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in relation to a statutory public authority, the Government,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) in relation to a public officer, the appointing authority or, where there is no such authority, the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “public officer” means a public officer as defined in Article 152 of the Constitution and includes a chairman, mayor, director, member, trustee, officer or other employee of a statutory public authority or of any other authority, corporation, body or organisation established, owned, managed or controlled by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of office of Ombudsman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be an Ombudsman who shall be appointed by the President on the recommendation of Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Parliament shall recommend for appointment as Ombudsman a person of known legal or administrative ability and conspicuous integrity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Term of office of Ombudsman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Ombudsman shall, subject to this section, hold office for a term of three years from the date on which he enters upon his office, and shall be eligible for reappointment for one further term.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Ombudsman shall not be removed from his office except by an order of the President passed pursuant to a resolution of Parliament supported by a majority of not less than two-thirds of the total number of members of Parliament on the ground of proved misconduct or physical incapacity:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such resolution shall be passed until the Ombudsman has been given a reasonable opportunity of being heard in person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Ombudsman may resign his office by writing under his hand addressed to the President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Remuneration, etc of Ombudsman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Subject to this Act, the remuneration, privileges and other conditions of service of the Ombudsman shall be the same as are admissible or applicable to a Judge of the Appellate Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of Ombudsman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Ombudsman may investigate any action taken by a Ministry, a statutory public authority, or a public officer in any case where-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a complaint in respect of such action is made to him by a person-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) who claims to have sustained injustice in consequence of such action; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) who affirms that such action has resulted in favour being unduly shown to any person or in accrual of undue personal benefit or gain to any person; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) information has been received by him from any person or source, otherwise than on a complaint, that such action is of the nature mentioned in clause (a).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Nothing in this section shall authorise the Ombudsman to investigate any civil or criminal proceedings before any Court, or the function performed by, or the conduct of, a person acting as a member of a Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Procedure in respect of investigations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Where the Ombudsman proposes to conduct an investigation under this Act, he shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) forward a copy of the complaint or, in the case where he proposes to conduct the investigation on his own motion, a statement setting out the grounds therefore, to the Ministry, statutory public authority, or the public officer concerned;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) afford to the Ministry, the statutory public authority, or the public officer concerned an opportunity to offer its or his comments on such complaint or statement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Except as aforesaid the procedure for conducting any such investigation shall be such as the Ombudsman considers appropriate in the circumstances of the case.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Ombudsman may obtain information from such persons and in such manner, and make such inquiries and in such manner, as he thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where any action is under investigation by any other person under any other law, the Ombudsman shall not investigate such action unless, for reasons to be recorded in writing, he is of opinion that an investigation by him is necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Evidence</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Subject to the provisions of this section, for the purposes of an investigation under this Act, the Ombudsman may require any public officer or any other person who, in his opinion, is able to furnish information or produce documents relevant to the investigation to furnish any such information or produce any such document.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purposes of any such investigation the Ombudsman shall have all the powers of a civil Court, while trying a suit under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (V of 1908), in respect of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) summoning and enforcing the attendance of any person and examining him on oath;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) requiring the discovery and production of any document;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) requiring evidence on affidavit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) requisitioning any public record or a copy thereof from any Court or office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) issuing commissions for the examination of witnesses or documents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) such other matters as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any proceeding before the Ombudsman shall be deemed to be a judicial proceeding within the meaning of section 193 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (5), no obligation to maintain secrecy or other restriction upon the disclosure of information obtained by or furnished to Government or persons in Government service, imposed by any law, shall apply to the disclosure of information for the purposes of any investigation under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No person shall be required or authorised by virtue of this Act to furnish any such information or answer any such question or produce so much of any document-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) as might prejudice the security or defence or international relations of Bangladesh, or the investigation or detection of crime; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) as might involve the disclosure of proceedings of the Council of Ministers or any committee thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">and for the purposes of this sub-section a certificate issued by a Secretary to the Government certifying that any information, answer or portion of a document is of the nature specified in clause (a) or clause (b) shall be conclusive and binding.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Without prejudice to the provisions of sub-section (4), no person shall be compelled for the purposes of an investigation under this Act to give any evidence or produce any document which he could not be compelled to give or produce in any proceedings before a Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Reports of Ombudsman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) If, after investigation of any action under this Act, it appears to the Ombudsman that injustice has been caused to the complainant or to any other persons in consequence of maladministration in connection with such action, the Ombudsman shall, by a report in writing, recommend to the competent authority concerned that such injustice should be remedied in such manner and within such time as may be specified in the report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The competent authority to which a report is sent under sub-section (1) or a person authorised by it in this behalf shall, within one month of the expiry of the time specified in the report, intimate to the Ombudsman of the action taken for compliance with the report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If, after investigation of any action under this Act, it appears to the Ombudsman that such action has resulted in favour being unduly shown to any person or in accrual of undue personal benefit or gain to any person and that this may be substantiated, he shall, by a report in writing, communicate his findings, together with the relevant documents, materials and other evidence, to the competent authority concerned and recommend such legal, departmental or disciplinary action as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The competent authority or a person authorised by it in this behalf shall examine the report forwarded to it under sub-section (3) and, within one month of the date of receipt of the report intimate to the Ombudsman the action taken or proposed to be taken on the basis of his report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If the Ombudsman is satisfied with the action taken or proposed to be taken on the basis of his report referred to in sub-sections (1) and (3), he shall close the case but where he is not so satisfied and if he considers that the case so deserves, he may make a special report upon the case to the President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Ombudsman shall prepare an annual report concerning the discharge of his functions under this Act and submit it to the President who shall cause it, together with an explanatory memorandum, to be laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) If, during any investigation under this Act, the Ombudsman finds any defect in any law, he may report such defect to the Government and recommend such reform of the law as, in his opinion, will remove such defect.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Staff of Ombudsman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Ombudsman may appoint officers and other employees to assist him in the discharge of his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The categories of officers and other employees who may be appointed by the Ombudsman and their terms and conditions of service shall be such as may be prescribed after consultation with the Ombudsman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Without prejudice to the provisions of sub-section (1), the Ombudsman may, with the previous consent of the Government, utilise the services of any officer, employee or agency of the Government if such services are required by him for the purpose of discharging his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power of entry</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. For the purposes of an investigation under this Act, the Ombudsman may enter upon and inspect any premises and search and seize such books or documents as he deems necessary; and the provisions of sections 102 and 103 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (V of 1898), shall, so far as may be, apply to such entry, inspection, search and seizure.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Restriction of publication of proceedings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) No person shall publish any proceedings relating to an investigation which is pending before the Ombudsman unless prior permission for the publication is obtained from the Ombudsman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Whoever contravenes the provision of sub-section (1) shall be punishable with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two thousand Taka, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power of Ombudsman to punish any person for obstruction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Ombudsman shall have power to punish any person who, without lawful excuse, obstructs him in the performance of his functions with simple imprisonment which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two thousand Taka, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Ombudsman may, by general or special order in writing, direct that any power conferred or any duty imposed on him by or under this Act may also be exercised or discharged by such of the officers, employees or agencies referred to in section 10 as may be specified in the Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Exemption</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any public officer or class of public officers from the operation of all or any of the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Immunities</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Ombudsman or any member of his staff in respect of anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No proceedings, decision or report of the Ombudsman shall be liable to be challenged, reviewed, quashed or called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Savings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The provisions of this Act shall be in addition to the provisions of any other law under which any remedy by way of appeal, revision, review or in any other manner is available to a person making a complaint under this Act in respect of any action, and nothing in this Act shall limit or affect the right of such person to avail of such remedy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong>: Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
583	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PHARMACY ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PHARMACY ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XIII OF 1976).[4th March, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to establish a Pharmacy Council to regulate the practice of pharmacy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to establish a Pharmacy Council to regulate the practice of pharmacy and to provide for matters connected therewith and inciden¬tal thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Pharmacy Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “approved” means approved under section 18 or, as the case may be, section 19;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Council” means the Pharmacy Council of Bangladesh established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “medical institution” means an institution whose medical qualifications are recognised under the Medical Council Act, 1973 (XXX of 1973);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “pharmacist” means a person who, for a fee, salary or other consideration paid to him or to another person on his behalf, manufactures, prepares, distributes, sells, or serves any prescription for, any medicine, drug or pharmaceutical preparation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the coming into force of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Council to be known as the Pharmacy Council of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and common seal, with power, among others, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, and shall by its name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Council shall subject to the provisions of sub-section (2), consist of the following members, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Secretary, Ministry of Health, Population Control and Family Planning, ex-officio, who shall, unless the Government appoints any other officer to be the President, also be the President of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the officer, if any, appointed under clause (a) to be the President of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Directors of Health Services, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Head of the Department of Drug Administration, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) Head of the Department of Pharmacy in the University of Dhaka, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) four persons to be so nominated by the Government that one of them is a Professor of Medicine and one is a Professor of Pharmacology of medical institutions in Bangladesh 1[ and one is a qualified pharmacist];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) one qualified pharmacist to be nominated by the Bangladesh Aushad Shilpa Samity;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) one person to be nominated by the Bangladesh Medical Association;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) one qualified pharmacist to be nominated by the Bangladesh Chemists and Druggists Samity;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) three persons to be nominated by the Pharmaceutical Society of Bangladesh registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (XXI of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, increase or decrease the number of persons to be nominated by it under 2[ clause (f)] of sub-section (1):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the decrease in the number of members shall not affect the continuance in office of, and the performance of functions by, any member until the expiry of his term.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disqualification for membership</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. A person, other than a Professor of a medical institution, shall not be eligible for nomination as a member of the Council unless he is a registered pharmacist:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, for the purpose of the constitution of the first Council, a person who is qualified to be registered as a pharmacist under this Ordinance, shall be eligible for such nomination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Publication of names</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government shall publish in the official Gazette the names or the official titles of the members of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Term of office</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (2), a member other than an ex-officio member shall hold office for a period of three years commencing on the day on which he assumes office and shall be eligible for re-nomination:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, notwithstanding the expiry of his term, a member shall continue to function until his successor assumes office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where the Government, upon the recommendation of a majority of the members of the Council, is satisfied that a member other than ex-officio member of the Council is negligent in the discharge of his duties or is guilty of any professional or dishonourable conduct or is otherwise not competent to perform the functions of a member, it may, by notification in the official Gazette, remove such member; and upon the publication of such notification the office of the member shall become vacant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Filling of casual vacancy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. A casual vacancy caused by the death, resignation or removal of a member shall be filled for the remainder of the term of such member, not being less than six months, by nominating another person in his place in the same manner in which such member was nominated.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Vacancy, etc, not to invalidate the proceedings of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. No act or proceedings of the Council shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the composition of, the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Election of Vice-President</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Council shall elect every year one of its members other than an ex-officio member to be the Vice-President of the Council and the Vice-President so elected shall hold office for a period of one year and shall be eligible for re-election:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Vice-President shall, notwithstanding the expiry of his term, continue to function until his successor is elected and assumes office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Vice-President shall perform such functions as may be entrusted to him by the Council and, in the absence of the President, also the functions of the President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Council may constitute such Committees as it deems fit for the purpose of advising it in the performance of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Committee constituted under sub-section (1) may co-opt as its member any person whose assistance or advice it may consider necessary for the efficient performance of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Council shall meet at such time and place, and a meeting of the Council shall be summoned and conducted in such manner, as may be laid down by its regulations:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until such regulations are made, the President of the Council may, by notice addressed to each member, summon and conduct a meeting at such time and place and in such manner as he may deem expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The President or, in his absence, the Vice-President shall preside at every meeting of the Council and, in the absence of both the President and the Vice-President, the members present shall elect one amongst them to preside at the meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of Secretary, Officers and Staff of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Council shall, with the approval of the Government, appoint a Secretary from amongst persons eligible for registration as pharmacists on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council may also appoint such officers and staff as may be necessary for the efficient performance of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Finance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The funds of the Council shall consist of the fees received by it under this Ordinance and of such moneys as may be placed at its disposal by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Council shall maintain proper accounts and prepare annual statement of accounts in such form as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Council shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh or any officer authorised by him in such manner as the Comptroller and Auditor-General may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual report</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. As soon as may be, after the close of every financial year, the Council shall submit to the Government, an annual report giving an account of its proceedings together with a statement of moneys received and expenses incurred by it during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The functions of the Council shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to approve examinations in Pharmacy for the purpose of qualifying persons for registration as pharmacists;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to prescribe the subjects in which approved examinations shall be held;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to approve the courses of study and practical training in pharmacy for the purpose of admission to approved examinations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to prescribe the conditions and procedure for admission of candidates to an approved examination;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to lay down the standard of teaching to be maintained by institutions conducting the approved courses of study;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to prescribe the equipment and facilities to be made available to the students;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to recognise degree or diploma in Pharmacy for the purpose of registration as pharmacists;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to cause inspection of institutions which conduct any course of study in Pharmacy and of the teachings imparted and examinations held by them;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to prepare and maintain Registers of pharmacists and apprentices in pharmacy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to register pharmacists and grant certificates of registration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to hold examinations for the purpose of registration as pharmacists; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to do such other acts and things as it may be empowered or required to do by or under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align:
