justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Approval of examinations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) Any institution or authority, other than the Council, which holds an examination in Pharmacy, may apply to the Council for approval of the examination for the purpose of qualifying a person for registration as a pharmacist under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council, if it is satisfied after such enquiry as it may think fit that the examination for the approval of which an application has been made under sub-section (1) is in conformity with the provisions of this Ordinance and the regulations, shall approve the examination and, by notification in the official Gazette, declare it to be an approved examination for the purpose of qualifying a person for registration as a pharmacist under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Approval of courses of study</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) Any institution or authority which conducts a course of study in Pharmacy may apply to the Council for approval of such course of study for the purpose of admission to an approved examination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council, if it is satisfied after such enquiry as it may think fit that the course of study for the approval of which an application has been made under sub-section (1) is in conformity with the provisions of this Ordinance and the regulations, shall submit the application together with its recommendation to the Government and shall, upon the approval of the course of study by the Government, declare it, by notification in the official Gazette, to be an approved course of study for the purpose of admission to an approved examination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Furnishing of information</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. Every institution or authority which applies for the approval of an examination under section 18 or a course of study under section 19, or holds an examination or conducts an approved course of study shall furnish to the Council such information as the Council may, from time to time, require relating to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the course of study conducted and training given;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the examination held;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the ages at which the students may undergo the course of study;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the equipments and facilities provided for the students; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) matters generally pertaining to the course of study, training and examinations and standard of teaching.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inspectors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Council may appoint such Inspectors for the inspection of institutions as it may consider necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An Inspector may, if he is so authorised by the President of the Council,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        inspect any institution which holds an approved examination or conducts an approved course of study and may attend any such examination held by such institutions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) inspect any institution which has applied for the approval of the examination held, or course of study conducted, by it and attend any examination held by such institution.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An Inspector who attends any examination shall not interfere with the conduct thereof but shall submit to the Council a report on the sufficiency or otherwise of such examination and on any other matter in regard to which the Council may require him to report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Withdrawal of approval</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) Where, upon a report by an Inspector, it appears to the Council that an approved course of study or an approved examination does not continue to be in conformity with the provisions of this Ordinance and the regulations, the Council shall give notice to the institution or authority concerned calling upon it to explain in writing why the approval of its course of study or examination should not be withdrawn.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institution or authority to whom a notice has been given under sub-section (1) shall, within sixty days from the receipt of such notice, comply with the notice and may also make such representation to the Council as it may wish to make.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Council, after considering the explanation given and any representation made under sub-section (2), may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare that its approval of the course of study or examination conducted or held by the institution or authority concerned shall stand withdrawn with effect from such date as may be specified in the notification; and every such declaration shall state that the course of study or examination conducted or held by such institution or authority shall be deemed to be approved only when completed or passed, as the case may be, before the date so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation and maintenance of Registers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) The Council shall prepare and maintain or cause to be prepared and maintained the following Registers of pharmacists and apprentices, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Register A—in which shall be registered the persons specified in clause (a) of sub-section (1) of section 24 and paragraphs (i), (ii), (iii) and (iv) of the proviso to that sub-section;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Register B—in which shall be registered the persons specified in clauses (b) and (c) of sub-section (1) of section 3[ 24] and paragraphs (v), (vi), (vii) and (viii) of the proviso to that sub-section; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Register C—in which shall be registered the apprentices in pharmacy:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Council may, with the previous approval of the Government, discontinue the registration of apprentices in pharmacy and may, with like approval, re-open such registration after it has been discontinued and shall, upon discontinuance or re-opening, publish in the official Gazette a notice thereof specifying the date of such discontinuance or re-opening.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every Register prepared and maintained under sub-section (1) shall contain the following particulars relating to a person so registered, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) full name;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) residential address;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) professional address;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) father's name;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) date and place of birth;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) nationality;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) qualifications;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) date on which registered; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) such other particulars as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Qualifications for registration as a pharmacist or as an apprentice in pharmacy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) The following persons shall, subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), be qualified for registration as pharmacists under this Ordinance, namely :—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        persons who hold a degree in pharmacy conferred by a University or an institution affiliated thereto, where the degree is recognised by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) persons who hold a diploma in Pharmacy recognised by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) persons who pass the examination in Pharmacy held or approved by the Council:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that during the period of two years from the coming into force of this Ordinance, the following persons shall also be deemed to be qualified for registration, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         graduates in Pharmacy from a University or an institution affiliated thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        graduates in science from a University or an institution affiliated thereto, with Chemistry 4[ or Bio-Chemistry] or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Pharmaceutical Chemistry or Pharmacology or Micro Biology as the principal subject, who are engaged for at least two years in the manufacture or test and analysis of drugs and medicines in any drug manufacturing concern licensed under the Drugs Act, 1940 (XXIII of 1940), or in any Government institution or laboratory;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       Inspectors of Drugs appointed under the Drugs Act, 1940 (XXIII of 1940), and Government Analysts so appointed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       teachers in any subject related to pharmacy in any institution conducting courses of study in Pharmacy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        persons who hold diploma in Pharmacy recognised for registration under the Pharmacy Act, 1967;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi)       persons who had been approved by the licensing authority on or before the 30th November, 1974, as “qualified persons” within the meaning of rule 24 of the Drugs Rules, 1946;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vii)      persons engaged in compounding or dispensing medicine in a Government  Hospital; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(viii)      persons certified as qualified compounders and dispensers of medicine by a Government  Hospital.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall, subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), be qualified to be registered as an apprentice in pharmacy if he has been taken as a student or apprentice in pharmacy by, and produces a certificate to that effect from, a pharmacist registered under this Ordinance and approved for the purpose, by notification in the official Gazette, by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No person shall be qualified for registration as a pharmacist or as an apprentice in pharmacy-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) if he is of unsound mind and stands so declared by a court ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) if he has been convicted by a court of any offence which in the opinion of the Council involves moral turpitude.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Procedure for registration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) As soon as may be after the opening of the Registers under section 23, the Council shall, by notification in the official Gazette, invite applications from persons desirous of being registered as pharmacists or as apprentices in pharmacy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An application for registration shall contain such particulars and be made in such form as may be specified by the Council and shall be accompanied by such fees as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Council shall examine every application received by it and, if it is satisfied that the applicant is qualified for registration under section 24, direct the entry of the name of the applicant in the appropriate Register.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Council shall, if it rejects the application of any person, inform the applicant in writing of such rejection within ninety days from the date of receipt of the application, and the applicant may, within sixty days of the receipt of the information, appeal against such rejection to the Government whose decision thereon shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) [Omitted by section 5 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Certificate of registration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) The Council shall issue a certificate of registration to a person who has been registered under section 25.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A certificate of registration issued under sub-section (1) shall bear a number and the official seal of the Council and be signed by the President and the Secretary and shall contain the following, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a passport size photograph of the person registered;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the full signature of the person registered; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        such other particulars as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A copy of the certificate with all the particulars specified in sub-section (2) shall be kept in the official records of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A person to whom a certificate of registration has been issued may, if the original is lost, defaced or mutilated or for any other reason, obtain a duplicate thereof on payment of the same fee as was paid for the original.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (5) A certificate of registration issued under this section shall remain valid for a period of five years from the date of its issue and shall, upon an application made in this behalf, be renewed on payment of the same fee as was paid for the original.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Revocation of certificate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) The Council may, after giving the person concerned an opportunity to make representation and of being heard, revoke the certificate of registration issued to him, if such person—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        incurs any disqualification specified in sub-section (3) of section 24; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) contravenes any of the provisions of the Poisons Act, 1919 (XII of 1919), the Dangerous Drugs Act, 1930 (II of 1930), the Drugs Act, 1940 (XXIII of 1940), or this Ordinance or of the rules made under any of these Acts; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) fails or neglects to comply with any directive in respect of the profession of a pharmacist which the Government may, from time to time, issue; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is guilty of such professional misconduct as may be laid down by the Council in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where any certificate of registration is revoked under sub-section (1), the name of the person whose certificate has been so revoked shall, after he has been given a notice in writing of such revocation, be struck off the Register in which his name was entered and his registration shall thereupon stand cancelled.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Council may, of its own motion, and shall, upon an application made in this behalf within thirty days of the receipt of the notice under sub-section (2) by the person concerned, review its decision regarding revocation of the certificate of registration; and the decision of the Council upon such review shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Examination for registration as pharmacists</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. (1) For the purpose of registration as pharmacists, the Council may after giving notice in this behalf, hold examinations 6[ * * *] in every year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An examination under sub-section (1) shall be held at least at three places in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notice of an examination shall be published for 7[ at least two days] in at least one newspaper in English and one newspaper in Bengali, each having wide circulation in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Every application for admission to an examination shall be made in such manner and in such form as may be specified by the Council and shall be accompanied by—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) such fee as may be prescribed by regulations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a certificate of good moral character from a respectable person; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) such other papers or particulars as may be required by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Qualification for admission to an examination</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. An applicant for admission to an examination under section 28,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        shall not be below seventeen years of age on the date fixed for the examination;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        must have passed the matriculation examination or an equivalent examination with general science as one of the subjects; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        must have been registered as an apprentice in pharmacy for a period of not less than two years before the date fixed for the examination:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that clause (c) shall not apply during any period during which registration of apprentices in pharmacy, remains discontinued under the proviso to sub-section (1) of section 23 and the period of two years thereafter.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition of practice without registration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (4), no person shall, after the expiry of two years from the coming into force of this Ordinance, or such later date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify in this behalf, practice as a pharmacist unless he is a registered pharmacist and displays his certificate of registration in a conspicuous place within the premises in which he so practises.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Whoever employs any pharmacist for the purpose of any business in pharmacy shall 8[ cause] the certificate of registration of the pharmacist so employed to be displayed in a conspicuous place within the premises in which such business is carried on.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Whoever contravenes the provisions of sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) shall be punishable, on first conviction, with fine which may extend to Taka five hundred, and, on each subsequent conviction with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to Taka five hundred, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Nothing in sub-section (1) shall apply to—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a registered medical practitioner as defined in the Medical Council Act, 1973 (XXX of 1973), or a person authorised to prescribe antibiotic and dangerous drugs under the Allopathic System (Prevention of Misuse) Ordinance, 1962 (LXV of 1962), who dispenses medicine to his own patients or serves his own prescriptions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a person who deals in non-poisonous household remedies in original and unopened container at any store or place or prepares non-poisonous household remedies in accordance with the rules made under the Drugs Act, 1940 (XXIII of 1940);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        a person who manufactures, sells or distributes drugs and medicines which fall exclusively under the unani, ayurvedic, bio-chemic or homeopathic system of medicine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        a person engaged as a health or veterinary technician in a Government  Hospital or institution ; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) a foreign pharmacist who is engaged, with the approval of the Council, for the purposes of consultation, advice or instruction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offences, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. No court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Ordinance except upon a complaint in writing made by an Inspector appointed under the Drugs Act, 1940 (XXIII of 1940), or an officer especially empowered in this behalf by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. (1) The Council may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without 9[ prejudice] to the generality of the foregoing power, such regulations may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the procedure for the meeting of the Council and its committees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the management of the property of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) maintenance and audit of the accounts of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the procedure for election of the Vice-President;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the powers and duties of the President, Vice-President and members of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the terms and conditions of service of the Secretary and other officers and staff of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) fees to be prescribed under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) such other matters as are required by this Ordinance to be provided for by regulations or are considered necessary for the efficient performance of the functions of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Until such time as the regulations are made, the President of the Council may issue such instructions as he may consider necessary to regulate all or any of the matters specified in sub-section (2); and any such instructions shall stand rescinded upon the making of the regulations by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. (1) The Pharmacy Act, 1967 (XI of 1967), hereinafter referred to as the said Act, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the said Act,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, and all property, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances, funds and all other interests in, or arising out of, such property of the Pharmacy Council of Pakistan in Bangladesh and of the Pharmacy Council of East Pakistan, hereinafter referred to as the Pharmacy Councils, shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all debts, liabilities and obligations of whatever kind of the Pharmacy Councils subsisting immediately before the establishment of the Council shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, be the debts, liabilities, and obligations of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all officers and staff of the Pharmacy Councils shall stand transferred to and become officers and staff of the Council and shall hold office on the same terms and conditions as were enjoyed by them immediately before the establishment of the Council and shall continue to do so until their terms and conditions are duly altered by the Council:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an officer or staff so transferred shall have the option not to continue in the service of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the Pharmacy Councils immediately before the establishment of the Council shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Council; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        notwithstanding the repeal of the said Act under sub-section (1), the ad hoc Committee constituted by the Government under Notification No. S-IV/2C-31/72-332, dated the 5th August, 1972, shall continue in office until such time as the Council is constituted under section 4 of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “and one is a qualified pharmacist” were inserted by section 2 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word, brackets and letter “clause (f)” were substituted for the word, brackets and letter “clause (g)” by section 2 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The figure “24” was substituted for the figure “23” by section 3 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “or Bio-Chemistry” were inserted by section 4 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Sub-section (5) was inserted by section 6 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word “twice” was omitted by section 7 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The words “at least two days ” were substituted for the words “a continuous period of not less than one week” by section 7 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The word “cause” was substituted for the word “cease” by section 8 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The word “prejudice” was substituted for the word “prejuudice” by section 9 of the Pharmacy (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
584	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE POLICE OFFICERS (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE POLICE OFFICERS (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXXIV OF 1976).[8th November, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for special provisions for maintaining discipline among certain members of the police-force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for special provisions for maintaining discipline among certain members of the police-force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Police Officers (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “authority” means an authority specified in column 2 of the Schedule;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “misconduct” means conduct prejudicial to good order or service discipline or contrary to the Government Servants (Conduct) Rules, 1966, or unbecoming an officer or gentleman; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “police-officer” means a police-officer of, and below, the rank of Inspector mentioned in column 1 of the Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance to override all other laws, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. This Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything contained in any law, rules and regulations relating to police-force nor shall prejudice the operation of any other law, rules and regulations including the service conditions of the said police-force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Where a police-officer is guilty of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         misconduct;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) dereliction of duty;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       act of cowardice and moral turpitude;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) corruption or having persistent reputation of being corrupt;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        subversive activity or association with persons or organisations engaged in subversive activities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi)       desertion from service or unauthorised absence from duty without reasonable excuse; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vii) inefficiency,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">the authority concerned may impose on such police-officer any of the penalties mentioned in section 5.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The following shall be the penalties which may be imposed under this Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        dismissal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) removal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) discharge from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) compulsory retirement ; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) reduction to lower rank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inquiry</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) When a police-officer is to be proceeded against any of the offences mentioned in section 4, the authority concerned shall frame a charge and specify therein the penalty proposed to be imposed and communicate it to the police-officer, hereinafter called the accused, requiring him to show cause within a specified time which shall not be less than seven days and not more than ten days from the date the charge has been communicated to him why the penalty proposed to be imposed on him shall not be imposed and also to state whether he desires to be heard in person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (2) If, after consideration of the cause shown, if any, under sub-section (1) and hearing the accused in person, if he so desires, the authority concerned finds the accused guilty of the charge, or, if no such cause is shown within the specified time, the authority concerned shall, within twenty-one days of the cause shown or, as the case may be, on the expiry of the said time, by notice specifying the penalty proposed to be imposed, require the accused to show cause within a specified time which shall not be less than seven days nor more than ten days from the date of service of the notice why the proposed penalty shall not be imposed on him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If after consideration of the cause shown, if any, under sub-section (2), or, where no such cause is shown within the specified time, the authority concerned decides to impose any penalty on the accused, it shall, within fifteen days of the showing of the cause or, as the case may be, on the expiry of the said time, impose on him the penalty specified in the notice under sub-section (2) or any other lesser penalty.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) For the purpose of this section, a notice shall be deemed to have been validly served if it is served by delivery to the accused or by affixing it to a conspicuous place of his last known residence or by publication in at least two newspapers.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. A police-officer on whom a penalty has been imposed under section 6 may, within seven days of the receipt of the order of punishment, appeal against the order to the appellate authority concerned specified in column 3 of the Schedule, who shall, within 2[ forty-five] days of the date of receipt of the appeal, communicate to the appellant his decision which shall be final.      3[</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Revision and review</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ 7A. Notwithstanding anything contained in section 7, the Government may, upon an application made to it by an aggrieved police-officer or on its own motion, within one month from the date of making of a decision by an appellate authority under that section,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) revise such decision, if made by an appellate authority other than the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) review such decision, if made by it as an appellate authority.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Court’s jurisdiction barred</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. No order passed under any of the provisions of this Ordinance shall be called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Sub-sections (2), (3) and (4) were substituted by section 2 of the Police Officers (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1982 (Ordinance No. XXII of 1982)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “forty-five” was substituted for the word “fifteen” by section 3 of the Police Officers (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1982 (Ordinance No. XXII of 1982)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Section 7A was inserted by section 4 of the Police Officers (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1982 (Ordinance No. XXII of 1982)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Section 7A was inserted by section 4 of the Police Officers (Special Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1982 (Ordinance No. XXII of 1982)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
585	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE POLITICAL PARTIES ORDINANCE, 1978 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE POLITICAL PARTIES ORDINANCE, 1978 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLV OF 1978).[18th November, 1978]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the formation and regulation of political parties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the formation and regulation of political parties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Political Parties Ordinance, 1978.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “foreign aided party” means a political party which-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         has been formed or organised at the instance of any Government or political party of a foreign country; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        is affiliated to or associated with any Government or political party of a foreign country; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       receives any aid, financial or otherwise, from any Government, political party or national of a foreign country;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “political party” includes a group or combination of persons who operate under a distinctive name and who hold themselves out for the purpose of propagating any political opinion or engaging in any other political activity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Formation of certain political parties prohibited</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) No political party shall be formed with the object of propagating any opinion, or acting in a manner, prejudicial to the sovereignty, integrity or security of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No person shall form, organise, set up or convene a foreign aided party or in any way be associated with any such party.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Underground activity and armed cadre prohibited</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. No political party shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        maintain any secret or underground organisation, group or agency, or engage in any secret or underground activity; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        organise or maintain any armed cadre, volunteer corps or any other organisation, by whatever name called, which is intended or is likely to operate like a disciplined force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Funds to be operated through bank account</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. All funds of a political party shall be maintained and operated through a scheduled bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reference to High Court Division regarding certain political parties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Where the Government is of the opinion that any political party has been formed or is operating in contravention of section 3 or has contravened any provision of section 4 or section 5, it shall refer the matter to the High Court Division, and the decision of the High Court Division on such question, given after hearing the person or persons concerned, shall be final:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the Government deems it necessary in the public interest so to do, it may, by order published in the official Gazette, direct such political party to suspend its operation or activity until the High Court Division has given its decision on the reference, and upon the publication of the order, the political party shall suspend its operation or activity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where the High Court Division, upon a reference under sub-section (1), has given a decision that a political party has been formed or is operating in contravention of section 3 or has contravened any provision of section 4 or section 5, the decision shall be published in the official Gazette, and upon such publication, the political party concerned shall stand dissolved and all its properties and funds shall be forfeited to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. If any person after the publication of any order in respect of a political party under the proviso to section 6(1) or the dissolution of a political party under section 6(2), holds himself out as a member or office bearer of that party, or acts for, or otherwise associates himself with, that party, he shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Sanction for prosecution</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. No prosecution under this Ordinance shall be instituted against any person without the previous sanction in writing of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
586	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PRESIDENT’S PENSION ORDINANCE, 1979 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PRESIDENT’S PENSION ORDINANCE, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XVIII OF 1979).[20th March, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for payment of pension to persons who have held office as President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for payment of pension and other benefits to persons who have held office as President of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the President's Pension Ordinance, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Pension to ex-President</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) There shall be payable to a person who, having held the office of President of Bangladesh for a period of not less than six months, has ceased to hold office by reason of resignation or expiration of the term of office 1[ a monthly pension, for the remainder of his life, of a sum equal to 2[ seventy five per cent] of the salary payable to him per mensem before he ceased to hold such office 3[ subject to a minimum of seven thousand five hundred taka,]] unless he elects under sub-section (2) to receive gratuity in lieu thereof:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where any such person receives a monthly pension from the Consolidated Fund for having retired from any service, post or office, he shall be entitled to receive either such pension or the pension payable under this section and shall not be entitled to both 4[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that when any such person elects to receive pension payable under this section, the sum received by him on commutation of his earlier pension shall not be recoverable either by adjustment or otherwise.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person entitled to receive pension under sub-section (1) may, within one month from the date on which he becomes so entitled, elect to receive in lieu of such pension a gratuity, and if he so elects, shall be paid as gratuity 5[ a sum equal to the amount of pension payable to him for each completed year of the period for which he has held office as President subject to a maximum of eight times of the amount of such pension for one year].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If a person entitled to receive pension under sub-section (1) dies without receiving such pension or without electing for gratuity under sub-section (2), he shall be deemed to have elected for gratuity and the sum due to him as gratuity shall be paid to the person nominated by him in this behalf or, in the absence of such nomination, to his heirs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If a person while holding office as President dies after having held office for more than 6[ six months], there shall be paid to the person nominated by him in this behalf or, in the absence of such nomination, to his heirs, the sum which would have been due to him as gratuity under sub-section (2) had he died after ceasing to hold office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (5) If a person entitled to receive pension under sub-section (1) dies after receiving such pension, his widow shall be entitled to a monthly pension, for the remainder of her life, equal to two-thirds of the monthly pension he was entitled to receive at the time of his death.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this sub-section “widow” includes a “widower”.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Other benefits</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ 3. (1) Subject to any rules made in this behalf, a person entitled to receive pension under this Ordinance shall also be entitled to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        one personal assistant and one attendant and office expenses, the total annual expenditure of which shall be determined by the Government from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) medical facilities which are admissible to a Minister;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the use of Government transport free of charge for attending official functions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) have one telephone installed at his residence and exemption from payment of charges in respect thereof to the extent to be determined by the Government from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) a diplomatic passport; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         stay in any circuit house or rest house owned by the Government without payment of rent during travel within the country.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The facilities in sub-section (1) (b), (e) and (f) shall also be admissible to the spouse of a person who is entitled to them.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Rights not admissible in certain cases</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Pension and other benefits under this Ordinance shall not be admissible to a person entitled thereto if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (a) holds or has held, after he ceased to hold office as President, any office, seat, position or post in respect of which he receives or has received any salary from the Consolidated Fund; or]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is, after he has become so entitled, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[Omitted]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. [Pension, etc., to be a charge on Consolidated Fund.- Omitted by section 3 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1995 (Act No. XXIII of 1995).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make Rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words and commas “a monthly pension, for the remainder of his life, of a sum equal to half of the salary payable to him per mensem before he ceased to hold such office” were substituted for the words “a pension of two thousand taka per month for the remainder of his life” by section 2 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. VII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “seventy five per cent” were substituted for the word “half ” by section 2 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1995 (Act No. XXIII of 1995)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words and comma “subject to a minimum of seven thousand five hundred taka,” were inserted by section 2 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1995 (Act No. XXIII of 1995)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The colon (:) was substituted for the full-stop (.) and the proviso was added thereafter by section 2 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. VII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “a sum equal to the amount of pension payable to him for each completed year of the period for which he has held office as President subject to a maximum of eight times of the amount of such pension for one year” were substituted for the words “a sum calculated at the rate of taka twenty-five thousand for each completed year of the period for which he has held office as President subject to a maximum of Taka two lakh” by section 2 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. VII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words “six months” were substituted for the words “one year” by section 2 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. VII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Sub-section (5) was added by section 2 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. VII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Section 3 was substituted by section 3 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. VII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Clause (a) was substituted by section 4 of the President's Pension (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. VII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
587	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PREVENTION OF MALARIA (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1978 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PREVENTION OF MALARIA (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE, 1978 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. IV OF 1978).[9th February, 1978]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to make provision for the prevention of malaria and for matters connected therewith.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the prevention of malaria and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Prevention of Malaria (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1978.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Formulation of measures, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) For the purpose of prevention of malaria, the Government or any person authorised by it in this behalf may,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) formulate schemes and adopt co-ordinated measures for prevention of malaria;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) lay down the policy in accordance with which the Directorate of Health Services shall execute any such schemes or measures;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) evaluate and assess the execution of the schemes and measures; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) have overall responsibility for the success of any such schemes or measures.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A scheme or measure formulated or adopted under sub-section (1) may relate to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the spraying of buildings and other premises with insecticides;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the survey of the country;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the medical examination of the people;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the treatment of persons suffering or suspected to be suffering from malaria;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the delimitation of malarious areas and the areas free from malaria and measures to prevent appearance or re-appearance of malaria in the latter areas; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         such other measures considered necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to require and prohibit doing of certain things</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government or any person authorised by it in this behalf may, by order,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        require any person to undergo medical examination and treatment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        require every person having knowledge or information of any case of malaria or suspected malaria to report the case to any specified authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        require every person coming from a malarious area and entering into a malaria-free area to report for examination at the nearest malaria detection post on arrival at the destination;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        require any employer in the district of Chittagong Hill Tracts to furnish to the nearest malaria detection post particulars of his employees coming from any other district so that necessary measures for their protection against malaria may be adopted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        prohibit from washing, white-washing, plastering, painting or applying any other surface treatment with respect to any building or other premises sprayed with insecticide during a period of five months from such spraying; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         prohibit doing of anything with respect to any engineering, agricultural and industrial projects which may increase the extent and spread of malaria.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person authorised in this behalf by the Government may apply insecticide, collect mosquitoes, check insecticide deposits, take blood films and do such other acts as are considered necessary to control or prevent malaria or to collect information relating to malaria and for any such purpose enter into any premises.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Whoever contravenes an order under sub-section (1) or obstructs or resists any person acting under sub section (2) of section 3 shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to taka five hundred, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is, in good faith, done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
588	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PUBLIC EXAMINATIONS (OFFENCES) ACT 1980</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE PUBLIC EXAMINATIONS (OFFENCES) ACT 1980</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XLII OF 1980).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[28th March, 1980]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the punishment of offences relating to public examinations. WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the punishment of offences relating to public examinations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Public Examinations (Offences) Act 1980.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means a board, body, authority or institution, by whatever name called, established or constituted by or under any law for the time being in force for the organisation, regulation, supervision, control or development of education of any type;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “examination hall” means a place or premises where a public examination is held;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “examinee” means a person in whose name a written authority, by whatever name called, for admission to a public examination has been issued by a University or Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “public examination” means any examination that is, or may be, held, conducted, regulated or organised by a University or Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “University” means a University established by or under any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Personation at public examination</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Whoever,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) not being an examinee, enters the examination hall during a public examination declaring himself or holding himself out as an examinee; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) appears at a public examination in the name of any other person or in a fictitious name,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 1[ five years and shall not be less than one year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Publication or distribution of question papers before public examination</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4.
