Whoever discloses, publishes or distributes, by any means whatsoever, before any public examination is held,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any paper containing any question set for such examination; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any paper containing any question falsely purporting to be set for such examination or intending that the same may be treated as identical with any question set for such examination,shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall not be less than three years, and shall also be liable to fine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Altering or tampering with any marks, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Whoever, without any lawful authority, alters or tampers with, in any manner, any marks, mark sheet, tabulation sheet, certificate, diploma or degree relating to any public examination, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to four years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Making, etc, of false mark sheet, certificate, diploma or degree</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Whoever makes, prints, distributes, or uses or, without lawful excuse, has in his possession any mark sheet, certificate, diploma or degree relating to any public examination which he knows to be false or not issued by the University or Board having authority to issue the same, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 3[ seven years and shall not be less than three years, and shall also be liable to fine].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Possession of blank form of mark sheet, certificate, diploma or degree</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. Whoever, without lawful excuse, has in his possession any blank form of mark sheet, certificate, diploma or degree relating to any public examination which has not been issued or delivered to him by or under the authority of the University or Board, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Substitution of or addition to answer scripts</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. Whoever substitutes one answer script relating to any public examination or part thereof for another or adds to an answer script any extra page with answer not written by the examinee himself in the examination hall during the examination period, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 4[ ten years and shall not be less than three years, and shall also be liable to fine].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Helping examinees</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Whoever helps any examinee-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) by supplying in the examination hall any written answer or any book or written paper or any page thereof or extract therefrom; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) by dictating any answer orally or by any mechanical means ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) by any other means whatsoever,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 6[ five years and shall not be less than two years, and shall also be liable to fine].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Conducting public examinations or examining answer scripts by unauthorised persons</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Whoever, not being appointed or authorised by a University or Board, conducts any public examination in an examination hall or examines any answer script relating to a public examination, or whoever conducts any public examination in an examination hall or examines any answer script relating to a public examination in the name of any other person or in a fictitious name, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Obstructions in public examinations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Whoever in any manner intentionally-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) obstructs any person in the discharge of his duties in connection with a public examination; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) obstructs the holding of a public examination; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) creates disturbances in any examination hall,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences by officers or employees of University or Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Whoever, being an officer or employee of a University or Board or being entrusted with any duty or responsibility in connection with any public examination, commits an offence under this Act shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Abetment of and attempt to commit offences under this Act</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Whoever abets or attempts to commit any offence under this Act shall be punishable with the punishment provided for the offence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Procedure</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Code of Criminal Procedure 1898 (V of 1898),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) an offence under this Act shall be cognizable;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) no Court other than that of a Metropolitan Magistrate or a Magistrate of the first class shall try an offence under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) a Court trying an offence under this Act shall try the offence summarily in accordance with the procedure laid down in the said Code for summary trial of summons cases;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) a Court may pass any sentence under this Act in excess of its power under the said Code.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Repeal and savings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Public Examinations (Offences) Ordinance 1980 (VI of 1980), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “five years and shall not be less than one year” were substituted for the words and commas “two years, or with fine, or with both” by section 2 of the Public Examinations (Offences) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XLI of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words and comma “ten years and shall not be less than three years, and shall also be liable to fine” were substituted for the words and commas “four years, or with fine, or with both” by section 3 of the Public Examinations (Offences) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XLI of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words and comma “seven years and shall not be less than three years, and shall also be liable to fine” were substituted for the words and commas “four years, or with fine, or with both” by section 4 of the Public Examinations (Offences) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XLI of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words and comma “ten years and shall not be less than three years, and shall also be liable to fine” were substituted for the words and commas “two years, or with fine, or with both” by section 5 of the Public Examinations (Offences) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XLI of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The semi-colon and word “; or” were substituted for the comma (,) and clause (c) was added by section 6 of the Public Examinations (Offences) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XLI of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words and comma “five years and shall not be less than two years, and shall also be liable to fine” were substituted for the words and commas “two years, or with fine, or with both” by section 6 of the Public Examinations (Offences) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XLI of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
589	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PUBLIC SERVANTS (MARRIAGE WITH FOREIGN NATIONALS) ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PUBLIC SERVANTS (MARRIAGE WITH FOREIGN NATIONALS) ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LVII OF 1976).[10th July, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for restriction on marriage with foreign nationals.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for restriction on marriage of public servants with foreign nationals and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Public Servants (Marriage with Foreign Nationals) Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “foreign national” means a person who is not a citizen of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “marriage” means matrimonial relationship entered into in accordance with any law for the time being in force or any religious rites or ceremonies, and its grammatical variations and cognate expressions shall be construed accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “nationalised enterprise” means any corporation or any commercial or industrial enterprise including a bank which, or the entire or majority share in which, is owned or held by, or vested in, the Government or any local authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “public servant” includes any person who is, for the time being, in the service of the Republic or of any local authority or nationalised enterprise; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ ***]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on marriage with foreign nationals</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 3.(1) A public servant shall not marry or promise to marry a foreign national except with the permission granted under sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The President may, on an application made in this behalf, grant a public servant permission to marry or promise to marry a foreign national.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A public servant who contravenes the provisions of sub-section (1) shall, notwithstanding anything contained in any other law or in the terms and conditions of his service, be liable to be removed from service.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. This Ordinance repeals and supersedes all laws, rules and other instruments in force immediately before its commencement relating to marriage or promise of marriage of a public servant with a foreign national.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (e) was omitted by section 2 of The Public Servants (Marriage with Foreign Nationals) (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act. No. XLII of 2009).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Section 3 was substituted by section 3 of The Public Servants (Marriage with Foreign Nationals) (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act. No. XLII of 2009) (with effect from 2nd July,  2008).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
590	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE RAILWAY NIRAPATTA BAHINI ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE RAILWAY NIRAPATTA BAHINI ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLVII OF 1976).[28th June, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the constitution of a Force for the better protection and security of railway property and for the regulation thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the constitution of a Force for the better protection and security of railway property and for the regulation thereof and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Railway Nirapatta Bahini Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Chief Commandant” means the Chief Commandant of the Force appointed under section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Force” means the Railway Nirapatta Bahini constituted under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “member of the Force” means a person appointed to the Force under this Ordinance other than a superior officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “railway property” includes any goods, money or valuable security, or animal, belonging to, or in the charge or possession of, the railway administration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “superior officer” means any of the officers of the Force appointed under section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) words and expressions used but not defined in this Ordinance and defined in the Railways Act, 1890 (IX of 1890), shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them under that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be constituted and maintained by the Government a Force to be called the Railway Nirapatta Bahini for the better protection and security of railway property.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Force shall be constituted in such manner and shall consist of such number of superior officers and members as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of superior officers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Government shall appoint a Chief Commandant of the Force, and may appoint one or more Commandants and Assistant Commandants of the Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The appointment of the Chief Commandant and other superior officers shall be made in such manner and on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chief Commandant and every other superior officer shall possess and exercise such powers and authority over the members of the Force under their respective commands as is provided by or under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Classes and ranks of members of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. There may be all or any of the following classes of officers and other ranks among the members of the Force, who shall take rank in the order mentioned, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">A. Classes of officers—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         Chief Inspector,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) Inspector,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) Sub-Inspector,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) Assistant Sub-Inspector;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">B. Classes of other ranks—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         Havildar,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        Naik,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       Prohari.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of members of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The appointment of members of the Force shall be made by the Chief Commandant in such manner and on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the power of appointment under this section may also be exercised by such other superior officer as the Chief Commandant may by order specify in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every member of the Force shall, on appointment, receive a certificate in the form set out in the Schedule under the seal and signature of the Chief Commandant or such other superior officer as the Chief Commandant may specify in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A certificate of appointment shall stand cancelled whenever the person named therein ceases for any reason to be a member of the Force and shall remain inoperative during the period of his suspension from the Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Superintendence and administration of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The superintendence of the Force shall vest in the Government, and subject thereto the administration of the Force shall vest in the Chief Commandant who shall discharge his functions in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance and of any rules made thereunder and under the general supervision of the General Manager of the Bangladesh Railway.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Punishment to members of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Subject to the provisions of article 135 of the Constitution and to such rules as may be made by the Government in this behalf, any superior officer may, by order in writing stating reasons therefor, award any one or more of the following punishments to any member of the Force whom he finds to be guilty of disobedience, breach of discipline, misconduct, corruption, neglect of duty or remissness in the discharge of any duty, or of any act rendering him unfit for the discharge of his duty, namely:—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        dismissal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        removal from service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        compulsory retirement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) reduction in rank or grade;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) stoppage of promotion;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) forfeiture of seniority for not more than one year;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) forfeiture of pay and allowances for not exceeding one month;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) forfeiture of increment in pay;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) fine to any amount not exceeding one month's pay;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         confinement to quarters for a period not exceeding fourteen days with or without punishment, drill, extra guard, fatigue or other duty;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        censure.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any superior officer may place under suspension any member of the Force against whom action under sub-section (1) is required to be taken or against whom any inquiry is required to be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An appeal against any order passed under sub-section (1) shall lie to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the General Manager of the Bangladesh Railway, if the order is passed by the Chief Commandant;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Chief Commandant, if the order is passed by any other superior officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Superior officers and members of the Force to be deemed to be railway servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Chief Commandant and every other superior officer and every member of the Force shall for all purposes be deemed to be railway servants within the meaning of the Railways Act, 1890 (IX of 1890), other than Chapter VIA thereof, and shall be entitled to exercise the powers conferred on railway servants by or under that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Duties of superior officers and members of the Force</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. It shall be the duty of every superior officer and member of the Force—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        promptly to execute all orders lawfully issued to him by his superior authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to protect and safeguard railway property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to remove any obstruction in the movement of railway property; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to do any other act conducive to the better protection and security of railway property.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to arrest without warrant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Any superior officer or member of the Force may, without any order from a Magistrate and without a warrant, arrest-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any person who has been concerned in an offence relating to railway property punishable with imprisonment for a term exceeding six months, or against whom a reasonable suspicion exists of his having been so concerned; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any person found taking precautions to conceal his presence within railway limits under circumstances which afford reason to believe that he is taking such precautions with a view to committing theft of, or damage to, railway property.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to search without warrant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) Whenever any superior officer, or any member of the Force, not below the rank of Havildar, has reason to believe that any such offence as is referred to in section 11 has been or is being committed and that a search-warrant cannot be obtained without affording the offender an opportunity of escaping or of concealing evidence of the offence, he may detain him and search his person and belongings forthwith and, if he thinks proper, arrest any person whom he has reason to believe to have committed the offence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (V of 1898), relating to searches under that Code shall, so far as may be, apply to searches under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Procedure to be followed after arrest</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Any superior officer or member of the Force making an arrest under this Ordinance shall, without unnecessary delay, make over the person so arrested to a police officer, or, in the absence of a police officer, take such person or cause such person to be taken to the nearest police-station.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Superior officers and members of the Force to be considered always on duty and liable to be employed in any part of the railways</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Every superior officer and member of the Force shall, for the purpose of this Ordinance, be considered to be always on duty, and shall, at any time, be liable to be employed in any part of the railways throughout Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No superior officer or member of the Force shall engage himself in any employment other than his duties under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Superior officers and members of the Force not to form any trade union</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, superior officers and members of the Force shall have no right to form any trade union or to be members or officers of any trade union.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalties for neglect of duty, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. Without prejudice to the provisions of section 8, any member of the Force who is guilty of cowardice or of any violation of duty or wilful breach of any provision of law or of any rule, regulation or order which it is his duty as such member to observe or obey or who withdraws himself from the duties of his office without permission, or who, being absent on leave, fails, without reasonable cause, to report himself for duty on the expiration of the leave, or who engages himself without authority in any employment other than his duty as a member of the Force, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand taka, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. No superior officer or member of the Force shall be liable to any penalty or to payment of any damage on account of an act done in good faith in pursuance or intended pursuance of any duty imposed or any authority conferred on him by any provision of this Ordinance or of any rule made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Court’s jurisdiction barred in respect of certain orders</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 17A. No order passed under any of the provisions of section 8 shall be called in question in any court.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Limitation of Legal proceedings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, any legal proceeding, whether civil or criminal, which may lawfully be brought against any superior officer or member of the Force for anything done or intended to be done under the powers conferred by, or in pursuance of, any provision of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder shall be commenced within three months after the act complained of shall have been committed, and not otherwise; and notice in writing of such proceeding and of the cause thereof shall be given to the person concerned and his superior officer at least one month before the commencement of such proceeding.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provisions relating to existing Railway Nirapatta Bahini</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Railway Nirapatta Bahini in existence at the commencement of this Ordinance shall be deemed to be the Force constituted under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chief Commandant, Commandants, Assistant Commandants, Chief Inspectors, Inspectors, Sub-Inspectors, Assistant Sub-Inspectors, Havildars, Naiks and Prohoris of the Railway Nirapatta Bahini in existence at the commencement of this Ordinance shall be deemed to have been appointed as such under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Anything done or any action taken before the commencement of this Ordinance in relation to the constitution of the Railway Nirapatta Bahini referred to in sub-section (1) and in relation to any person appointed thereto shall be as valid and as effective in law as if such thing or action was done or taken under this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this sub-section shall render any person guilty of any offence in respect of anything done or committed to be done by him before the commencement of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Section 17A was inserted by section 2 of the Railway Nirapatta Bahini (Amendment) Ordinance, 1977 (Ordinance No. XLIV of 1977)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
591	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE RAILWAY PROPERTY (UNLAWFUL POSSESSION) ORDINANCE, 1979 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE RAILWAY PROPERTY (UNLAWFUL POSSESSION) ORDINANCE, 1979 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XVII OF 1979).[28th March, 1979]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to consolidate and amend the law relating to unlawful possession of railway property.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to unlawful possession of railway property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Railway Property (Unlawful Possession) Ordinance, 1979.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Force” means the Railway Nirapatta Bahini constituted under section 3 of the Railway Nirapatta Bahini Ordinance, 1976 (XLVII of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “member of the Force” means a person appointed to the Force other than a superior officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “officer of the Force” means an officer of and above the rank of Assistant Sub-Inspector appointed to the Force and includes a superior officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “railway property” includes any goods, money or valuable security or animal, belonging to, or in the charge or possession of, the railway Administration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “superior officer” means any of the officers of the Force appointed under section 4 of the Railway Nirapatta Bahini Ordinance, 1976 (XLVII of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) words and expressions used but not defined in this Ordinance and defined in the Railways Act, 1890 (IX of 1890), shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them under that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty for unlawful possession of railway property</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Whoever is found, or is proved to have been, in possession of any railway property reasonably suspected of having been stolen or unlawfully obtained shall, unless he proves that the railway property came into his possession lawfully, be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty for connivance at offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Any owner or occupier of land or building, or any agent of such owner or occupier in-charge of the management of that land or building, who wilfully connives at an offence against the provisions of this Ordinance, shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences under the Ordinance not to be cognizable</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (V of 1898), an offence under this Ordinance shall not be cognizable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to arrest without warrant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Any superior officer or member of the Force may, without an order from a Magistrate and without a warrant, arrest any person who has been concerned in an offence punishable under this Ordinance or against whom a reasonable suspicion exists of his having been so concerned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disposal of persons arrested</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. Every person arrested for an offence punishable under this Ordinance shall, if the arrest was made by a person other than an officer of the Force, be forwarded without delay to the nearest officer of the Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inquiry how to be made against arrested persons</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) When any person is arrested by an officer of the Force for an offence punishable under this Ordinance or is forwarded to him under section 7, he shall proceed to inquire into the charge against such person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For this purpose the officer of the Force may exercise the same powers and shall be subject to the same provisions as the Officer-in-Charge of a Police-station may exercise and is subject to under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (V of 1898), when investigating a cognizable case:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) if the officer of the Force is of opinion that there is sufficient evidence or reasonable ground of suspicion against the accused person, he shall either admit him to bail to appear before a Magistrate having jurisdiction in the case, or forward him in custody to such Magistrate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) if it appears to the officer of the Force that there is not sufficient evidence or reasonable ground of suspicion against the accused person, he shall release the accused person on his executing a bond, with or without sureties as the officer of the Force may direct, to appear, if and when so required, before the Magistrate having jurisdiction in the case, and shall make a report of all the particulars of the case to his official superior.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to summon persons to give evidence and produce documents</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) An officer of the Force shall have power to summon any person whose attendance he considers necessary either to give evidence or to produce a document, or any other thing in any inquiry which such officer is making for any of the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A summons to produce documents or other things may be for the production of certain specified documents or things or for the production of all documents or things of a certain description in the possession or under the control of the person summoned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All persons, so summoned, shall be bound to attend either in person or by an authorised agent as such officer may direct; and all persons so summoned shall be bound to state the truth upon any subject respecting which they are examined or make statements and to produce such documents and other things as may be required:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the exemptions under sections 132 and 133 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (V of 1908), shall be applicable to requisitions for attendance under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Every such inquiry, as aforesaid, shall be deemed to be a judicial proceeding within the meaning of section 193 and section 228 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Issue of search warrant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) If an officer of the Force has reason to believe that any place is used for the deposit or sale of railway property which had been stolen or unlawfully obtained, he shall make an application to the Magistrate, having jurisdiction over the area in which that place is situated, for issue of a search warrant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Magistrate to whom an application is made under sub-section (1) may, after such inquiry as he thinks necessary, by his warrant authorise any officer of the Force-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to enter, with such assistance as may be required, such place;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to search the same in the manner specified in the warrant;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to take possession of any railway property therein found which he reasonably suspects to be stolen or unlawfully obtained; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to convey such railway property before a Magistrate, or to guard the same on the spot until the offender is taken before a Magistrate, or otherwise to dispose thereof in some place of safety.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Searches and arrests how to be made</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. All searches and arrests made under this Ordinance shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (V of 1898), relating respectively to searches and arrests made under that Code.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of Courts to order forfeiture of vehicles, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Any Court trying an offence punishable under this Ordinance may order the forfeiture to Government of any property in respect of which the Court is satisfied that an offence under this Ordinance has been committed and may also order the forfeiture of any receptacles, packages or coverings in which such property is contained, and the animals, vehicles, or other conveyances used in carrying the property.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance to override other laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Railway Stores (Unlawful Possession) Ordinance, 1944 (XIX of 1944), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
592	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE RAJSHAHI TOWN DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>RAJSHAHI</strong><strong> </strong><strong>TOWN</strong><strong> DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXVIII OF 1976).[22nd October, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of an Authority for the formulation and execution of plans and schemes for the development of Rajshahi Town and certain areas in its vicinity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of an Authority for the formulation and execution of plans and schemes for the development of Rajshahi Town and certain areas in its vicinity and for matters connected therewith and ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975 and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>CHAPTER I</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>PRELIMINARY</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Rajshahi Town Development Authority Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the areas comprised within the limits of the Rajshahi Municipality and to such other areas in the vicinity of the said municipality as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force in such areas and on such dates as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Authorised Officer” means an officer appointed by the Authority, by notification in the official Gazette, to exercise and perform the powers and functions of an authorised officer under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Authority” means the Rajshahi Town Development Authority established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Authority;           (d)       “Commissioner” means the Commissioner of the Rajshahi Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “member” means a member of the Authority and includes the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “municipal area” means the area of the Rajshahi Municipality;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “municipality” means the Rajshahi Municipality;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “Paurashava” means the Rajshahi Paurashava constituted under the Bangladesh Local Government (Union Parishad and Paurashava) Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 22 of 1973); and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER II</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CONSTITUTION OF THE AUTHORITY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish an Authority to be called the Rajshahi Town Development Authority for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to rules made under this Ordinance, to hold, acquire and dispose of properties, both movable and immovable, and shall by the same name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Authority shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Chairman of the Rajshahi Paurashava, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Deputy Commissioner, Rajshahi, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) one representative of the Public Works Department, not below the rank of Superintending Engineer, to be nominated by the Ministry of Public Works and Urban Development;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) one representative of the Roads and Highways Department, not below the rank of Superintending Engineer, to be nominated by the Ministry of Communications (Railway, Roads , Highway and Road Transport Division);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) one representative of the Telegraph and Telephone Department, not below the rank of Superintending Engineer, to be nominated by the Ministry of Communications (Posts, Telegraph and Telephone Division);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) one representative of the Public Health Engineering, not below the rank of Superintending Engineer, to be nominated by the Ministry of Land Administration, Local Government, Rural Development and Co-operatives (Local Government, Rural Development and Co-operative Division);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) one representative of the Ministry of Health, Population Control and Labour, to be nominated by that Ministry; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) three persons, to be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The members appointed under clause (i) of sub-section (1), hereinafter referred to as the non-official members, shall hold office for a period of three years at a time, unless their appointment is terminated earlier by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman who shall be the executive head of the Authority may be either a whole-time or a part-time officer and shall hold the office for such period and shall be entitled to such remuneration and other benefits as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The non-official members shall be entitled to receive such fee or allowance for attending the meetings of the Authority as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman or any member, other than an ex-officio member, may at any time, resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that his resignation shall not take effect unless accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Government may, at any time by order in writing, terminate the appointment of the Chairman or any member, other than an ex-officio member, without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disqualifications of members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. No person shall be, or shall continue to be, a member who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is, or at any time has been, convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) is, or at any time has been, adjudicated insolvent;     (c) is a minor; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) has directly or indirectly, any share or interest in any contract or employment with, by, or on behalf of, the Authority; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) in the case of a non-official member, does not reside permanently in the area to which this Ordinance extends and does not pay any tax or rate to the Paurashava.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The meetings of the Authority shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until rules are made in this behalf, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All meetings of the Authority shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by a member elected for that purpose by the members present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Authority, a non-official member and four other members, including the Chairman, shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All questions at a meeting of the Authority, shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in case of equality of votes, the Chairman or the person presiding over the meeting shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Authority shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of a vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Authority may constitute from amongst its members as many committees and for such purposes as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Association with the authority or committees of persons who are not members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Authority or any committee thereof may associate with itself any person whose assistance or advice it may desire in carrying out any of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person associated with the Authority or any committee thereof under sub-section (1) for any purpose shall have a right to take part in the discussions in a meeting of the Authority or of the committee, but shall have no right of vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER III</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">POWERS AND DUTIES OF THE AUTHORITY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of records of existing services, facilities, public utilities and of important public properties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Authority shall, as soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, collect maps and other relevant records, undertake physical survey and do such other things as it may deem necessary for the purpose of preparation of records of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        existing drainage system, indicating its efficiency and deficiency;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) maps of all drains owned and maintained by Government or any local authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) maps of drains over private land forming part and parcel of the drainage system in the area to which this Ordinance extends;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        existing water supply and distribution system, location and capacity of different water works including deep tube-wells, overhead tanks, main water-supply pipe lines and the areas served by different water works indicating the efficiency and deficiencies of such water works;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) educational institutions, particularly primary and secondary schools, indicating their location, standard, number of pupils and the population of the area served by each such institution;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) existing public open spaces, play grounds for teenagers and other places of recreation, indicating their location, site, and the area and population served by each such open space, play ground or place of recreation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) existing road system, traffic load and nature of traffic on different roads indicating the efficiency and deficiencies of the system; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) properties including vacant lands owned by Government, local authorities, and corporations, indicating their present use.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The records of existing services, facilities, public utilities and important public properties shall be preserved in printed maps, charts, graphs, and in such other written documents as the Authority may deem appropriate and printed copies of such records shall be made available to the public on payment of such fees as the Authority may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of general development plan</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Authority shall prepare in the prescribed manner a general development plan for the area within its territorial limits and submit the same to the Government for approval; and the Government may approve the plan with or without modifications.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The general development plan shall broadly indicate,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        future road system;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) future drainage system;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) future water supply system;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) future distribution of educational institutions, health service facilities, public open spaces and places of recreation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        location of future industrial establishments and commercial centres;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) lands likely to be required for development projects the execution of which may commence within five years from the date of submission of the general development plan to the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) such other matters as the Authority may deem fit to indicate in it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The general development plan shall include such maps, charts, graphs and other descriptive matters and reports as the Authority may consider necessary to fully explain the proposals contained in the plan with their implications, justifications and benefits.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The general development plan shall lay down such basic planning policy as the Authority may deem appropriate for overall long term development of the areas to which this Ordinance extends but the plan need not precisely indicate the land to be required or acquired for any purpose, alignment for any road, drain or water supply line, the boundaries of any public open space or the sites for educational institutions, heath service facilities and other amenities and public utility services.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All future development schemes for any area within the limits of the Authority formulated by the Authority or other agencies shall be in conformity with the general development plan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of functional master plans</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Authority shall, pursuant to the general development plan, prepare in the prescribed manner functional master plans relating to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        land use zoning and land reservation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) water supply, sewerage and drainage;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) roads, highways and traffic circulation; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) community planning, housing, slum clearance and slum improvement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority may, pursuant to the general development plan, call upon any local Authority or Government organisation or institution dealing with electric supply, railways and tele-communications in an area to which this Ordinance extends to prepare functional master plans in respect of electric supply, railways and tele-communication and thereupon the local Authority or Government organisation or institution shall prepare in the prescribed manner functional master plans in respect thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Authority, any local authority or any Government organisation or institution may be required to prepare functional master plans for the purpose of this Ordinance on such matters as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All functional master plans prepared under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) shall be submitted by the Authority to the Government for approval and the Government may approve such plans with or without modifications.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">No use of land contrary to functional master plans</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) No person shall, except with previous permission of the Authority, use any land for any purpose other than that laid down in any functional master plan approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All future developments and constructions, both public and private, within the area to which this Ordinance extends shall be in conformity with the functional master plans approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No compensation shall be payable to any person owing to the restricted use to which this land may be put under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of development schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Authority shall prepare in the prescribed manner and submit to the Government for approval specific development schemes for an area to which this Ordinance extends or any part thereof on the basis of the functional master plans, and all such development schemes shall contain plans for the proposed developments, including those for housing, if any, written reports, specifications of works, estimates of cost and proposed methods of financing.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A development scheme prepared and submitted under sub-section (1) may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the acquisition of any land in the area comprised in the scheme, which may, in the opinion of the Authority, be required for, or be affected by, the execution of the scheme;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the laying out or re-laying out of the land in the said area;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) such demolition, alteration or reconstruction of buildings situated on the land which it is proposed to acquire in the said area as the Authority may consider necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the construction of any building which the Authority may consider it necessary to erect for any purpose, consistent with the provisions of this Ordinance, other than sale;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) laying out or alteration of streets, drains, sewers, water supply pipe lines, bridges, cause ways and culverts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the levelling, paving, metalling, flagging, channelling, swearing, and draining of the said streets and provision therein of water, lighting, and other sanitary conveniences ordinarily provided in a municipality;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the raising, lowering, or levelling of any land in the area comprised in the scheme;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the formation, retention, enlargement and improvement of open spaces;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the augmentation of the present water supply or any other scheme for the improvement of water supply;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the making of a drainage and sewerage scheme including outfall works ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) the acquisition and reservation of sites for construction of educational institutions, health centres, hospitals, power houses and electric sub-stations, bus, taxi and rickshaw stands and bazaars; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         any other matter consistent with this Ordinance which the Authority may consider necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may approve a development scheme submitted to it under sub-section (1) with or without modifications.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Formulation and execution of development schemes of urgent public importance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14.
