Notwithstanding the provisions of sections 10 and 11, the Authority may, with the prior approval of the Government, formulate and execute development schemes of urgent public importance even before the preparation of the general development plan or preparation of functional master plans.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Publication of general development plan and functional master plans</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. When the Government approves the general development plan or a functional master plan it shall announce the fact by notification in the official Gazette and such notification shall be conclusive evidence that the plan has been duly made and approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of plan and scheme</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. A general development plan, a functional master plan or a development scheme prepared and approved under this Ordinance may be modified by the Authority at any time with the previous approval of the Government, and any such modification shall be published in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on preparation and execution of certain schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. No plan or development scheme shall be prepared or executed by any person, local authority or Government organisation or institution for the area to which this Ordinance extends or any part thereof except with the concurrence of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Execution of development schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) When the Government approves a development scheme it shall announce the fact by notification in the official Gazette, and the Authority shall forthwith proceed to execute the scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the Authority may require a local authority or Government organisation or institution within whose territorial jurisdiction any particular area covered by a development scheme lies to execute the scheme or any portion thereof, in consultation with the Authority; and the expenditure incurred on the execution of any such scheme or portion thereof shall be borne as may be agreed to between the Authority and the local authority or Government organisation or institution, or in the event of disagreement, as may be determined by the Government .</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer to Authority of buildings or land vested in a local Government body</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) whenever any building, or any street, or any land or square or any part thereof, which is vested in a local Government body is situated within the area covered by any development scheme and is required for the purpose of such scheme, the Authority shall give notice accordingly to the Chief Executive Officer of such local Government body and such building, street, square, land or part thereof shall thereupon vest in the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where any street or square or any part thereof, vests in the Authority under sub-section (1), no compensation shall be payable by the Authority to the local Government body concerned in respect of such street, square or part thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where any land or building, not being a street or square, vests in the Authority under sub-section (1), no compensation shall be payable by the Authority to the local Government body concerned in respect of such building or land, if such building or land is required for a purpose similar to the purpose for which it was acquired, held or used by the local Government body.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If any question or dispute arises in respect of any matter under this section, the matter shall be referred to the Government whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer to Authority of private street or square</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) Whenever any street or square or part thereof which is not vested in any local authority is required for executing any development scheme, the Authority shall cause to be affixed in a conspicuous place in or near such street, square or part thereof, a notice signed by the Chief Executive Officer stating the purpose for which the street, square or part thereof is required, and declaring that the Authority will, on or after a date to be specified in the notice, take over charge of such street, square or part thereof from the owner thereof; and shall simultaneously send a copy of such notice to the owner of such street, square or part thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) After considering and deciding objections, if any, received in writing before the date specified in the notice under sub-section (1), the Authority may take over charge of such street, square or part thereof from the owner thereof; and the same shall thereupon vest in the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) When the Authority closes or alters any street or square or part thereof which has vested in it under sub-section (2), it shall pay to the previous owner compensation at such rate and in such manner as may be prescribed for the loss of his rights therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If the closing or alteration of any such street or square or part thereof causes damage or substantial inconvenience to owners of property adjacent thereto, or to residents in the neighbourhood, the Authority shall forthwith provide some other reasonable means of access for the use of persons who were entitled to use such street, square, or part thereof as a means of access to any property or place; and if the provision of such means of access does not sufficiently compensate any such owner or resident for such damage or inconvenience, shall also pay him reasonable compensation in money.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer to Authority of any scheme or property of Government or local authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, the Government may, upon such terms and conditions as it may specify, transfer to the Authority any scheme sanctioned or undertaken by the Government or by any Government Organisation or institution in respect of any area to which this Ordinance extends and may also place at the disposal of the Authority any property, movable or immovable, connected with or ancillary or appurtenant to such scheme and any scheme so transferred shall be deemed to be a development scheme prepared and approved under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be lawful for the Authority to execute and maintain all works and carry out all unfinished works and operations required for the execution of any scheme transferred to it under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, the Government may, upon such terms and conditions as it may specify, place at the disposal of the Authority any property or fund held by the Government, or by any Government organisation or institution or local authority, or permit the Authority to collect and retain duties which, immediately before the establishment of the Authority, were leviable by the Government, Government organisation or institution or local authority , and thereupon the Authority shall hold such property or fund and collect such duties in accordance with such terms and conditions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, a local authority may, upon such terms and conditions as it may specify:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        transfer to the Authority any scheme, sanctioned or undertaken by such local authority, in respect of any area to which this Ordinance extends and place at the disposal of the Authority any property, movable or immovable, connected with or ancillary or appurtenant to such scheme and any scheme so transferred shall be deemed to be a development scheme prepared and approved under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        place at the disposal of the Authority any property or fund held by the local authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or terms and conditions of service, any person serving under the Government or any Government organisation or institution or any local authority in connection with any scheme transferred to the Authority under sub-section (1) or sub-section (4) shall serve under the Authority, if required by the Government to do so on such terms and conditions, not otherwise inconsistent with the service rules applicable to such person, as the Government or the Government organisation or institution or the local authority, as the case may be, may in consultation with the Authority, determine; and the person so serving under the Authority shall, except in the matter of dismissal, removal or reduction in rank, be subject to the power and control of the Authority in the same manner and to the same extent as any officer or employee appointed by the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">General powers of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) Subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, the Authority may adopt such measures and exercise such powers as may be necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, the Authority may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        enter into and perform all such contracts as it may consider necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) cause studies, surveys, experiments and technical researches to be made or contribute towards the cost of any such studies, surveys, experiments or technical researches made by any other person or agency at the request of the Authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        issue interim development orders for areas for which a development scheme is under preparation and restrict or prohibit, by general or special order, any use or change in the use of land and any alteration in buildings, structures and installations:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no order of restriction or prohibition under this clause shall be made for such period, not exceeding twelve months, as may be specified in the order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        seek and obtain advice and assistance for the preparation of any plan or development scheme or for the execution of any scheme from any local authority or Government organisation or institution, and the expenditure, if any, involved in giving such advice or assistance shall be borne by the Authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) co-ordinate the execution of development schemes; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) finance and supervise the execution of any development scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER IV</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">PREVENTION OF HAPHAZARD CONSTRUCTION OF BUILDINGS, EXCAVATION OF TANKS, ETC.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on constructions and excavation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any agreement, no person shall, without the previous sanction of the Authority, construct any building or excavate any tank within the area to which this Ordinance extends.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authorised Officer may, on an application made for the purpose in such manner and in such form and accompanied by such fee as may be prescribed, sanction the construction of a building or excavation of a tank subject to such conditions as the Authority may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If in the opinion of the Authorised Officer any of the conditions subject to which the sanction under sub-section (2) was granted has been contravened, he may cancel the sanction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall not apply to a case of normal repairs to an existing building.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal of buildings under construction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) The Authorised Officer may, by a notice served in the prescribed manner, direct the owner of a building or tank the construction or excavation of which is in progress on the date of commencement of this Ordinance, not to proceed with the work any more and to remove such construction or fill up such excavation within the period mentioned in the notice or within such further period as may be extended by the Authorised Officer, and the owner thereof shall, on payment to him of such compensation as the Authority may think fair and reasonable, remove the same within the period aforesaid.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall not apply to normal repairs to existing buildings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Eviction of occupier of buildings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) The Authorised Officer shall, simultaneously with the issue of a notice on the owner of a building under section 24, issue a notice upon the occupier thereof, if the occupier himself is not the owner, to vacate such building within the period mentioned therein or within such further period as may be extended by the Authorised Officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the occupier does not, in pursuance of a notice under sub-section (1), vacate the building within the aforesaid period, he shall, notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, be liable to be summarily evicted therefrom by the Authorised Officer; and the Authorised Officer may, in effecting such eviction use or cause to be used such force as may be deemed necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exemption of certain buildings and tanks</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) Nothing contained in sections 23 and 24 shall apply to any building or tank owned by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, on application made to it, exempt any building or tank from the operation of section 23 or section 24, subject to such conditions as it may think fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compensation not payable for unauthorised construction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, no owner of any land or building shall be entitled to any compensation on acquisition of such land or building under any law for the time being in force, if he had contravened the provisions of section 23, section 24, section 25 or section 29, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Paurashava not to sanction construction without approval of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Municipal Administration Ordinance, 1960 (Ord. X of 1960), or in any other law for the time being in force, no sanction for construction of any building or excavation of any tank within the area to which this Ordinance extends shall be accorded by the Paurashava or by any other local authority, unless such construction or excavation has been sanctioned by the Authorised Officer under sub-section (2) of section 22.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Whenever the Authorised Officer sanctions any construction or excavation, a copy of such sanction together with plans duly signed by him shall be sent to the Chairman of the Paurashava or of the local authority in whose area the site of the proposed construction or excavation is situated.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any sanction accorded in contravention of sub-section (1) shall be deemed to have been accorded without lawful authority and construction or excavation, if any, made or done on the strength of such sanction shall be deemed to be unauthorised.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) In the event of cancellation of a sanction under sub-section (3) of section 22, the validity of any sanction accorded by the Paurashava or by any local authority under sub-section (2) shall be deemed to have expired.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on filling up of low land</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any agreement, no person shall, without the previous permission of the Authority, fill up any low land or raise any land or otherwise obstruct the natural drainage within the area to which this Ordinance extends; and such permission shall be subject to such conditions as the Authority may think fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An application for permission under sub-section (1) shall be made in such manner and in such form and shall be accompanied by such fee as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The permission granted under sub-section (1) shall be liable to cancellation by the Authority for breach of any of the conditions under which such sanction was granted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar to jurisdiction of civil Court</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. Every order under sections 23, 24, 25 or 29, as the case may be, shall, subject to the provisions of section 31, be final and shall not be questioned in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. An appeal against an order under section 23, 24, 25 or 29, as the case may be, shall lie to the Commissioner if preferred within thirty days from the date of the order appealed against, and an appeal against an order of the Commissioner shall lie to the Government whose decision shall be final and shall not be questioned in any civil Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER V</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">ESTABLISHMENT</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Chief Executive Officer</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. (1) There shall be a Chief Executive Officer of the Authority who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chief Executive Officer shall be responsible for the day-to-day administration of the Authority and shall perform such functions as are assigned to him by this Ordinance or by rules made thereunder; and shall, in respect of performance of his functions, be responsible to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If the Chief Executive Officer is unable to perform the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, the Government may appoint another person to officiate as Chief Executive Officer in his place during the period he remains so unable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chief Executive Officer shall act as the secretary of the Authority and shall have the same right of being present at any meeting of the Authority or of any committee thereof and of taking part in the discussions thereat as if he were a member of the Authority or of such committee, and may, at any time with the consent of the person presiding at the meeting, make a statement or explanation of facts, but he shall not vote upon, or move any motion at such meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Chief Accounts Officer</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. (1) There shall be a Chief Accounts Officer of the Authority who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Chief Accounts Officer is unable to perform the functions of his office on account of absence, illness, or any other cause, the Government may appoint another person to officiate as Chief Accounts Officer in his place during the period he remains so unable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chief Accounts Officer shall perform such functions as may be assigned to him by this Ordinance or rules made thereunder, and shall, in respect of the performance of his functions, be responsible to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chief Accounts Officer shall act as the financial adviser of the Authority and shall have the same right of being present at any meeting of the Authority or of any committee thereof, and of taking part in the discussions thereat as if he were a member of the Authority or of such committee, and may, at any time with the consent of the person presiding at the meeting, make a statement or explanation of facts in matters where financial implications are involved, but he shall not vote upon, or move, any motion at such meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to appoint officers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. The Authority may, subject to such general or special order as the Government may give it from time to time, appoint such officers, advisers, consultants, and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The officers and other employees, etc to be public servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. All officers, advisers, consultants and other employees of the Authority shall, when acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any of the provisions of this Ordinance, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER VI</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">MAINTENANCE OF PUBLIC STREETS, DRAINS, ETC. VESTED IN THE AUTHORITY AND PAYMENT OF LOCAL RATES AND TAXES IN RESPECT OF BUILDINGS VESTED IN THE AUTHORITY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Maintenance of public streets, drains, etc vested in the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">36. All public streets, squares, buildings, lands or part thereof, vested in the Authority shall be maintained by the Authority itself or jointly by the Authority and any other local authority or agency under such arrangements made with the authority or agency concerned as the Authority may deem it necessary for proper upkeep and maintenance of such public streets, squares, buildings, lands or part thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Vesting in municipality of streets, drains, etc for maintenance after execution of development scheme</p><p style="text-align: justify;">37. (1) Whenever the Authority is satisfied that execution of a development scheme has been completed in accordance with the plans and specifications sanctioned by the Government, the Authority shall pass a resolution to that effect and shall call upon the Paurashava to take over and to maintain the streets, drains, sewers, parks and other services and facilities provided by the Authority as and from such date as may be fixed by the resolution.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Paurashava on being called upon to take over the streets, drains, sewers, parks and other services and facilities under sub-section (1) is satisfied that the development scheme has been executed in accordance with the plans and specifications sanctioned by the Government, it shall inform the Authority of its intention to take them over, and by written notice affixed in some conspicuous position within the area of the development scheme declare the streets, drains, sewers, parks and other services and facilities to be public streets, drains, sewers, parks and services and facilities, which shall thereupon vest in, and be maintained, kept in repair, lighted, cleansed, and watered by, the Paurashava.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If the Paurashava fails to comply with the resolution of the Authority under sub-section (1) or fails to inform the Authority within three months of the reasons for non-compliance with the resolution of the Authority under sub-section (1), the Authority shall pass a resolution in its meeting requesting the Commissioner to ask the Paurashava to take over the streets, drains, sewers, parks and services and facilities for maintenance from such date as may be fixed by the Commissioner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Commissioner, on being requested by the Authority, shall fix a date, and thereupon from such date so fixed by the Commissioner such streets, drains, sewers, parks and services and facilities shall be public streets, drains, sewers and services and facilities and shall vest in, and be maintained at the expense of, the Paurashava.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Commissioner may, if he deems it necessary, request the Paurashava to make a written statement in this regard for this consideration.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Commissioner may, before fixing a date under sub-section (4), may ask the Authority to complete such other work as he may consider necessary for facilitating proper up-keep and maintenance, at reasonable cost, of the streets, drains, sewers, parks and services and facilities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Payment of municipal tax for buildings vested in the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">38. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Municipal Administration Ordinance, 1960 (Ord. X of 1960), or any other law for the time being in force, no municipal tax or rate or charges shall be levied or be payable for any building acquired or requisitioned in connection with the execution of any development scheme and vested in the Authority, provided such building is vacant and not used for any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where such building is used for office accommodation of the field staff of the Authority engaged in the execution of the development scheme in connection with which the building was acquired , no holding tax shall be levied by the Paurashava, but other rates and charges for services provided by the Paurashava shall be payable at the usual rate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where such building is used for a purpose other than that for which it was acquired or requisitioned or let out, municipal holding tax and other rates and charge shall be payable in respect of such building at the usual rate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER VII</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">FINANCE</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Authority Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">39. (1) There shall be a fund to be known as the Rajshahi Town Development Authority Fund, hereinafter referred to as the Fund, which shall vest in the Authority and shall be utilised by the Authority to meet charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance, including the payment of salaries, other remuneration and fees to the Chairman, members, officers, advisers, consultants and other staff and employees of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Fund shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        grants made by local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) loans raised by the Authority with the special or general sanction of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) foreign aid and loans obtained from any source outside Bangladesh, with the previous sanction of the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) all other sums received by the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowing Power</p><p style="text-align: justify;">40. The Authority may, with the previous sanction of the Government, borrow money for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance or for servicing any loan obtained by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">41. The Authority shall maintain its accounts in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">42. The Authority shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a statement, to be called the annual budget statement, in the prescribed form for every financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">43. (1) The Accounts of the Authority shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh, hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor –Gener                      </p></div></div>
593	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE REGULATION OF SALARY OF EMPLOYEES LAWS REPEAL ORDINANCE, 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE REGULATION OF SALARY OF EMPLOYEES LAWS REPEAL ORDINANCE, 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLII OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[31st August, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal certain laws relating to regulation of salary of Government and certain other employees.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal certain laws relating to regulation of salary of Government and certain other employees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Regulation of Salary of Employees Laws Repeal Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) The Bangladesh Nationalised Organisations (Regulation of Salary of Employees) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 54 of 1972), and the Bangladesh Government and Semi-Autonomous Organisations (Regulation of Salary of Employees) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 79 of 1972), hereinafter referred to as the said Orders, shall stand repealed on such date, and to such extent or in relation to such matters, services or posts, as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct; and such direction may be so given as to have retrospective effect from a date not earlier than the first day of July, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The repeal of the said Orders under sub-section (1) shall not have the effect of giving or restoring any right to any salary or other emoluments or any arrears thereof which any employee would have been entitled to receive had not the said Orders been in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
594	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE RURAL ELECTRIFICATION BOARD ORDINANCE, 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE RURAL ELECTRIFICATION BOARD ORDINANCE, 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LI OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[31st October, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Rural Electrification Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Board for rural electrification in Bangladesh and taking measures for effective use of electrical power for development of the rural economy of the country;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Rural Electrification Board Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Rural Electrification Board established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “member” means a member of the Board and includes the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (e) “rural area” means an area which is not included within a municipality and includes such a municipality or an area within a municipality as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify in this behalf;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “Samity” means a Palli Bidyut Samity formed under this Ordinance and registered with the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Board to be called the Rural Electrification Board for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head Office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The head office of the Board shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may establish offices at such other places as it deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) 2[ four] whole-time members to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) one part-time member to represent the Bangladesh Power Development Board to be nominated by that Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) one part-time member to represent the Bangladesh Agricultural Development Corporation to be nominated by that Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) one part-time member to represent the Small and Cottage Industries Corporation to be nominated by that Corporation; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) one part-time member to represent the Integrated Rural Development Programme to be nominated by the Local Government, Rural Development and Co-operatives Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other members shall hold office on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of Chairman and other members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Chairman shall be a whole-time officer and the chief executive of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other members shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or as may be assigned to them by the Board from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until rules are made in this behalf the meetings of the Board shall be held as and when convened by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum of a meeting of the Board, not less than three members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in the case of equality of votes the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman or, in his absence, by a whole-time member authorised in writing by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to establish electricity generation, transmission, transformation and distribution systems in the rural areas of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to take measures for effective use of electricity to foster rural development with special emphasis on increase of use of electric power for economic pursuits, such as development of agriculture and establishment of rural industries and assisting the disadvantaged sections of the community for augmenting their income and standard of living;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to determine, with the approval of the Government, the criteria for rural electrification and associated works to ensure optimum use of resources and maximum socio-economic benefits;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to conduct surveys and feasibility studies and prepare schemes for establishment of electrical systems in the rural areas and to provide for prompt utilisation of electrical power for socio-economic benefits to the community;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to submit reports and schemes to the Government for approval and to execute the approved schemes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to take over from the Bangladesh Power Development Board and other organisations electric systems together with the assets and liabilities relating thereto and arrange for their management;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to organise the prospective consumers of electricity into formal and informal groups, such as Palli Bidyut Samities, electric and other co-operatives, societies, associations and companies for the purpose of execution and management of schemes and providing related services;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to prescribe by-laws for the Samities and other groups for their registration with the Board and determining the manner of their functioning;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to receive grants and raise loans from the Government and other bodies and individuals for creating funds for the purpose of carrying out its business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to advance funds, on such terms and conditions as it may determine, to any Samity or other group for the execution of approved schemes, operation and management of works and services and providing loans to their members for the purpose of obtaining electric connections and equipping them for productive utilisation of electrical power;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to hand over to any Samity or other group completed schemes for operation and management on such terms and conditions as it may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to organise effective programme for preparation, execution, operation, and management of rural electrification programmes and related works;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) to prescribe standards for work, equipment, operation, maintenance, procurement and warehousing personnel and fiscal administration and other aspects of management to be followed by the Board as well as by the Samities and other groups registered by it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) to prescribe relending terms for the Samities and other groups borrowing funds from the Board and prescribe regulations for project appraisal and credit administration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) to cooperate with agencies of the Government, interested non-government bodies as well as local administration and local authorities in rural development works and to take initiative for promotion of setting up of rural industries, boosting irrigation and drainage and augmenting commercial and domestic use of electricity;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) to enter into any business, including manufacture of electric equipment, and to enter into any contract and arrangements with others for efficient discharge of its functions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q) to conduct research and evaluation to adjudge the effectiveness of its programmes as well as those of others in the relevant fields;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r) to take such other measures and exercise such other powers as it considers necessary or expedient for carrying out its functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provisions regarding power supply</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Notwithstanding anything contained 3[ in this Ordinance or] in any other law for the time being in force, the Board-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) may, on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government, take over any electric power distribution system 4[ including one in a municipality] and operate it or make it over to any Samity for its operation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) may prescribe standards for the operation and maintenance of distribution system made over to the Samities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) shall receive supply of electricity from the Bangladesh Power Development Board 5[ and any power generating station run by any person or entity under a contract with the Government] at such rates and on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) shall approve the rate of electricity to be levied by the Samities and other groups for sale of electric power to their members and in doing so shall see that the rate enables the Samities and other groups at least to recover costs of financing, operation and maintenance and depreciation of assets.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Special provision regarding operation, etc, of certain electricity system</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ 9A. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance or in any other law for the time being in force, where any rural area is included in a municipality after the establishment therein of electricity generation, transmission, transformation and distribution systems by the Board, the systems so established shall continue to be operated, maintained and managed by the Board, as if the area had not been included in the Municipality.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board to be licensee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Board shall, for the purpose of Electricity Act, 1910 (IX of 1910), be deemed to be licensee and shall have all the powers and discharge all the obligations of a licensee under that Act:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in sections 3 to 11, sub-sections (2) and (3) of section 21 and sections 22, 23 and 27 or in clauses I to XII of the Schedule to the said Act relating to the duties and obligations of a licensee shall apply to the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Board may appoint such officers and other employees and engage such consultants, advisors, auditors and contractors as it may consider necessary for the performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no post shall be created by the Board without the prior approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may appoint officers and other employees on deputation from other organisations and may also depute its own officers and employees to other organisations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recovery of dues</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Any sum due to the Board or the Samities from any person under this Ordinance shall be recoverable as a public demand.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) There shall be formed a Fund to be known as the Rural Electrification Board Fund which shall vest in the Board and shall be utilised by the Board to meet the charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance, including the payment of salaries and other remunerations to the Chairman, members, officers and other employees of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To the credit of the Rural Electrification Board Fund shall be placed-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) grants made by local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) grants and loans obtained from any source outside Bangladesh with the sanction of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) sale-proceeds of electricity; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) all other sums received by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowing power</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, borrow money for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance or for servicing any loan obtained by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Board shall, by such date before the commencement of every financial year as the Government may direct, submit to the Government for approval a budget, in such form as the Government may specify, for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit and Accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Board shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as the Government may specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General), in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (2) the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Board and may examine the Chairman or any member, officer or employee of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Auditor-General shall, as soon as possible after completion of the audit, send to the Board his audit report and the Board shall forward it, with its comments thereon, to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Board shall take steps forthwith to remedy the defects or irregularities pointed out in the audit report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Board shall submit to the Government, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, a report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall submit to the Government at such times and at such interval as the Government may specify-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) such returns, accounts, statements, estimates and statistics as may be required by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) information and comments asked for by the Government on any specific subject;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) copies of documents required by the Government for examination or any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of Entry</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Chairman or any member, or any other person authorised by the Chairman in this behalf, may, with or without assistants or workmen, enter into or upon any land in order-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to make any inspection, survey, experiment, valuation or inquiry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to dig or bore into the sub-soil;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to set out boundaries and intended lines or work;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to mark such boundaries and lines by placing marks and cutting trenches; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to do any other thing,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">whenever it is necessary to do so for any of the purposes of this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such entry shall be made without giving the occupier of the land at least twenty-four hours' notice of the intention to make such entry.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When any person enters upon any land in pursuance of sub-section (1) he shall, at the time of entering or as soon thereafter as may be practicable, pay or tender payment for all necessary damage to be done, and in case of dispute as to the sufficiency of the amount so paid or tendered refer the matter to the Deputy Commissioner whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to place underground and overhead structure</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Board may place underground cable and pipes and overhead structures, such as poles, wires, brackets, stays, apparatus and appliances, for transmission and distribution of electricity as well as for telegraphic, telephonic, carrier and radio communications necessary for the proper execution of its schemes and performing other functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compulsory acquisition of land for the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. Any land required by the Board for carrying out its functions under this Ordinance shall be deemed to be needed for a public purpose and such land may be requisitioned or acquired for the Board by the Government or the Deputy Commissioner, as the case may be, in accordance with any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. The Board may, by general or special order, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman or by such member or officer of the Board as may be specified therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to issue directions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Government may, from time to time, issue directions to the Board to take such measures as it considers necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance; and the Board shall comply with all such directions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Board, the Chairman or any member, officer or employee of the Board for anything done or intended to be done in good faith under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board, etc, not to be construed as shop, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ 23A. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, the Board or a Samity shall not be construed as a “shop”, “commercial establishment”, “factory” or “industry” within the meaning of the Shops and Establishments Act, 1965 (E.P. Act VII of 1965), the Factories Act, 1965 (E.P. Act IV of 1965), or the Industrial Relations Ordinance, 1969 (XXIII of 1969). ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. No provision of law relating to the winding up of bodies corporate shall apply to the Board, and the Board shall not be wound up except by order of the Government and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Board may, with the approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters not rendered to be provided for by rules and for which provision is necessary or expedient for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (e) was substituted by section 2 of the Rural Electrification Board (Amendment) Act, 2002 (Act No. XXII of 2002)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “four” was substituted for the word “three” by section 2 of the Rural Electrification Board (Second Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XXVII of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “in this Ordinance or” were inserted by section 2 of the Rural Electrification Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “including one in a municipality” were inserted by section 2 of the Rural Electrification Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “and any power generating station run by any person or entity under a contract with the Government” were inserted by section 2 of the Rural Electrification Board (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XXVI of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Section 9A was inserted by section 3 of the Rural Electrification Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Section 23A was inserted by section 2 of the Rural Electrification Board (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XXIV of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
595	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE SEEDS ORDINANCE 1977</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE SEEDS ORDINANCE 1977</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXXIII OF 1977).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[19th July, 1977]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for regulating the quality of certain seeds for sale and for matters connected therewith.WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for regulating the quality of certain seeds for sale for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and the 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Seeds Ordinance, 1977.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “agriculture” means food and fibre crop production and includes horticulture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Board” means the National Seed Board constituted under sub-section (1) of section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Certification Agency” means a Seed Certification Agency established under section 8;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “container” means a box, bottle, tin, barrel, case, receptacle, sack, bag, wrapper or other thing in which any article or thing is placed or packed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “export” means taking out of Bangladesh to a place outside Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “import” means bringing into Bangladesh from a place outside Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “kind” means one or more related species or sub-species or crop plants each individually or collectively known by one common name, such as, cabbage, paddy and wheat;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “notified kind or variety”, in relation to any seed, means any kind or variety thereof notified under section 5;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (hh) “Non-notified kind or Variety” in relation to any Seed means any kind or variety not notified under section 5;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (j) “Seeds” means, except those used for drugs and narcotics, any of the following classes of seeds used for sowing or planting-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) seeds of food crops including edible oil seeds and seeds of fruits and vegetables;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) seeds of fibre crops;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) seeds of flower and ornamental plants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) seeds of forage crops;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">and includes seedlings, and tubers, bulbs, rhizomes, root cuttings, all types of grafts and other vegetatively propagated materials;]</p><p style="text-align:
